loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma's family is filled with talented artists who use their creativity to make beautiful paintings. When she was a little girl Normal learned to paint, and has continued to improve since. Thanks to her performance and dedication she has been able to sell her works outside of her neighborhood, and therefore has earned more money. For this reason she is asking you for a loan which with she will purchase material to use in the creation of her beautiful works of art. Your support will allow this diligent and talented mother to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Toda la familia de Norma da muestra de la elaboración de bellos trabajos y de la inmensa creatividad que poseen al elaborar sus bellos cuadros; ella desde niña aprendió esta labor y sus cualidades le han dado la posibilidad de mejorarlos.Gracias a su desempeño y dedicación pueden ofrecer sus productos fuera de su zona de residencia y en ellos obtener mayores ganancias, debido a esa razón en esta oportunidad recurren a vosotros para solicitarte un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus bellos trabajos.Nuestro aporte permitirá cristalizar los deseos de esta diligente y talentosa madre.

loans.use: Purchase art supplies.

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ms Rocío del Pilar sells clothes and is a hard working mother who wants to move forward in this business. She wants to pay for all of her two sons' needs through her business and they are her reason for working on. Her partner Alfredo, an independent worker (a trader) is very supportive of her and is in charge of purchasing the products she needs to then sell on.

Rocío del Pilar wants to keep growing her business and so has decided to increase the number of products in her range and to rent a space for her clothes store. In order to achieve her objectives she asks for your help, for the loan that you can offer. Rocío is a good payer who pays very punctually and promises to continue to do so for those who support her work.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rocío del Pilar se dedica a al venta de ropa, es una madre trabajadora que quiere salir adelante en este negocio y desde luego por medio del mismo dar lo necesario a sus dos hijos quienes estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Ella tiene a su pareja, Alfredo, trabajador independiente (comerciante) que la apoya mucho, él es el encargado de comprar la mercadería que ella necesita para después venderla. Rocío del Pilar quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por eso que decidió implementar más productos y alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa. Para lograr ese objetivo solicita tu ayuda, el préstamo económico que le puedas brindar, Rocío es buena pagadora, muy puntual y así promete cumplir con quien apoye su trabajo.

loans.use: To add more products to her range and rent a space for her clothes store

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is divorced and raises her two kids alone. She runs a small business selling men's outerwear in the central city market. Svitlana has been in this trade for 12 years. Presently, she has about $6000 invested in inventory. Her income is about $1300. 

Svitlana's diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and helps maintain her loyal clientele. Svitlana would like to receive a loan for 5000 Grivnas to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of high-quality, durable, and comfortable outerwear. It will help Svitlana's business grow, especially for the upcoming fall season.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Кенжаева Хосият жительница района Вахш. Возраст 51 год,замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование средние. Клиентка на протяжении 15 лет занимается выращиванием  пшеницы. Собрав урожай  она делает запас на год,а остатки реализует на местном рынке. Сельское хозяйство является  основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как готовый хлеб на рынке стоит очень дорого. В данный момент Хосият хочет закупить качественные семеня пшеницы и ГСМ.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Hosiyat K. lives in Vakhsh. She is 51, married, and has four children. She has a high school education. The client has, for the past fifteen years, cultivated wheat. After harvest, she stores a year’s worth and takes the rest to market. Agriculture is the fundamental source of income for this big family since baked bread is very expensive at the market. Currently, Hosiyat wants to buy high-quality wheat seed and petroleum products (gasoline and motor oil). She plans to pay off the loan in twelve 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying high-quality wheat seed and petroleum products

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=36098&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta. Jesusa es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años, Jesusa viaja a dos ferias de la región, los días martes a la feria de Acocro que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los días sábados a Ccejelambras, en donde compra cereales diversos, luego de acopiarlo lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los demás días Jesusa se dedica a la atención de sus hijos y en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales en harinas que reparte a las tiendas.

Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba, cebada, maíz. Jesusa sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=36098&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Jesusa is a member of La Kantuta Community Bank.

Jesusa lives with her partner, is 31 years old and has two children who are 9 and 5 years old. Jesusa travels to two regional fairs: on Tuesdays to the Acocro fair that is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho and on Saturdays to Ccejelambras, where she buys different grains. After collecting them, she sells them in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. On other days, Jesusa dedicates her attention to her children and, on some occasions, processes the grains into flour which she distributes to stores.

Jesusa needs a loan of 1,600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, beans, barley and corn. Jesusa dreams of purchasing land to build a house on, providing a good education to her children and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jesusa needs a loan of 1,600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, beans, barley and corn.

loans.name: Salamot

texts.en: Salamot, 34 years old and married with three children, buys CD and DVD discs from Alaba International Market to rent out to her shop customers.  An LAPO client, she is requesting a loan to buy more discs to rent. Salamot says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more DVD and CD discs for renting

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Mrs. Yeth P., 49, has three children, one of whom is a palm juice collector, another one earns income plowing fields for other farmers, while the third one still attends school. Mrs. Yeth P. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ean Eng, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. They currently need a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the productivity of the plantation.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Shah Mohammad

texts.en:
Shah Mohammad is the son of R.. He lives in District 8, Kabul, Afghanistan His house is near the 500 Family High School. It is a popular school in the area. Shah Mohammad is 40 years old, married, having three children.

Shah Mohammad has a general store in which he sells different kinds of materials. He needs a loan to expand his business and have more success. He requests an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans (USD$1075) for a term of 12 months. With this loan, he wants to enlarge his shop and complete his inventory, so he may support his family better.

Shah Mohammad is very happy that this loan process is available in Afghanistan and he thanks all lenders.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and complete his inventory.

loans.name: Molika

texts.fr: B. Molika  est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle achète et revend depuis un certain temps en gros et détail des sacs de charbon à Lomé la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter de nouveaux  sacs  de charbon, afin d’augmenter la taille de son commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge  des besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Molika B. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two. For some time now, she has been buying and selling charcoal at the wholesale and retail levels in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She would like to use this loan to buy new sacks of charcoal to expand her commerce and to meet the needs of her customers. The profits derived from her work will enable her to be responsive to her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Oyeyemi

texts.en:
Oyeyemi Arowosegbe is 70 years old and married with six children. He sells building materials in wholesale and retail. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more building materials to sell.

Oyeyemi says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana trabaja en una clínica reconocida de la ciudad como enfermera con una antigüedad de 8 años, su esposo el señor Francisco labora como albañil independiente desde hace 7 años, ellos son una familia muy trabajadora y están solicitando este crédito para la colocación del vitropiso en su vivienda, el cónyuge se hará cargo de la colocación ya que el se dedica a este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Juana S. G. has worked as a nurse for 8 years in a well-known clinic in the city. Her husband Francisco has worked as an independent builder for 7 years. Their family is very hardworking and they are requesting this loan to buy ceramic floor tiles for their home. Francisco will install the ceramic floor tiles as he often works on this type of project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of ceramic floor tiles

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline W. is 37 years old and is married to a medical doctor. She has four children who go to school. Jackline currently dispenses drugs and is requesting a loan to build a pharmacy. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: Build a pharmacy

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.en:
Nadejda is a very hardworking woman because she loves her work. In childhood she went through many difficult moments, so now it is much easier for her to perceive things and to survive. She has three children that she must care for.

Nadejda has a small business in the central market of the town of Edinet where she sells women’s clothing. She rents a market table from a friend, to whom she pays a monthly rent. Sales have fallen in some recent months and so, at the moment, she has money only for payment of the monthly rent. Now she still needs to increase her stock of goods.

Thus, Nadejda will pay the monthly payment to her friend and, of course, have the profit she needs to support her children.

loans.use: To increase stock of women's clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has had a tractor for 13 years. He is a 31-year old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. With his tractor, he transports cars, furniture, and lots more. Ali is willing to help clients from his region with his big tractor. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his work. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to improve his family’s income.

Ali has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. He is requesting a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his tractor. His previous loan helped him improve his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on a tractor

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna A., 42, is a married mother of two children and is a resident of Pigsag-an Cagayan de Oro City. She is engaged in food-snack vending business. She peddles food and snacks in her village. She also lends small amounts of money with 10-15% interest to her established customers. She is happy because although the money lent is small, it helps her co-villagers during emergencies. She wants to pursue her food-vending business and requires additional capital; therefore she is applying to HSPFI for her third loan of PHP 11,000.

loans.use: additional capital for her food-snack business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 09. Đông Sơn (10.13.09) Group

texts.en:
Châm Lê Thị (251) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Đông Sơn.  Châm is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09. Đông Sơn (10.13.09).

Châm is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Châm owns and operates a general store selling mostly daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community.  Châm has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

Châm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Châm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting her second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, in the amount of 1.626.900 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  Châm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Lê Thị Gấm (241) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.
2.  B. Thị M. Thư (240) is a 32 year-old female requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business running a general store.
3.  Lê Thị Hiền (236) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
4.  Đỗ Thị Gái (237) is a 55 year-old female requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the town of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Marites is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es: Rubén tiene 47 años, vive con sus 3 hijos, es padre soltero, lo cual no le impide seguir adelante en busca de progreso. Es propietario de 2 motocarros, los mismos que son manejados por chóferes particulares, con estos vehículos se dedican al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años atrás. Adicionalmente Rubén tiene un taller de mecánica y venta de lubricantes que es administrado y atendido por él mismo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con varias personas y le brinda una buena atención para que sean sus clientes regulares. Ambos negocios los considera rentables porque le generan buenos ingresos económicos, los cuales administra correctamente para solventar sus gastos y mantener estable su taller. Para más adelante, Rubén quiere comprar otro motocarro para aumentar sus ganancias en este rubro del transporte. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes son amigos y muestran su solidaridad ante cualquier circunstancia adversa. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando lo usará en la reparación de uno de sus motocarros, como también comprara lubricantes y repuestos para incrementar la mercadería y accesorios de su  taller.
texts.en:
Rubén, 47, lives with his three children. He is a single father, which does not stop him from going forward to seek progress. He owns two “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized cart), which are driven by other drivers. For six years he has worked in passenger transportation using these vehicles. He also has a mechanic’s shop. He sells oil. He runs the business and works in it. What he likes about the business is interacting with different people. He provides them with good attention so that they become regular customers. He considers both businesses to be profitable because they generate good income. He uses the income well in order to pay his expenses and keep his shop stable. In the future, Rubén wants to buy another motocarro to increase his earnings from this form of transportation. This is his third loan with MFP. What he likes about working with his community bank is that all of the members are friends, and they demonstrate unity in the face of any adverse circumstance. He will use the money he is now asking for to repair one of his motocars. He will also buy oil and replacement parts to increase his merchandise and the accessories in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his "motocarros"

loans.name: Ajpop Group

texts.es: El grupo Ajpop de la comunidad de Pacoxom, del Municipio de Nahualà departamento de Sololà acudieron a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para poder apoyar a estas señoras trabajadoras y ella pidieron un prestamo grupal, ya que ellas expusieron su situaciòn, precaria de sus economia ya que en otros bancos no les ayudan por ser personas de escasos recuersos porque tiene casas sencillas, y Ellas quieren salir abante ya que ven la necesidad de vender màs  pero no poseen suficiente  capital lo que se requiere en la inversiòn de compra de ropa y venderlos porteriormente, para sostenimiento de ellas mismas y de sus hijos y asi tener una mejor vida y poder superar esa crisis financiera y poder tener un nivel de vida mejor;porque en esa àrea de Nahualà el nivel de pobleza es demasiado alta y pàrsonas buscan la manera de sobre salir.
texts.en:
The Ajpop group of Pacoxom community, Municipality of Nahualà, Sololà Department attended the ASDIR Association to support these female workers and asked for a group loan. They presented them with their precarious economic situation because other banks do not help them because they are poor people with simple houses. They want to emerge as they see the need to sell more but do not have enough capital required to purchase and sell clothing. They want to sustain themselves and their children, overcome this financial crisis and have a better standard of living because in Nahualà the poverty level is too high and people are looking for a way out.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implementation of Capital

loans.name: Felipa Consuelo

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Felipa Consuelo R. dedica su tiempo a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías tales como peines, colas, aros, entre otros productos. Es de importancia destacar que la señora Felipa es una excelente trabajadora y ha llevado el sustento a su hogar por medio de su negocio.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías y de esta forma continuar en el negocio logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de bisuterías

loans.name: Deob

texts.en: Deob L. is a low-income people living in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province, about over 200 km from Phnom Penh Capital, along the street 6. She owns small family house and resides with other family members. Since 2006, she absorbed a basic skill of handicraft making from her nearby neighbor and she employs a skill that she learned to earn a living. She also produces rattan cupboard from her home and she will sell out to her buyers every month when she saves up over 20 sets of rattan. In addition, her husband always buys more wooden furniture from other people and resells to gain extra income. This humble couple has six children; most of whom helps with them in making cupboard. Deob L. will be used her loan to purchase a motorcycle which she uses to supply her investment and to reduce her family’s transportation cost.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 44-year-old divorced man who lives in Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Sami has been working as a car repairer. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car oil and new tools for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Sami is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. Sami decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase car oil and new tools for his garage.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn K. lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer noodle maker. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Pith, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and do the plowing. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Hoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are drivers while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and for plowing.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed S.. Mohamed was born in Magbass village about seven miles from Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One of his children is in class III and the other is in class II. The last is not yet of school age. 

Mohamed owns a video center and a call center where he makes both local and international calls for customers, recharges their mobile phones for a fee of SLL 1,000 and sell top-up cards. Mohamed wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy a generator, and a television and to invest in his wife’s business.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a TV and invest in his wife's business

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a very strong lady and is the bread winner for her family. She is married with five children (three girls and two boys), and her husband is unemployed. 

Isabella was a farmer before she ventured into the cereal business. She has been in this business for 23 years now, and wants to expand in order to be able to meet her huge financial obligations. She wants to borrow KES 50,000 to increase her inventory of cereals. She operates in a market where she has rented a stand. Her major challenge is that she operates alone, and it's tough. 

Her dream is to see her kids get the best education. Five years from now, she wants to run a wholesale store. She describes herself as a hardworking person.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Fatayi

texts.en: G. sells beef at retail prices in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is 35 years old and married with two children. He sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on his table to feed his children. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profits during this season. G. is asking for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more beef to sell. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Despertar está formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, fue bautizada y fundada Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca por los conquistadores españoles, caracterizándose por los cuatro ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico, su temperatura oscila entre 14 º a 18 º, siendo su gente muy cálida, amable y de un carisma que entregan a propios y extraños, siendo un ejemplo nuestras socias.

La Sra. María P. es socia del banco comunal El Despertar, vive por el sector del Control Sur en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado un hijo que se encuentra de 6 años de edad, estudia en la escuela Ignacio Escandón, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una latonería (donde pintan, enderezan latas torcidas de un carro), no tiene casa propia.
María se dedica al que hacer de su hogar, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y tiene un gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de su bankito, con el préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos para su auto, su sueño es de tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Despertar Communal Bank is in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca was baptized Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca as it was founded by the Spanish conquistadors. It is characterized by its four rivers that bathe it, its historical center, and its temperatures ranging from 14° to 18°. Its people are very warm and likeable. They have a charisma which they share with their own and strangers. Our members are examples of this. María P. is a member of the El Despertar Communal Bank. She lives in the Control Sur area of the city of Cuenca. She is 31, married, and has a six year old son. He goes to the Ignacio Escandón School. Her husband works as an employee of a body shop (where they paint and fix car damage). She does not have her own house. María devotes herself to the household chores. She is in her third cycle, and she has a great friendship with all of her colleagues in her bank. She will use the loan to buy replacement parts for her car. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts for her car

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
N. Rustam is a 43-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Rustam has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Rustam gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. Rustam says that he works with only one aim in mind: to provide his children with a proper education.

Now, Rustam would like to expand his business and purchase three cows. For this purpose, he has applied for 5000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana B. de 59 años de edad, reside en Apopa. Vive junto a su esposo y una hija menor de edad. Feliciana posee una tortillería en la cual su hija le ayuda, repartiéndolas en las casas de sus clientes. Así mismo la señora Feliciana, vende huevos, golosinas y pan, de manera que pueda obtener algunas ganancias extras. Ella se destaca por ser una señora muy trabajadora y honrada, la cual sabe apreciar la oportunidad que tiene de poseer un negocio lo cual en la actualidad es muy difícil de sostener, sobre todo cuando la mayor cantidad de ganancias están siendo usadas para los gastos del hogar. Feliciana solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con la capacidad monetaria de poder comprar maíz al por mayor y de esta manera poder obtener la materia prima de su productos a precios más bajo, así mismo desea poder comprar otros productos perecederos para surtir la pequeña venta que posee.
texts.en:
Feliciana B., 59, lives with her husband and one daughter in Apopa. Feliciana is helped by her daughter in a tortilla business, they deliver to the homes of their clients. Also, señora Feliciana sells eggs, candies, and bread for extra profit. She stands out as an honest, hard-working woman who knows how to take advantage of the opportunity to have a business, which is difficult to maintain because she must spend most of the profits on household expenses. Feliciana is requesting a loan in order to purchase corn, the raw material for her products, at the lower wholesale price. She also would like to buy other household products in order to increase her small sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and other household products

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Shalom 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teolinda is the coordinator of her group, Shalom. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town in the east of the DR where the economy is based around agriculture. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Teolinda is excited to be receiving her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by purchasing pants and blouses by the dozen to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to invest in her home and her children. Her long-term dream is to see her children become professionals. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants

loans.name: Edwige Akouavi

texts.fr: L. Edwige Akouavi est née le 16 Octobre 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Edwige Akouavi s'est installée à Akadjamey dans la commune d'Abomey calavi. Mariée à GODONOU Périn, un militaire, Edwige Akouavi n'a pas encore d'enfant, mais a un enfant à charge. La famille vit ensemble à Akadjamey. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Edwige Akouavi n'a fait que l'école primaire. C'est une jardinière qui livre ses légumes aux revendeuses. Edwige Akouavi achète les graines et les engrais à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 5 ans que Edwige Akouavi mène cette activité, et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Edwige Akouavi a bien remboursé le premier crédit, et sollicite un deuxième crédit en vue de développer son jardin et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra d'avoir plus de revenu.
texts.en:
L. Edwige Akouavi was born on October 16, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. About ten years ago, she settled in Akadjamey, in the town of Abomey Calavi. Married to GODONOU Périn, a soldier, she still has no children, but she supports a child. The family lives together in Akadjamey. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Edwige Akouavi attended primary school only. She is a gardener who delivers her vegetables to retailers. She buys seeds and fertilizer at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for five years and has already had a loan from ALIDé. She repaid her first loan and is requesting a second one for developing her garden and satisfying her customers further. This will allow her to earn more income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 5 sacks of manure and 5 sacks of seeds

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. has been selling ladies' shoes and bags in Abura for some time now. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and she supports him with the general upkeep of the house. Naomi has received junior high education. Her loan will be used to buy more shoes and bags for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy land to put up a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and bags for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a committed micro-business entrepreneur and is married with three children. His firstborn is in third grade of secondary school and the last-born is 9 months old.

George runs a clothing business at Migosi Estate in Kisumu City where he stocks clothes for all genders. His clientele are mainly from the nearby settlements. He has been in this business for the last nine years while his wife, Leah, runs a grocery in the same estate.

George is a very enterprising man with a wide experience working as a vendor and is full of business ideas. He believes in client-friendly services and has always put this as a priority in his business.

This is George’s first loan from KADET. He hopes to use the money from the loan to purchase more clothes for sale and also to help his wife accumulate a good stock of groceries. Therefore, George is optimistic that he will get Kiva lenders to enable him to achieve his business targets.

George harbors a dream of scaling the heights in his business and to ultimately open a big clothes stall in the city centre. There, he believes he can get more clients than his current business location. He also plans to assist his wife in her grocery business. Together, they have a dream of becoming prime suppliers of fruits and vegetables in the city.

George also aspires to seeing his children get a good education because he feels that this is the best gift he can give them.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell and more groceries for his wife's business

loans.name: Mr. Chheun Chhil Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who make up this village bank loan, live in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. C. C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. He is a rice middleman and his wife, Mrs. Phorll Pou, is a pig breeder in her house. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand. Thus, Mr. C. C. decided to request a loan to buy more rice for re-selling. Through this activity, the couple supports five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factoR., and the others are enrolled in a local public school. 

All the members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more rice for re-selling

loans.name: Luz Carmelina

texts.es:
Luz C. de 50 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es soldador ellos tienen dos hijos de 22 y 17 años. 

Hace unos años atrás empezó a trabajar en el mercado Pedro Pablo Gómez (Lugar donde hay muchos puestos de comerciantes de alimentos) como vendedora de víveres. Pero por la frustrante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en víveres y vitrinas para los productos. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las desde las 06h00 am hasta las 22:00 pm todos los días. Vende bebidas, aceites, granos, dulces en su pequeña tienda. Uno de los factores contra en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, azúcar para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente y que su esposo pueda comprar maquinaria para su taller de soldadura.
texts.en:
Luz C. is 50 years old. She lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. Her house is concrete, and she has all of the basic services. Her husband is a welder. They have two children, ages 22 and 17. Several years ago she started working in the Pedro Pablo Gómez market (place where they are a lot of food stands) selling food. Due to the frustrating idea of having her own business, she decided to invest her few savings in food and display cases for her products. Now she works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. everyday. She sells drinks, oils, grains, and sweets in her small store. One of the negative factors in her business is the delinquency that exists in the area where she lives. She wants to use this loan to buy rice, oils, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants her business to increase and for her husband to be able to buy machinery for his welding shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Having five children, 38 years old Marilou D. O. doesn’t know anymore how will she budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping him maintain the rice field. She is currently preparing her farm for planting and needs help to be able improve their harvest and so is applying for a loan of Php 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and married with eight children aged from 12 to 32 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Mary is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been farming for twenty-five years and has only one employee. Her main produce consists of maize, beans, avocados, passion fruit and sugarcane which she sells to the local market. She also sells dairy cows to the local market and earns income from a tailoring shop she owns in the area.

Mary is one of the many active clients in Juhudi Kilimo, having recently completed her fifth loan of KES 50,000. She has requested this new loan from Juhudi for KES 80,000 to purchase a tractor. This tractor will help her in her farming activities.

Mary’s biggest challenge in farming came when she started to practice dairy farming since she did not have the know-how to keep dairy animals. But now, everything seems okay. In future she would like to purchase a van for transporting milk.

Mary says her previous loans have helped her to educate her children and give them a better life. She says Juhudi Kilimo has helped raise her from poverty, since much of her assets has been acquired through it.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj A., a 38-year-old single mother with two daughters, lives in Baku city where she has been selling personal products for five years. Her shop is 15 sq. meters, and she buys her goods at discount prices at Bine Trade Centre.  Although her current income sustains her and her daughters, it is not enough to buy more than basic necessities. With her loan of 2000 AZN, Sevindj would like to buy more merchandise and eventually expand her business and hire an employee so that she can spend more time with her children.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan B. is from the village of New Compostela, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Susan is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Susan is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y una de sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la costura, donde confecciona mandiles para amas de casa, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su maquina de coser, de esta manera trabaja en el taller de costura que tiene en su misma casa. Mientras que su hermana la ayuda en la comercialización de mandiles, llevándolos a distintos lugares y ciudades aledañas de su zona. Su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias, y esto gracias a las arduas horas de trabajo que realizó. en adelante desea implementar su negocio con nuevas maquinas de coser y otras herramientas que necesita para su taller de costura. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos por fardos y conos, de esta manera tendrá buen abastecimiento de su materia prima y mayores márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and one of her two children. For more than ten years she has worked as a seamstress, making aprons used by housewives. Her main piece of equipment that she uses for work is her sewing machine. She has a sewing workshop inside of her home. Even though her sister helps her with selling aprons, Antonia must travel to different places and neighboring cities. Her business generates good earnings, thanks to the long hours of work she has performed. Moving forward she wants to buy new sewing machines for her business and other equipment that she needs to keep her sewing workshop operating.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Antonia is very happy to know that she has financial backing, which is why she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of bales of fabric and cones of thread so that she can have a good stock of materials and obtain higher profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Yolidia Esther

texts.es:
Yolidia tiene 27 años de edad, trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 9 años en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera de una niña de 8 añitos de edad la cual estudia su tercer grado de primaria en la misma escuela donde ella labora.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construccion  para asi poco a poco ir construyendo una cocina que mucha falta le hace, pues actualmente la tiene en la sala.  

Yolidia es una mujer muy responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente ella està cursando su quinto año en la Universidad en la carrera de Psicologia Clinica en la Universidad Martin Lutero, su mayor sueños en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que su hija estudie para que en el futuro sea persona de bien.
texts.en:
Yolidia is 27 years old and has worked for 9 years as a primary school teacher in zone # 5 of Nueva Guinea. She is the single mother of an 8-year-old daughter, who is now in the third grade at the same school where Yolidia works. She is requesting refinancing of her 7th loan, with the aim of buying construction materials so she can gradually build a kitchen, which her household needs badly, since they are currently cooking in the living room. Yolidia is a very responsible, honest and hard-working woman. She is currently in her fifth year at the university, studying Clinical Psychology at the Martin Luther University. Her greatest dreams in life are to have a stable job situation and to see her daughter attend the university so she can be successful when she grows up.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for a kitchen

loans.name: Khursheed Begum's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed begum has six children - three sons and three daughters - and lives Multan, a historic city in Pakistan. She makes a living embroidering clothing for people living in her neighborhood.  
None of her three sons were able to complete their education, as they had to start working to help their family. They all do different kinds of jobs to earn income: the eldest son has a brick-selling business; the middle one does embroidery; and the youngest one has a job in the private sector. Khursheed’s husband works for a Municipal Corporation; however, his income is not sufficient for supporting the family. Therefore, Khursheed, with the help of a loan from Asasah, started the embroidery business to share the financial burden with her husband. Over the past few years, Khurseed has borrowed from Asasah three times and has maintained a good credit record every year.
Now, Khurseed has applied for a new loan from Asasah, which will be her fourth one, and which she will use to expand her embroidery business by buying additional embroidery materials, such as beads, cloth, colored thread, and sketches. She hopes that the expansion will help her increase the business profits and, in turn, allow her to provide sufficient dowry for her elder daughter, who is nearing marriage age.

loans.use: Purchase of embroidery material in bulk to expand embroidery business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 42 years old. Carmelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years. Her husband is a farmer and she also helps him sell his harvest to the market.

Carmelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
This is Lucy C., 38, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Andres C., a company driver, and is the mother of three children. One of her children is already working while one is enrolled in high school and the youngest is still in elementary school. At this time, Lucy is working hard to send her two younger children all the way through college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Lucy, who herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Lucy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lucy earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale price and selling at piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lucy dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Халимов Мухамади проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно – рогатого скота, то есть он хочет купить два бычка и увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Muhamadi H. lives in the Yavan region. He is 30 years old. He is married and has three children, he has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry breeding cattle at home. He mainly feeds and sells cattle. He has been doing this business for twenty years now. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle, meaning that he wants to buy two calves and increase their number.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame   Sanata T. a plus de 27 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs  enfants (1garçon et 2 filles) à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Sanata T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des friperies il y a environ dix années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis quinze années. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.  
Après une pose, elle sollicite ainsi un troisième prêt lui permettant d’acheter, 3 balles de friperie de qualités différentes (T-Shirt, pantalons, chemises, napperons, serviettes, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sanata T. is over 27 years old. She lives with her husband and their children (a boy and two girls) in Wayerma II, a popular neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

After attempting several activities without success, Mrs. T. started buying and selling used clothing about ten years ago. She works at the big market of Sikasso, where she is in high demand by her customers due to the quality of her merchandise.

To meet the needs of a steadily increasing customer base, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution 15 years ago. Having previously obtained three group loans as a member of a women’s association in her neighborhood, she eventually started applying for individual loans.

After a break, she is now seeking her third loan to buy three bales of used clothing (T-shirts, pants, shirts, placemats, napkins, etc.) of various grades. She buys her stocks on location from wholesalers, and then resells the merchandise at retail.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA,which will be used primarily to cover family expenses and pay the interest on the loan, with the remainder to be invested in her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
la sra. Carolina A. se dedica a la vanta de ropa en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, Carolina distribuye ropa en su aldea y en otras aldeas cercanas a su comunidad.
su esposo es agricultor y juntos se ayudan mutuamente para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Carolina es una persona muy honrada y trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijos,
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y asi tener mas ventas. las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina A. works selling clothing in general, a business she has had for six years. Carolina distributes clothing in her own neighborhood and in neighboring areas of her community. 

Her husband is a farmer and together they help each other in order to cover the household expenses. 

Carolina is a highly honorable person and works very hard to put her children ahead. 

She will use the loan to purchase clothing and thus make more sales. She requires the earnings to get her children ahead.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es: Juan Felipe tiene 44 años su actividad es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 18 años que tiene su negocio. Tiene 1 hijo de 18 años a su cargo, Juan tiene ubicado su negocio en el mercado, en donde todos los días tiene que llegar a vender sus productos que ofrece arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, concentrado entre otros. El se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, Juan se va tarde para lograr obtener más ganancias. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio.
texts.en: Juan Felipe is 44 years old, and has a business selling staple grains.  He has had this business for more than 18 years.  He has a son who is 18 who he supports.  Juan's business is located in the market where he sells his products every day, including rice, beans, cooking oil, corn extract and other items.  He gets up early and works from 7am until 9 at night.  Juan works late so that he can get higher earnings.  The loan he requests is to buy supplies for his business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Toktobubu Japarova's Group

texts.en: Toktobubu J. is married to a farmer. She is 44 and together with her spouse she gives upbringing to three daughters, all of them schoolgirls. As average villagers, the family makes money by keeping poultry. All the family members are engaged in this business and all of them are interested in increasing the family budget. One of the Tortobubu’s main wishes concerns the improvement of her family's welfare. She hopes to make it come true by developing her business and for this reason she needs to purchase poultry. Therefore she applies to obtain a loan. In the future, she hopes to purchase a washing-machine. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Orlando Fidel

texts.es:
Orlando Fidel T. Z. tiene 36 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Orlando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Orlando Fidel T. Z. is 36 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 2 children.

The 'El Batan' solidarity group is located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group has 21 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing cacao, cassava and corn.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Orlando has been growing cacao, cassava and corn for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in Chillanes market and in the district.

Orlando is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cacao crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working. 

He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Catalina; ella tiene 80 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio D. venta D. artesanía y tejidos, la socia venD. en un lugar llamado baratillo que es un lugar donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos y también  ropa D. segunda mano, su esposo es carpintero y por medio D. estos pequeños negocios sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia se levanta muy temprano y empieza a realizar los tejidos como chompas y chalinas, la socia quiere tener una tienda donD. pueda venderé los tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas y también para comprar artesanía.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. ropa, construcción, transporte, servicio D. taxi, restaurant y tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Catalina is one of its members. She is 80 years old, she is married and she has 8 children. She engages in selling crafts and knitted fabrics. She works in a market called Baratillo, where they sell every kind of items, including second-hand clothes. Her husband is a carpenter and they help their children getting by thanks to these small activities. She wakes up very early to begin making fabrics such as jumpers and scarves. She wishes to run a shop of her own where to sell the knitted fabrics. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials such as wool and also to buy crafts. 

The activities of the other members are: clothe sale, construction, transportation, taxi services, restaurant and grocery store.

Catalina is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy wool and crafs.

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
The woman in this photo is Lot R..  She is 37 years old and lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living by raising pigs. 

She has run this business since 2000, and it has provided her with income to support her family. She is married and has three children who are students in the public school. Her husband helps her in raising the pigs.  He also sells firewood for income.  To earn more income, Lot R. will use the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets

loans.name: 13 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “13 DE ENERO” es un grupo de 8 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Germán Busch, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos: venta de venestas escolares, venta de sobres, elaboración de polleras, venta de cocinas a gas, venta de varios, costura de polleras, venta de cocinas a gas, cerrajería..

Para su organización, la B. C. 13 de Enero cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Flora, una tesorera, la señora  Margarita y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Ana.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Flora vive con su esposo y uno de sus tres hijos (los otros dos hijos ya han conformado su hogar) la señora Flora está en el negocio de la costura de polleras, ella tiene este trabajo desde hace veinte años.   La costura de las polleras se realizan en su domicilio de acuerdo al pedido que le hagan sus clientes, en caso de que la demanda fuera mayor, le colabora su yerna .  
El préstamo solicitado por la señora presidenta, doña Flora fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la compra de tela bongé.

La señora Flora indica que esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el crédito rápido y ahorrar”.
texts.en:
The "13 DE ENERO" Communal Bank is a group of 8 women who have decided to join together to receive loans, training, and medical attention. They will be a part of the Germán Busch headquarters in their first loan cycle. 
Each of these group members has her own business: service, production, or retail. Among them are school supplies, envelopes, skirt production, gas stoves, general goods, skirt sewing, and locksmith services. 
In terms of its organization, this communal bank has its own board of directors; Ms. Flora, the president, Ms. Margarita, the treasurer, and Ms. Ana, the secretary. 
The president, Ms. Flora, lives with her husband and one of her three children (the other two have already started their own households). Ms. Flora has been sewing skirts for a living for 20 years. She makes the skirts by special order in her home. When the orders are bigger, her daughter-in-law gives her a hand. 
The president,doña Flora, requested a loan amount of 2,000.00 BOB, which will be used to purchase bongé fabric. 
Ms. Flora states that this is her first experience as a member of Pro Mujer. When asked what attracts her most about the institute, she responded, "The fast loan and the savings."

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 28 years old, married and has one child. He graduated from primary school. The borrower will use this loan to develop his bakery shop and purchase an electric kneading machine. The borrower has good reputation in the market and has excellent experience in the field of his job. He has energy to develop his work to raise his family income. He has attracted lots of the clients due to the good quality of his bread.

loans.use: For purchasing kneader

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena V. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 36 years old, is married, and has 3 school-aged children.

Rowena owns and operates a business in the retail sector, primarily operating a general store. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP.

In 2006, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC.

Rowena is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet S. lives with his mother, wife and two children in Talin. Together with his wife, Karapet looks after their cattle farm and fruit orchards. In addition to this, Karapet is a seasonal construction worker, which gives his family additional income. 

Karapet has been a good borrower with SEF for years, and thanks to previous loans he has been able to increase his number of cattle. Currently the cattle barn roof requires renovation, and for this purpose Karapet has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To renovate the roof of the cattle barn

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegría se formo con la unión D. varias señoras D. la localidad D. San Isidro D. Santaní.
Todas las integrantes desarrollan el plantado D. productos agrícolas.
Las integrantes formaron  un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen este comité, ya están en su 7mo ciclo.
La sra. Priscila por ejemplo se dedica a cosechar y sembrar su pequeña chacra, y como ahora se aproxima la época D. siembra necesita mano D. obra para el arado D. sus tierras, por eso solicita el crédito, para poder pagar esta clase D. servicios a fin D. poder trabajar nuevamente en su huerta.
texts.en:
The committee La Alegria, or ‘happiness,’ was formed when several women from the San Isidro locality in Santani came together. 

All the members cultivate agricultural products.

The members formed a very united group, one capable of accomplishing activities together that strengthen this committee. They are already in their seventh loan cycle. 

Ms. Priscila, for example, harvests and plants her small farm, and now that planting time is coming closer, she needs labor to plow the land. She is requesting the loan to be able to pay for this labor so she can work on her farm again.

loans.use: To pay for labor to plow the small farm to plant new crops

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde nació en la ciudad de Paruro  y tiene 39 años de edad. Actualmente, Clotilde vive junto con sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica es ayudar a una costurera, ella ayuda a una señora que se dedica a al confección de ropa, arreglar ropa, ella es muy entusiasta y está aprendiendo todo del negocio de la costura y su deseo es abrir su propio taller de costura. Ya son tres años que se dedica este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Clotilde en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal, ella nos cuenta que va pagar la inscripción de la matricula para que pueda postular su hija Maribel a la Universidad y con lo que sobre para comprar utiles escolares para sus demás hijos que están en el colegio.    

Clotilde es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 39 years old and was born in the city of Paruro. She and her four children currently live in Cusco, which is known as the Imperial City of the Incas. Clotilde is a responsible mother who wants to move her family forward. Her job is that of an assistant seamstress. She helps a woman who makes and repairs clothing. Clotilde is very enthusiastic and willing to learn everything about the sewing business. She wants to open her own sewing workshop. Clotilde has been working in this business for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use. Clotilde will pay the required registration fees so that her daughter Maribel can apply to the university. She will also buy school supplies for her other children who are students.

Clotilde is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Sumac Purisisun”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's university registration fees and purchase school supplies for her other children.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel N. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Emmanuel has a tailoring business, which he has had for four years.         

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Emmanuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Angeles Q. tiene la edad de 41 años, asistio a la escuela hasta el segundo año de primaria ya que sus padres no tenian los recursos economicos para darle mas estudios e inicio a aprender a trabajar en las labores del hogar, años despues se caso con el señor Alfredo el cual es panadero, ellos tuvieron cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya estan casados y actualmente solo vive con ellos es mas pequeño que asiste a la secundaria, Doña maria y su familia viven en la comunidad de San Miguel Soyaltepec en el estado de oaxaca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por que ahi esta ubicada la presa hidroelectrica de cerro de oro y su laguna da mucho pesca y trabajo a los señores de la comunidad.

Ella nos platica que su esposo sabe hacer pan y trabajaba en una panaderia pero hace un poco mas de seis años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y le enseño a doña maria a elaborar pan desde entonces trabajan juntos en su panaderia, ellanos platica que al medio dia inician ha elaborar el pan y a ornearlo para que por la tarde ya este listo y calientit para salir a venderlo por las calles de su comunidad con sus amigos y vecionos. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo enla compra de Arinas, leche, azucar,chochitos de colores, piña y mantequilla para la elaboracion de su pan.
ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere mas dia a dia para poder darle a su hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en el futuro una carrera.Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el prestamo que se le ha otorgado y la confianza que le dio al darle el prestamo.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles Q. is 41 years old.  She only has a second grade education because her parents did not have the financial resources to provide for more education, so she began learning how to work in the home.  Years later she got married to Alfredo, who is a baker.  They have five children, four of whom are now married and the youngest who still lives with them and attends junior high school.  Maria and her family live in San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca.  The Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located here, along with a lake that offers much fishing and work to the men of the community.
 
She tells us that her husband knows how to bake and work in a bakery, but a little more than six years ago he decided to start working his own business and taught her how to bake.  Since then, they have been working together in their bakery and she says that they begin baking at noon so that the bread will be hot and ready in the evening so that she can go out and sell it to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She needs this loan to buy flour, milk, sugar, sprinkles, pineapple, and butter for the bread.

She expects her business to prosper with the help of this loan, so that she can give a better quality of life to her children and careers in the future.  She is very grateful to the foundation for believing in her and granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El señor Walter nacido en la ciudad de Potosí  de 35 años de edad vive en la zona de la Gremial hace 2 años  donde esta construyendo su vivienda para dar mayor comodidad a su familia. Su Actividad es la de servicio de trasporte en la ciudad Santa Cruz hace ya 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad,  el sr. Walter no es casado pero convive hace 15 años con la señora Lucinda de actividad labores de casa, los señores cuentan con cuatro hijos a su poder.Destino del crédito es para terminar de hacer construir su vivienda. Los señores se sienten muy agradecidos por haber depositado la confianza en ellos y haber agilizado el crédito.
texts.en: Walter was born in the city of Potosí.  He is 35 years old and has lived in the Gremial zone for 2 years, where he is building his house in order to provide more a more comfortable life for his family.  He works providing transportation services in the city of Santa Cruz, an activity he has been carrying out for 13 years.  Walter is not married, but has cohabitated with Lucinda, who is a homemaker, for 15 years.  Together, they have four children.  The loan is destined to help them finish building their house.  They are very thankful for the confidence shown in them through the granting of credit.

loans.use: finish building his house.

loans.name: Walter Milton

texts.es:
Walter,es agricultor vive en casa propia junto a una hermana y tres sobrinas. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y chile, también a la crianza de ganado.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas de chiles, abono y tratamiento para plagas, este préstamo le ayudara para sembrar este cultivo y realizar como cada año la siembra.
Él quiere mejorar sus cultivos, produciendo más y de esta manera tener mayor posibilidad de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is a farmer who lives in his own house with his sister and three nieces.  He cultivates corn and chili and also raises livestock. He is requesting a loan to buy chili plants, fertilizer and pest treatment.  This loan will help him to plant this crop and harvest each year.  

He wants to improve his crops, producing more and thus be more likely to help his family.

loans.use: To buy chili plants, fertilizer and pest treatment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 58-year-old married mother of seven children, has been working in the quarry business for 10 years, earning 27,500 KES a month. She sells stones to customers on the Athi River, Mulolongo, and Kitengela.
