Mary is requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD to buy an additional piece of a quarry and will use the profits from the loan to buy another piece.

Describing herself as hardworking, in the future Mary hopes to have a very big piece of quarry and a lorry for transportation to customers.

loans.use: to buy a piece of a quarry.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old.  She is married and has 8 children.  Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.    She has been running her store for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Josephine has requested a loan for PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like milk, coffee, sugar, salt, creamer, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  Josephine has borrowed and repaid 23 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Ivan Antonio

texts.es: Ivan de 37 años de edad es  casadp, trabaja para la Alcaldia  desde hace 16 años,  como  policia municipal. Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo que esta en mal estado y construyendo la letrina. y evitar cualquier enfermedad. Sueña con poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ivan is 37 years old and married.  He has worked as a city police officer for 16 years.  He is requesting his first loan to improve his home.  He would like to replace his roof, which is in a bad state of repair, and build a toilet so that he can avoid becoming ill.  He dreams of being able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is engaged in the business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Jalia sells her products door-to-door on a retail basis. Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Jalia include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling solely on a wholesale basis and to provide for the education of her children up to university level.  

Jalia and her husband own a home that has access to electricity but not to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent and medication. They have five children, four of whom are in school.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Adolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Adolfo de Jesús vive en la ciudad de Managua trabaja como conductor en la ciudad de Managua.
El señor Adolfo visito nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito por que necesita el dinero para  gastos medico.
El señor  agradece a ceprodel por haberle dado el crédito  y así poder solvente sus gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Adolfo de Jesús lives in the city of Managua and works as a driver in the city of Managua. 

Mr. Adolfo visited our office to apply for a loan because he needs the money for medical expenses. 

He gives thanks to Ceprodel for having given him the loan so he may pay for his medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Doris H.

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Doris H. She is married and has four children aged 17, 13, 10 and 7 years old who are all going to school. In 1999, Doris H. established her food and drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in the running of their home. Working five days a week, and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 LE every month from this business. Doris H. requires a loan in order to buy soft drinks, rice, maltina and stout. She would like a loan of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Doris H. plans to locate her business in the centre of town and buy a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, rice, maltina and stout

loans.name: Ismenia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Ismenia; La socia al igual que sus compañeras es nueva en el banco de hecho el mismo banco es nuevo y todos los socios se encuentran muy emocionados ya que es la primera vez que se organizan de esta manera y que piden un crédito para poder invertir en sus negocios y mejorar en la calidad de servicios que prestan, la socia tienen una agencia de viajes llamada Hiran Bingan;  y la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de equipo de camping, ella alquila y vende equipo para hacer caminatas, canotaje, caballos y otros tours, la socia por esta razón requiere le préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo de camping y poder implementar su agencia de viajes, ella aparte de ofrecer sus servicios de tour guiado alquila el quipo para cada ocasión; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo de camping.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Ismenia belongs to CUSCO community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.  In common with her fellow bank members, Ismenia is new.  The whole bank is new and all its members are very excited as this is the first time that they have organized themselves in this way.  They are all requesting a loan so that they can invest in their businesses and improve the quality of the services they provide.

Ismenia owns a travel agency called 'Hiran Bingan'.  She would like to invest her loan in buying camping equipment.  She rents out and sells hiking equipment, canoeing equipment, horse-riding equipment, etc.  She needs this loan to invest in buying camping equipment so that she can stock her travel agency.  In addition to offering her services as a tour guide, she also rents out equipment for every occasion.

Ismenia is grateful for the support that she will receive and, for her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a motorcycle transportation business, operating from the market and from home. In addition he sells poultry, which serves as another source of income. He dreams of establishing a retail business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan he wants to start another business of keeping poultry. He will use the loan to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 32 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is married with four children.

Virgie has a sari sari store selling different kind of products. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 28000 to purchase more stock of products for her general store.

Virgie has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Virgie hopes to expand her sari sari store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products for her general store

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia, 35 years old, is married and has one child who is not in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan, for five years. Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use the profit to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is willing to work hard every single day in his corn farm business because he wants to give his family a good quality of life.

Danilo is 43 years old and lives with his family in the village of Maligaya, Cauayan city, Isabela. He hopes to maintain his farm business to be able to send his children to school and to give them a good quality of life.

At this time, Danilo aims to improve his corn farm business, but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm business. Danilo hopes to maintain his farm business to secure his family's future.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luís es un joven padre de 22 años, convive junto a Narcisa de 20 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 01 año a quien desea un futuro mejor. Luís, se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene su chacra en la que produce café,  por lo que tiene 01 año realizando esta actividad, pues su único fin es brindar un mejor provenir a su hijo. Cada mañana se levanta muy temprano y se despide de su hijo para poder ir a su chacra a estar permanente con sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo, es poder hacerlo en compañía de sus amigos quienes lo apoyan; sin embargo lo más difícil es no darle un hogar en buen estado a su pequeño hijo, ya que por ahora esta viviendo en una casa de madera. Con el tiempo desea construir su casa a base de material noble  y que su familia se sienta segura. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar trabajando. Además le agrada ser parte de banco comunal ya que todos son responsables y solidarios. Con los 2,000 soles, podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, ladrillos, fierros, alambres, entre otros; para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Luís, a young father, is 22 years old and lives together with Narcisa who is 20 years old. Together they live in their own house together with his 1 year old infant and he hopes for a better future for his child. Luís works in agriculture. He has a farm and grows coffee, and has been doing this for one year in order to provide better for his child. Each morning he gets up very early and says goodbye to his child and goes to his ever-waiting crops.

What he likes most about his work is being able to work with his friends who help him, and the hardest is not to be able to provide a home in good shape for his little child, as right now he is living in a wooden house. Over time he wants to construct a home built with better materials so that his family will feel safe.

This will be his 2nd loan with MFP, and he is hoping for help from each of you so he can continue working. He also likes being a part of the communal bank because they are all responsible and caring. With the 2,000 soles from the loan he will buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron bars, and wire among other items in order to build his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron bars, and wire in order to build his house.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 47, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Angel is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members. Angel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month for these activities.

In 1994, Angel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which he will use to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn mentioned that nowadays, life is difficult due to the high cost of commodities, school fees and transportation. Despite this, she has the strong determination to improve her status of living and support her family's needs. She is now 33 years old and has five school-aged children. She helps her husband in cultivating their farm land by planting corn and vegetables for sale. 

They aim to plant more vegetables to ensure high yields, but due to financial constraints, she is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production. They mentioned that this loan will help them to increase their production and income to educate all their children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long, 55 years old, is a responsible mother of 6 children. She is in the agricultural business. She has a life partner in her husband who provides motorcycle services to the people around Baray district. 

Besides farming work, Mrs. Long has another skill in weaving clothes. But she hasn’t used this skill for a long time because she doesn’t have a loom at home to operate. Now she has decided to look for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase a loom and other raw materials for the process. She hopes that she will be able to generate more income through this new project.

loans.use: to purchase a loom and other raw materials for the silk weaving process.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother). 

Robinah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Robinah sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling piped water and from houses she rents out.  

The main business challenges for Robinah include the rainy season and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own  a delivery van to ease transportation  and also to open up another branch in  the market. Robinah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old, and she is married to Mutunga. They are blessed with three children, aged 18, 16, and 13 years. She has been running a greengrocer business in an open-air market for the past 19 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Margaret will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and to rent a greengrocer house, which will help her to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 42-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be determined man. He operates a van with which he manages transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. In addition, he also sells chickens. His business is located at a busy market. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more chickens to boost his chicken business. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to boost his chicken business.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin, age 31, a mother of four children, owns a plantation, where she and her husband grow banana crops. She has been in the business since 2005, that's why she has good experience in running and operating her business. 

Besides growing bananas herself, she sometimes buys them from other villagers and takes them to sell at a reasonable price in a market of the province. So now Bin is seeking a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy bananas in bulk from other farmers' plantations. 

Bin is very appreciative and hopes that her project will be successful, thereby increasing her income to satisfy the whole family.

loans.use: to buy bananas in bulk from other farmers’ plantations.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es de la ciudad de Itá, estudia la carrera de técnico gastronómico, ella se dedica a hacer y vender tortas decoradas, a través de las cuales tiene los medios para poder estudiar.
Ella se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios. Anhela poder montar su propio negocio para poder mejorar.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Martha Aurelia

texts.en:
Miss Martha has a lovely family, made up of her four children and her husband. They live in Monclova in the state of Coahuila. One of their children is currently studying a program in university but the family income was not enough to provide him with the education that he wanted. With this situation at hand, Miss Martha started to sell shoes by catalogue and in this manner be able to obtain the income to put towards the realization of her son\'s wish.

She now requiers a loan of $475 that wil be used to purchase merchandise and pay off some outstanding accounts. With this she will be able to increase her sales, most needed because her son\'s tuition costs aree increasing and they cannot cover them. Make it possible for the continuation and completion of Miss Martha\'s son\'s studies. Become an essential part of the realization of the dream. Help them, they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha tiene una linda familia, conformada por 4 hijos y su esposo, ellos viven en Monclova, en el estado de Coahuila. Uno de sus hijos hace dos años que tuvo el deseo de estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero los ingresos familiares no alcanzaban para brindarle la educación que él deseaba. Tras esta situación, Doña María comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo y de esta manera poder obtener ingresos que utilizaría para poder cumplir el deseo de su hijo.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, que utilizará para poder comprar mercancía y pagar unas facturas pendientes. Con esto ella podrá incrementar sus ventas, ya que los pagos de la educación de su hijo se están incrementando y no alcanzan a cubrirlos. Haz posible la continuación y culminación de los estudios D. hijo de Doña Martha. Vuélvete parte esencial de la realización de su sueño, apóyalos, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Winifred Neba

texts.en:
Born in 1968, Winifred is married and mother of five children, all in school. The passing away of her supportive father and brother within one year, coupled with continuous difficulties to raise capital, caused her to take a friend’s advice to take a loan. On completion of the Minimum Skills Workshop organized by GHAPE for first-time borrowers, she received her first loan in 2003. Her performance earned trust and she was later elected to a leadership position, Centre Chief of her center. With previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with good quality raw foodstuff. She is proud of having contributed financially in paying school fees for her children.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to increase her stock by buying beans, garri and potatoes. She is convinced that her business will succeed because of her marketing skills, the available market provided by the ever increasing population of the Bamenda urban center, her business site, and the availability and advantages of liquidity. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Ngochembo  Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda was born in 1975. She is married to a polygamist called Koko Alphonse Mienguh. She has five children.  The deaths of a daughter and her mother have been very painful. It hurts so much because they were very young when they died.
Emelda has had a beauty salon for a few years but wants a change. She thinks that  a business selling firewood would be very profitable because there is no wood for fuel in her quarter, especially now during the rainy season. She wants to be able to supply this wood to her community and reduce the distance they cover in search of wood, while continuing to dress the hair of the ladies there. She hopes to help her husband pay for her children’s education and improve their living standards. This will make her very happy.
She will repay her loan during the term.

loans.use: Beauty salon and Selling of firewood

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Salomat is 48 years old. Her husband passed away and left her with 7 children. In addition to her there are 16 other members of her family that live together: 2 sons with their families and 4 non-adult daughters. The oldest daughter recently got married and lives with her husband.

Sources of income need to be found to feed such a large quantity of people. The two sons drive people in vans on local routes, while Salomat sells traditional Tajik flatbread at the market. She has been doing this for several years. Early in the morning one of her sons drives the flatbread to the market, helps her to arrange it on the counter and then leaves for his job. One of the daughters helps Salomat to sell. Salomat has many regular clients and she sells all of her flatbread in 3 hours. 5 months ago the price of flatbread increased slightly and Salomat decided to get a loan from MicroInvest. The loan brought additional profits and since then she has been borrowing continuously. She plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Саломат 48 лет. Так получилось что ее муж умер и оставил на нее 7 детей. А живут у нее в семье кроме нее самой еще 16 человек. Это 2 сыновей со своими семьями и 4 ее несовершеннолетних дочери. Старшая дочь недавно вышла замуж и живет со своим мужем. Чтобы прокормить такое количество приходится находить способы зарабатывания денег. 2 ее сыновей возят на микроавтобусах людей по местным маршрутам, а Саломат выходит на базар торговать лепешками (национальный таджикский хлеб). Она занимается этим уже несколько лет. Рано утром один из ее сыновей подвозит лепешки на базар, помогает разложить его на прилавке и затем уезжает на маршрут. Одна из дочерей помогает Саломат торговать. У нее много постоянных клиентов и уже через 3 часа она продает все лепешки. 5 месяцев назад цена на лепешки немного повысилась, и Саломат решила взять займ в Микроинвест. Полученный займ принес дополнительную прибыль Саломат и с тех пор она постоянно кредитуется. Новый займ планирует потратить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa has worked hard since she was a little girl. She has survived despite difficult circumstances thanks to her optimism and strives above all to care for her seven children. Rosa and her husband had worked in agriculture, but when he passed away fourteen years ago, she struggled to provide her family alone. To supplement her income, she rented a small store on the main street of her neighborhood and stocked it with groceries. The store has been a real boon for her family, yet the cost of raising this large family prompts Rosa to seek other ways to apply her talents. She has been knitting shawls in her free time and this brings in much-needed income. Rosa feels that with more working capital the shop could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of $325 to jumpstart the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible mother give her children a brighter future.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa desde niña fue una mujer muy trabajadora que ha sabido sobrellevar gracias a su optimismo muchas circunstancias difíciles, con el único objetivo de poder apoyar a sus siete hijos. Sufrió la pérdida de su esposo, hace 14 años y la dura tarea de satisfacer todas y cada una de las necesidades en su hogar la llevaron a perseverar con el trabajo agrícola que había emprendido junto a su esposo cuando consolidó su matrimonio. Poco tiempo después adicionalmente al desarrollo de esta actividad pudo iniciar un negocio de venta de abarrotes alquilando un local cerca de la avenida principal, este pequeño espacio le ha generado muchas satisfacciones familiares sin embargo a pesar de contar con este ingreso adicional los gastos siguen siendo muchos por esa razón continúa incansable y aún sigue explotando sus talentos. La elaboración de ponchos en sus horas libres se ha convertido en una importante ocupación para incrementar el ingreso familiar.De esta manera y a través de innumerables actividades trata de satisfacer completamente las necesidades de su numerosa familia. El incremento de capital para su desempeño en la pequeña tienda podría generarle sumas de dinero importantes por esta razón solicita 325 ´dólares para impulsar su pequeño negocio, con el objetivo de seguir incrementando la calidad de vida familiar. Ayudemos a esta increíble madre la posibilidad de brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Tume Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a widower who lives with relatives who take care of his son and help out in his carpenter’s workshop. His carpentry business is doing well and he has many happy clients. Lawrence believes that this is a good time to expand his business, and has come to us for a loan to make that expansion possible. He will use part of the loan to buy wood and other items he needs to make more furniture, and the balance to buy baby chickens that he will raise and sell in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens, planks, nails and varnish

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a partner of the Communal Bank “Divine Baby Jesus”, she is dedicated to the sale of small animals, and also she has a brick business where she sells bricks for construction. Her place of sale is the market in the Province of Carhuaz in the city of Ancash.

With the loan of 1,000 soles, which will be paid off in 6 installments, she will buy a sack of food for animals and medicines for them; also she will buy sawdust for the production of the bricks.

She is 39 years old, she has two sons, and her husband helps her in the brick factory but she manages the production and the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Divino Niño Jesús”, ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores, paralelamente tiene una ladrillera (venta de ladrillos para construcción). Su lugar de venta es en el mercado de la a Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 1 saco de afrecho (comida para animales) y medicinas para cuyes, también comprará aserrín para la producción de ladrillos.

Ella tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la ladrillera pero ella administra la producción y la venta.

loans.use: The purchase of food and medicine for young animals.  The purchase of sawdust.

loans.name: Ziomara

texts.es:
Mrs. Ziomara is 39 years old and is the mother of four children. She currently belongs to the communal bank Women with Future. She is the owner of a motorcar and dedicates herself to managing that as well as selling food at night. Her husband, Mr. Miguel, who supports her in everything, is happy and proud to have a hard-working woman. For Ziomara, the only goal of her daily efforts is to improve the conditions of her work tools and after that, to enhance her food sales business. For this, she needs cash that she will invest in the expenses of the previously mentioned goals. She awaits your noble heart’s unselfish help.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ziomara de 39 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, en la actualidad pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ella es propietaria de un motocarro y se dedica a la administración del mismo, adicionalmente también se dedica a la venta de comida por la noches. Su esposo el señor Miguel, quien la apoya en todo se siente feliz y orgulloso por tener una mujer trabajadora.Para Ziomara el único fin de su esfuerzo diario es mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo y desde luego implementar más su negocio de venta de comida, para lo cual requiere de un capital que lo invertirá en los gastos del deseo antes mencionado.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Wampala North A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Martha B.. She is currently has a business as an airtime dealer and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Martha is 38 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 2 and 4 and her children go to school. Each week, Martha makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a crafts shop. Martha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Martha is joined in her small group by Suzan S., Florence W., Florence W., and Jolly M.. Suzan S. has a beauty salon business and wants to buy more salon equipment. Florence W. is currently operating a stationary shop business and wants a loan to increase stock. Florence W. operates a business of tailoring and wants to buy a sewing machine and more clothing materials. Jolly M. is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and more beer.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime (credit cards) and boost business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Every day, along with her husband, Rosalina works hard in her humble home in order to improve her children's lives. She sells sweaters in various colors, styles and sizes at the different markets in her city, and thanks to her high quality workmanship and good taste, she is getting more and more orders. She wants to be able to fill all of these orders and increase her business, and is therefore requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalina en compañía de su querido esposo se desempeña a diario en su humilde hogar con el deseo de contribuir con la superación de sus queridos hijos. Oferta diversos colores, modelos y tallas de chompas en las diferentes ferias de su ciudad y gracias a la calidad de las mismas y a su buen gusto han incrementado la cantidad de sus pedidos.Su deseo de cumplir y ampliar su radio de trabajo lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas de las diversas personas que se desempeñan en esta labor en sus respectivos hogares y de las cuales Rosalina y su esposo se han convertido en sus mejores clientes.

loans.use: Additional funds to be able to sell more sweaters

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Uwenacho Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 31 years old and is married with 1 child, age 7. Mwanahawa owns a small food vending store, and she is a cloth seller, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Elizabeth, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Evas Naturinda's Group

texts.en:
Evas is a leader of 4 members in a group. She is 36 years old and married with 2 children, who are both are in school. She lives in a semi-urban community.

She operates a retail shop selling essential commodities, kitchenware and soft drinks. Her main challenges are the unstable prices of commodities and high rent fees. She has managed to increase her stock and adequately contribute to the well-being of the family. She would like to transform her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To transform her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C., 51, and her husband, Mr. Chea Ou, 52, live on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children--three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. The remaining four children live at home. Two are construction workers and the other two are in school.

Mrs. Seng has been farming and working as a silk weaver since 1979. These are skills that she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a man from the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chea farms and raises cows.

Mrs. Seng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving, and also to buy zinc to roof her daughter’s home.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Yessica Elieth

texts.es:
Yessica is 23 years old and married with 3 children, all under 18. She lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. Yessica has been selling new clothing for a year and a half in a business she was able to start thanks to her husband's support. Her sales have peaks and valleys as in all businesses but she has been able to keep the business going well despite the cycles. She is requesting a loan with which to buy more products in order to increase her inventory. She dreams of one day owning her own clothng store and of giving a good education to her 3 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Yessica tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, habita en el barrio Villa venezuela, tiene 3 hijos que son menores de edad. Yessica vende ropa nueva desde hace año y medio, negocio que pudo empezar gracias al apoyo que le dio su esposo. Las ventas tiene altas y bajas como todo negocio, pero Yessica se puede mantener ante estas situaciones. Solicita el crédito para comprar más productos y poder aumentar el inventario de su negocio. Su sueño es poder llegar a tener una tienda de ropa y poder darle educación a sus 3 pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Buy new clothing to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús lives in his parents´ house at 2040 Caupolican Street, in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz, with his wife and son, in one room.

Now that he has a child, he needs to make things a bit more comfortable for his family. For this reason, with some money he has saved, he decided to build an extra room. Since Jesús works as a bricklayer he decided to do the construction himself in order to cut costs.

The loan he is requesting now is to purchase materials such as brick, sand, cement, etc. so he can build the room he needs in order to live more comfortably. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from IMPRO, and a socioeconomic and income analysis shows that Jesús is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Jesús vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Caupolican #2040 de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijo, en una sola habitación.

Ahora que ya tiene un hijo necesita dar mas comodidad a su familia y es por eso que teniendo un dinero ahorrado decidió construir una habitación extra; además, Jesús trabaja como albañil y por eso él mismo hará la construcción, logrando abaratar los costos.

El préstamo que ahora solicita es precisamente para la compra de materiales, como ser ladrillo, arena, cemento, etc., para construir la habitación que necesita para vivir con mayor comodidad. Es al primera ves que solicita un crédito en IMPRO, y el análisis socioeconómico efectuado más su flujo de caja dan como resultado que Jesús está calificado para acceder a este préstamo.

loans.use: Buy materials to build on another room to his parents´ house.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. As part of the Yamen solidarity group, Samar sells lingerie to the women of her region. Samar has requested a loan of $600 to purchase more merchandise and to diversify her inventory of goods. Samar has been a micro-credit client of A. Majmoua for the past 3 years and has always repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: Help to diversify her stock of clothing

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
La señora Lola tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay”, ella desea tener un negocio en la venta de golosinas ya que cree que se gana mejor que con su actual negocio; junto a su esposo que trabaja en una planta minera mantienen a su tres hijos y con la venta de anticuchos, que vende en la ciudad de Huaraz en el puente Huascarán, atenúa algunas carencias económicas en casa; lo mas difícil para ella es no tener una casa propia y vivir en alquiler. 
Con este préstamo de s/.300 soles, que pagará en cuatro meses, comprará, aceite, platos, y una cocina a gas para poder atender mejor a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Señora Lola is 29 years old and a member of the community bank "Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay" (Persevering Women of Patay). She wants to have a business of of selling sweets because she believes she can earn more this way than with her present business. Together with her husband, who works in a mineral plant, they take care of three children. With the sales of anticuchos (skewered meats popular in the Andes) that she markets in the city of Huaraz in the port of Huascarán, she minimizes the economic scarcities in their home. The most difficult thing for her is not having her own home and having to rent. With this loan of 300 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy oil, plates, and a gas cooker, so ultimately she can better look after her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil and disposable plates. Buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon C., 39, and her husband married in 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One of the children studies at the local school and other two are too young to attend school. Pon’s children are cared for by their grandmother. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pon's husband is very ill so she farms alone. She has been growing rice for ten years and she learned this skill from her parents. Besides farming, she has been selling lotus flowers for five years. She purchases them from her neighbors to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun N., 43, and her husband, Vong N., 33, were married in 1998 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children attend school and the other one is too young to attend school. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been selling grocery for seven years. Vong assists his wife in grocery selling. They buy them from Prek Phnao market for resale. They hope their business will be able to support their children to study at the highest level in school as possible.

Savorun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additional grocery items for resale

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Vy Khuth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine people and is located in Trea Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Vy K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. C. Chit, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. In this business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough equipment. Thus, Mrs. Vy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice. Mrs. Vy K. is 50 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are construction workers while the remaining two are attending the local school.

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term borrower and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrower is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients sT. to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees to climb up to gather juice

loans.name: Casimena

texts.en: Casimena has three children and runs a successful clothing store.  Her store, "Tienda Casimena," specializes in used clothing for women. The Esperanza Home Improvement team toured her house, and they verified that several cement walls need repair. Presently, the walls allow water to seep through several places in the kid's room.  Please help her by financing this loan.  Thank you!

loans.use: Wall Repair

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is a 33-year-old mother of 3 kids, who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the kids. She has operated a seamstress shop for the past 12 years. She has one young lady (apprentice) who is learning to acquire skills and experience for her future. She sews all forms of women's wear with various kinds of styles, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sews children's school uniforms. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. It has been her dream to make progress this year to increase her business size. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids in school. She belongs to a village bank called Honesty.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Fredy Modesto

texts.es:
Freddy  vive en la C. “Corpa”    de la zona anexo 25 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus  tres hijos en su casa propia.

Trabaja como albañil en diferentes construcciones donde requieren mano de obra, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos (todos se encuentran en edad escolar).
 

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de lentes de aumento para una de sus hijas, pues requiere con suma urgencia para poder estudiar. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy lives on Corpa street in the area next to "25 de Julio" in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their three children in their own home. He works as a builder for different construction jobs, which requires manual labor. His wife is dedicated to household chores and caring for their children (all of them are school-age).

The loan will be used to get reading glasses for one of his daughters. She needs them urgently so that she may study. It is his first loan with Impro; the evaulation that he completed qualified him to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Glasses for his daughter

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. According to her, her two children are in primary school. Salamatu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

She works to make some income to support her husband financially. She is in the palm oil production business. Salamatu procures palm fruits from farmers in her community and in nearby villages to produce the oil. She distributes the oil to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to an increasing number of her customers.

It is her desire to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure palm fit for processing.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Tú Lê (1714080939) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Tú owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Tú has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Tú joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Tú is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Tú plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Laura has been selling agrifood products for five years. She requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her sales. Laura is an active woman who is always willing to participate in forums in order to sell her products. She is also very active within Al Majmoua, participating in several training sessions like vocational training, business-management training and lots more. Laura is special in her work because she is good with her agrifood products. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her work, she didn’t have the start-up capital and didn’t have all the needed equipment. Laura decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income and because she likes working. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Laura will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme habite dans le quartier de Tokoin Soted qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé.  Elle est divorcée de son mari et vit seule avec ses 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pains en gros et en détail, elle s’approvisionne dans une grande  boulangerie de la ville de Lomé. Voulant rehausser son stock elle sollicite auprès de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 120 pains.
C’est avec le revenu issu de ce commerce qu’il subvient aux besoins de ses 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady lives in Tokoin Soted district, which is an area in downtown Lomé. She is divorced from her husband and lives alone with her three children. She sells bread wholesale and retail, stocking up in a big bakery in the city of Lomé. Wishing to increase her stocks, she is asking WAGES for her first-ever loan to buy 120 loaves of bread.

The income from this business permits her to support her three children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of loaves of bread for resale

loans.name: Bimila

texts.en:
Bimala has been successfully running a small shop selling kitchen utensils for more than 13 years. Bimala is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband, Krishna, is employed with Nepal Telecom. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 Nepalese Rupees to purchase a wide range of kitchen utensils.

In future, Bimila hopes to expand her business and grow her income so that she and her husband can afford to build a small house.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen equipment and utensils to restock her shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. V. resides in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She operates a business selling fish. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years, earning 5,000 PHP per month.

She joined PMPC,a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar totora y chillihua (plantas de la zona), y fabricar quesanas (tejas,calaminas), luego llevar a las ferias de la zona para venderlo.

Su deseo es mejorar su criadero de truchas
A ella le gustan las charlas, las reuniones y las orientaciones que se dan en el Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “Las Totoritas” Communal Bank located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 27 years old, married with 2 children, and has partially completed secondary school. She lives in the Chimu Central community. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 7 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used to make artisan pieces. Today she needs a loan for S/.1500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy reed mace and chillihua (local plants) and make artisan pieces (weavings, metal pieces) to take to the area markets to sell. Her wish is to improve her trout farm. She likes the Communal Bank’s seminars and orientations it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make artisan pieces

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: Don Bernardino es un cliente antiguo de la institución, puntual y muy responsable, tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja como radio taxi, vive con su esposa en su casita propia, sus hijos ya son independientes pero como todo papá se preocupa siempre por ellos y por su bienestar. Invertirá el crédito en el mantenimiento general de la movilidad, para que pueda trabajar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Don Bernardino is a punctual, very responsible, long-time customer of the institution. The vehicle with which he works is a radio-taxi. He lives with his wife in their own small house. His children are already independent, but, as all fathers, he is always concerned about them and their well-being. He will invest the loan in the general maintenance of his vehicle, so that he can work without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: WILL BE INVESTED IN THE MAINTENANCE OF HIS VEHICLE

loans.name: Gladys Rosa

texts.en:
Gladiy is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 42 years old and has 4 children 21, 20, 16, and 10 years old. Her youngest two children are studying in the nearby public school. Gladiy’s also has a disabled brother whom she also looks after, in addition to her children. Despite not being able to walk he has learned to make crafts out of leather and sheepskin. He taught Gladiy, who then worked making artisan goods for 12 years before she decided that she needed to spend more time looking after her children. However, after a few years, hard economic circumstances required her to return to making crafts. She says she enjoys creating the chests, decorations, and other memorabilia.

Since Gladiy has joined FINCA her economic situation has improved greatly. She uses the loans to invest in more materials and the education of her children. Gladiy is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy more sheepskin, thread, and leather. Her dream is to someday have a workshop that produces fine leather goods.

loans.use: buy more sheepskin, thread, and leather

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a member of the KDC borrower group in Kiboriloni, Iringa, She is 45 year old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 8 children. Her children are 30,28,25,23,21,20,17,12 years old.

Vera has owned shoes business for 20 years, She works 12 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Vera`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy  more shoes for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Vera hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Said N. is 35 years old, married with 4 children aged between 14 and 2 and 5 dependents.

Said has been in the business of shopping for a period of 15 years working 14 hours a day by employing 2 employees. Though that period, Said could not make enough profits. So in order to make more profits than before, Said is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a  for expanding his business through purchasing more shopping goods like 10 sacs of salt and sugar,12 carton of cooking oil  etc

Through the use of this loan, Said hopes to get more profit and with that profit, he plans to pay school fees and get more food for his family.

loans.use: for purchasing more products

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a 31 year-old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with her husband. For two years, Zaynab has been selling clothes. She also sells women’s accessories and toys for children. She is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop including the collection for the new season. This is her second loan cycle and previously she paid on time.

Her previous loan helped improve her sales by diversifying her merchandise. Her clients are people from her region. When Zaynab first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties except finding the proper place to open her shop. She decided on her business because she likes what she does and from a young age she wanted to open a clothing shop. In the future, she plans on improving her business further.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth Jemaiyo

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old, married to William and has five children. Her business is located in Tembeleo in Eldoret.

With the loan she is taking from Kadet, Elizabeth intends to buy cooking oil, Unga flour and sugar to sell in her retail shop. Her future plans are to sell a wider variety of foodstuffs, to support her family by putting food on the table and to be able to afford to educate her children.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, Unga flour and sugar to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Lukia Sekaana's Group

texts.en:
Lukia, a 40-year-old married mother of three children between 8 and 20 years of age, all attending school, owns and resides in a five-roomed house with seven people, as she takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. Lukia's monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She also incurs transport costs going to and from Owino market, one of the biggest markets in Uganda, where she has a shop selling used clothes.

Working seven days a week, Lukia receives an average of 30 customers a day. Her major business challenges include thieves, the rainy season, and seasonality. During the rainy season she moves door to door, which reduces customer volume. She has been in this business for 15 years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her twelfth loan working with the same group mates. Lukia joined MCDT because it was near her home and offered the opportunity for her to increase her capital. Lukia wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and aspires to expand her business and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: K. Célestine est née vers 1963 et est mariée à FOLI Jonas, un forgeron. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés, mais trois seulement sont à leur charge. Célestine vit depuis douze ans avec ses enfants et son mari à PK11 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestine mène comme activité, la vente de farine de blé en sachets, sardines, vinaigre, allumette, défrisants, pâtes alimentaires, oeufs, etc. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine a 8 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Célestine sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son commerce et de satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Célestine K. was born around 1963 and is married to Jonas Foli, a blacksmith. The couple have six children, all in school, but only three of whom are in their care. For twelve years, Célestine has lived with her children and husband in PK11 in Sèmè-Podji, Benin. Célestine helps her husband provide for the family. Célestine never went to school. To meet her needs and those of her family, Célestine runs a business selling packets of wheat flour, sardines, vinegar, matches, hair straighteners, pasta, eggs, etc. It is in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin, that Célestine gets her supplies. Celestine has 8 years of experience in this area. She is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) who has repaid her loans properly. Célestine is seeking a fifth loan through ALIDÉ in order to enlarge her business and to further satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of wheat flour, boxes of pasta, and trays of eggs

loans.name: Mujeres Rn Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Mujeres en Desarrollo” se conformo gracias al deseo de sus integrantes de generar  mas  ingresos  para  sus hogares y ayudar al sustento de la casa . Utilizaran  su crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: insumos para la fabricación de comestibles, compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra venta de ropas, lencería, helados, bebidas, compra de animales para su posterior venta, etc

1Luz Fabiana M. R.
Vta de Comestibles
2
Ingrid L.
Vta de ropas                                                                                                                                       
3
Lilia G.
Vta de ropas

texts.en:
The Mujeres en Desarrollo communal bank formed thanks to the desire of its members to generate more income for their homes and help support the household. They will use the loan to buy diverse supplies like milk, sugar, herbs, flour, salt, baked goods, and vegetables to make food to sell. They will buy clothes, lingerie, ice cream, and drinks to sell later. They will also buy animals to sell later. 1 Luz Fabiana M. R. Sells Food 2 Ingrid L. Sells Clothes 3 Lilia G. Sells Clothes 4 Ruth B. Sells Food 5 Mirian Celeste P. Sells Food 6 Gladys A. Sells Clothes 7 Gloria Del Rocios L. Sells Food 8 María Isabel F. Sells Food 9 Cristiani A. Sells Fruit 10 Sara G. Grocery Store 11 Lina M. Sells Clothes 12 Cristina N. Sells Clothes 13 Mirta Celeste M. Buys and sells animals 14 Juana E. Raises animals 15 Ninfa G. Raises animals

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food to sell, buy food and clothing to sell, buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Otuwa

texts.en:
Otuwa M. is currently in the business of selling beans, groundnut paste and green vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of beans and groundnut paste to sell.  Otuwa is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a logician.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more bags of beans and groundnut paste to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 52 años y 05 hijas, ya independientes.

Isabel, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con ganas de seguir adelante, así aportar en el ingreso económico, en su hogar.
Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse más en el campo, así que con su esfuerzo estableció un pequeño ambiente, ubicado en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde atiende  a sus clientes; con el carisma y alegría que siempre le ha caracterizado. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos de arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos de plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Isabel, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Activas de Belen” in the district of Moyobamba, in the Province of Moyobamba, in the Department of San Martin. She is in a domestic partnership, is 52 years old and has 5 independent daughters. Isabel is a hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and bring in more income to help support her home. She has been working in food sales, and seeing that it generates a good income, she decided to work more in this area. She put in the effort to open a small stand located in the Central Market in her district. She attends to her clients with the charisma and joy that have always characterized her. Currently she is continuing with the same business and tells us that it is going very well and that already she is well-known and has a good reception. With this loan of 1500 PEN she will buy supplies to prepare her dishes, such as kilos of rice, sugar, potatoes, plantains, live chickens in crates; as well as some kitchen tools to replace the old ones. Isabel feels that she is a calm, happy, and successful woman with a desire to ensure a peaceful retirement. She would like to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to fulfill her dreams and goals, as well as for helping other women who want to grow professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more calves and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, maize in bulk.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith M. L. is 44 years old, married and has six children, the youngest of which is only one year old. For the last 18 years, she has made a living selling items such as maize, beans and millet in a busy market in the town of Kakamega. She says that this business is profitable, with her main challenge being a large number of competitors. Transportation is also poor, which makes it hard to take delivery of items to sell. But she works very hard to keep her business profitable, and has applied for a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cereals to sell. She also hopes to buy some land to farm in the future, because she is a hardworking and visionary lady.

loans.use: Maize

loans.name: Moth

texts.en:
Mrs. E. is a 49-year-old fish merchant. She leaves home in the early morning to where fish are sold in bulk and she buys fish from her suppliers. She then brings the fish back to sell in her village for a profit. She has been operating this business for five years and earns $5 a day.

E. is married with eight children, seven of whom are married and have already started new homes, and the other one is single. Her husband earns his daily money by driving a taxi.

E. will use her first loan to enlarge her fish-selling enterprise and to repair her husband’s taxi that often has broken down.

loans.use: To enlarge her fish-selling enterprise and to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 13, and 10, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for five years.

Batsaihan operates a carpentry business in his town. His business is well known in the local province. Batsaihan designs and produces a variety of wooden products to sell to his many customers. He began his business in 2000 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD). His business has grown quickly over the years, and he has a loyal customer base. With a lot of hard work and determination, his working capital has risen to 1,200,000 tugrugs (~$845 USD).

Batsaihan is an experienced carpenter and a very hardworking person. He would like to save money for his children's education. Batsaihan is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon Y. is 26 years old and lives in Banga South Cotabato. She is a farmer. Her main crop is rice. She has a 1-hectare farm. She works very hard to ensure an abundant harvest. She has one child, who is 9 years old. She started planting rice last 2009. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Paris Enole

texts.en:
Paris Enole M. is 37 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children. She is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last seven years.

Paris learned about KADET through a friend who is already registered member. This will be her first loan which she is planning to use to plant more maize which normally does well in her area due to good climatic conditions.

Paris hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Paris’s dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. Despite being a widow, she is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To plant more maize

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana A. Haikal is a hard-working woman from Hebron City in Palestine. After getting a divorce, Hana established her own beauty salon in order to take care of her only son and her ill mother who lives with her and to cover life expenses. The salon was very primitive, but she started taking loans from FATEN to develop it.

The salon offers all beauty services, such as hair cuts, nail polish, and hair dying. Hana came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan to purchase wedding gowns that she rents to brides who come to her salon for make-up and hair-dos.

Hana's son has entered a beauty school so he can help his mother by working in the salon. In the photo, she is showing the gowns that she purchased.

loans.use: Purchase wedding gowns

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta T is currently in the business of selling maize, millet, sorghum, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more cereals to sell.  Antoneta is 41 years old and is widowed.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more cereals to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 54 años, es viuda, y vive en compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 3 años se dedica en la venta D. productos en la tienda que posee, ubicado en el interior D. su domicilio. DesD. muy joven aprendió el comercio ambulante, llevando sus productos a otras ciudades. Actualmente su establecimiento esta provisto D. varios productos como los D. primera necesidad, en donD. sus hijos la ayudan en la atención al cliente. El calido trato le ha dado ventaja frente a la competencia, por tanto desea continuar esforzándose en su trabajo y abastecer D. más productos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. arroz D. distintas calidades, fideos y algunas menestras.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old, widowed, and lives with her five children in her own house. For more than three years she has sold goods in her store, located in her home. When she was very young she learned about traveling sales, taking her products to other cities. Currently her establishment carries basic goods, and her children help her attend to customers. The warm treatment has given her an advantage over the competition, so therefore she wishes to continue working hard and stock more goods. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She has always been responsible with her payments, and she is pleased to be part of her communal group, because all the members are responsible and supportive. With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in the purchase of bags of rice of various qualities, beans and mixed vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa que le fue heredada por sus padres. Hace más de 7 años brinda el servicio de transporte, actividad que lo realiza con su esposo, quien es el conductor de la movilidad que ellos alquilan. De esta manera su esposo recorre los diferentes puntos de la ciudad, siempre teniendo en cuenta la calidad de su servicio, mientras que Evelyn administra los ingresos en que luego serán derivados a los gastos familiares. A su vez, cría vacas y toros en un establo que posee. Ambas actividades lo realiza con mucha dedicación y lo cumple para mejorar la economía de su familia. Evelyn disfruta de su trabajo porque tiene más ingresos y de manera independiente, es por eso que ella y su esposo desean  tener su propio carro para que sus ganancias sean más rentables. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será destinado al pago del mantenimiento del carro y otra parte en la compra de animales.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 small children in a house that she inherited from her parents. For more than 7 years, she has provided transportation services, an activity which she carries out with her husband, who drives their rented vehicle. Her husband travels around to the various areas of the city, always taking care to provide quality service, while Evelyn manages the finances and the family's expenses. She also raises cows and bulls in a stable she has. She carries out both activities with great dedication and works hard in order to improve her family's economic situation. Evelyn enjoys her work, because it brings her more income in an independent manner. For this reason, she and her husband would like to have their own car, so that their work will be more profitable. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support, since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. She would like to thank all of the people who will be involved in providing the loan she is requesting; it will be very useful to her for the progress of her business. She will use the funds from the loan she is requesting to pay for maintenance for the car, and she will also use a portion to buy animals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Providing maintenance for their rented vehicle, buying animals

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan. She is 43 years old and married with four adult children. Editha has a business selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D., 58, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Bernardo D., a driver. They are blessed in their marriage with good health and strong physiques which enable them to work hard for their future together.

Elena operates a ready-to-wear clothing store. She mainly offers children’s clothing, summer shorts (which are very popular in tropical Philippines), statement shirts, and other basic everyday wear. The clothing is made from sheer cotton fabrics, which are all suited to the hot and humid climate. Most customers only buy made-to-order clothes when really necessary, as it is more expensive. Elena’s customers are her immediate community and neighbors.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and designs of clothing to replenish and increase her current business inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Elena has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for almost 8 years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings*.
 
Elena dreams of being able to have her own house and lot someday through all her hard work in her business.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship group gathers each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to replenish and increase her current business inventory

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera S. is a resident of Balykchi, a nice city in the Isykul region. Venera is 37 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. Her sons are at school and her daughter is not yet in school. In order to make money, Venera sells apricots and apples grown in her garden. She also sells about 20 liters of milk per day (earning 10 TJS per liter). Venera's husband earns money to cover family expenses by working in construction.
Venera also breeds livestock. She had 40 farm animals, but sold all of them to finish building her house. With her loan, she wants to purchase livestock for breeding. Her dream for the future is to provide her children with a good education.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment).
