It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia plants and harvests rice for sale. Delia works hard to improve her business. 

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gayaza-Kampala Group

texts.en:
Her monthly cash income is estimated at close to $67 a month. With an experienced business resume spanning over three years, her confidence has sky rocketed despite the challenging nature of her medical clinic business with competition growing ever day. Despite this, her level of optimism has not plummeted at all. 

Meet 36-year-old N. Noah, a happily married woman with two children. Taking a long view of things is an attribute which has aided her a lot.  Norah belongs to Akwata empola group-Kampala. It was after listening to talk from close friends and family that she embarked on this business. With this loan she wants to purchase more drugs for her clinic.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: La señora Reyna Maria O. A., tiene la edad de 42 años es casada vive en el Barrio San Ignacio, sus hijos son mayores de edad y están casados, y sobreviven bajo su propio esfuerzo, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 21 años y tras este largo periodo se han enfrentado a diferentes problemas de plagas que disminuyen la producción, es para contrarrestar este problema que desea invertir en materiales agrícolas para llevar a cabo un mantenimiento fitosanitario. Con el crédito podrá mejorar a corto plazo el volumen de sus ventas y tener una calidad de vida más favorable para hacer frente a futuros proyectos familiares y económicos.
texts.en: Reyna María O. A. is 42 years old,  married, and lives in the San Ignacio neighbourhood. Her grown-up sons are married and financially independent. She has been a farmer for over 21 years and over this period has encountered different pest problems which reduce production. To combat this problem, she would like to invest in agricultural materials to maintain the health of her crops. The loan will enable her to improve the short-term volume of sales and have a better quality of life, so as to plan better for the future of her family and business.

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Asociaciones Unidas Group

texts.es: El entusiasmo de un grupo en su mayoría mujeres, que con esfuerzo y creatividad han sabido salir adelante para el surgimiento económico de sus negocios y sus familias. Un grupo conformado por 8 integrantes llamado Asociación Unidas, con un año de formado, en el grupo existe mucha confianza y apoyo entre todos los integrantes ya que se conoces muy bien debido a que todos son vecinos de la misma zona en la que viven. Cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero mencionaremos solo una, la historia de Lola R. de 57 años de edad madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de comida hace ya más de 10 años el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones económicas para ella y su familia y ha sido un sustento en su hogar por mucho tiempo, con el esfuerzo de la venta de  comidas a podido construir a los largo del tiempo su casa de material noble y darles una educación decente a sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo piensa comprar mercadería para su negocio y abastecerse para los próximos meses. Como la señora Lola R. cada integrante del grupo  Asociación Unidas tiene el deseo y el empeño de seguir adelante por el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The enthusiasm and  effort and creativity of this mainly women's group has helped them get ahead with the economic impetus for their businesses and their family.  This is a group made up of 8 members called  Asociación Unidas (United Association).  The group was formed a year ago and they are very confident and supportive of each other since they are all neighbors from the same area.
  Each member has a story to tell but we will only mention one.  Lola R., 57, is the mother of three children.  She has been selling food every day for the past 10 years.  This has helped her, and her family financially, and has been a big support for them for a long time.  With the effort in the sale of the food she has been been able to build her home of good materials over a period of time, and she has given her children a decent education.  With the recent loan she plans to buy supplies for her business and stock up for the next months.  As with Mrs. Lola R. each member of the  Asociación Unidas group has the wish and goal to get ahead for the good of their families.

loans.use: With the recent loan she plans to buy supplies for her business and stock up for the next months.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga M. is a married woman with four children. She has a very hard life caring for such a big family. She started a business in 2003 and since that time she has become very successful and was able to open a men's clothes shop.  Now she is doing great and her husband helps her in this business.

Shafiga has applied for 1000 AZN loan to increase her income by buying more clothes to sell. Shafiga recently finished her loan from Kiva and promises to repay on time as she did with her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Blanca Miriam

texts.es: Blanca Miriam G. D. S. D. 56 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en Tonacatepeque, en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella es una señora la cual trabaja para sostener su hogar y sus necesidades personales, se dedica a la venta D. ropa para mujeres, niños y hombres, su venta se encuentra sobre la calle principal D. Tonacatepeque, un lugar en el cual cuenta con una ubicación muy buena debido a que las personas que se dirigen hacia el mercado pasan enfrente D. su puesto y así mismo esta calle es una D. las vías principales D. acceso por lo que es muy transitado. Blanca cuenta con muy buenas ventas por lo que desea aumentar su inventario, sobre todo comprar mayor cantidad D. pantalones y blusas para mujer, los cuales son los que más venD.. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda lograr lo anterior, esto lo hace con el gran deseo D. mejorar sus ventas y D. esta forma vivir D. una forma más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Miriam G. D. S. is 56 years old.  She lives with her husband and two dependent children in Tonacatepeque, in San Salvador department.  She works to support her household and to cover her personal needs.  She sells women's, children's and men's clothes.  She makes her sales on the main street of Tonacatepeque.  She has a very good location because people heading to the market pass right in front of her stall.  This street is also one of the main routes of access to the city which means that it is very busy.

Blanca has very good sales and so would like to increase her inventory.  Above all she would like to buy more women's pants and blouses which are what she sells the most of.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral which will help her to achieve her goal.  She does this with a great desire to improve her sales and thereby live in a more stable manner with her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristobal vive en casa en anticretico en la zona Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un hijo menor de edad; es casado, el señor es carpintero y su esposa hace labores de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.
El crédito será utilizado para aumentar a sus ahorros y tomar una habitación más en anticrético para tener mayor comodidad.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Cristobal lives in a rental house in Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  He has one dependent child and is married.  Cristobal is a carpenter and his wife does household chores.  He uses the income he makes in his business to support his family.  This is the first time that he has taken a loan.  It will be used to increase his savings and to rent an additional room so that his family is more comfortable.

Cristobal's socio-economic profile qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To rent an additional room for his family's comfort

loans.name: Mrs. Nhoem Phal Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people from the village of Dak Por in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Nhoem P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living. She is a silk weaver who can earn some money to support her family by selling silk cloth. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So, for that purpose, Mrs. Nhoem P. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Vanak Noub, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he grows rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a rock breaker. This couple has three children, one of whom is a student. The others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Reyna Aquilina

texts.es: Reyna Aquilina tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. Ella inicio este medio de vida por su Mama ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a este negocio, Reyna se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena cliente ya que el pago de sus cuotas las realiza en tiempo y forma se encuentra muy contenta con este financiamiento que lo utilizara para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, pan, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Reyna Aquilina is 39. She sells general merchandise. She has had this business for over 15 years, during which time she has proven herself to be a very responsible person. She started this work because of her mother, who had this business previously. Reyna has been a very good client, as she pays her quotas on time and completely. She is very happy to have this loan, which she will use for the purchase of candies, drinks, pop, bread, and basic grains, among other items.

loans.use: working capital; the purchase of candies, drinks, pop, bread, and basic grains, among other items.

loans.name: Floribelia

texts.es:
Floribelia, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en Yamabal, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la sastrería, vive con sus hijas Karla de 9 y Sonia de 5 años de edad en compañía de su esposo.
Floribelia se dedica a confeccionar ropa haciendo vestidos y trajes, trabaja todo el día y de las ganancias por su trabajo mantiene a su familia, este oficio lo aprendió en la academia de corte y confección. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo pues necesita materiales para la confección de ropa como, telas, botones, ciper, hilos de diferentes colores, esto le será de gran ayuda para contar con los materiales  y realizar los trabajos de los clientes.
Sueña con algún día tener un bazar de ropa y además de ayudar a sus hijas con los estudios y el sustento diario, por estas metas ella se esfuerza cada día para que su familia tenga un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
Floribelia is 25 years old and lives in Yamabal in the department of Morazán.  She is a seamstress and lives with her daughters, Karla, 9, and Sonia, 5, together with her husband.

Floribelia makes dresses and suits.  She works all day and uses her income to support her family.  She learned her skill from the sewing academy.  

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and different colored thread.  This will be of great help to her since she will be able to fill customer orders.

She dreams of one day having her own clothing shop and of helping her daughters with their studies and daily living costs.  She works hard everyday to make a difference in her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, zippers, different colored thread

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21 year old single man who has been the owner of a barber shop since 2009 with 11 years of experience. Ali started working early because of his family's low income, so he had to work while he was still a child who needed to play. He is regretting that he did so, because his family comes first and he became mature as he knew life's real face early. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to do necessary renovations to his shop such as changing the painting color, pasting floor tiles and fixing the shop's roof top. Ali might also change his chairs if he saves any money after making the requested changes. Through his last loan, Ali paid for an advertisement for his shop, which came with positive feedback and increased his clients and income at the same time. He was a borrower in good standing, and he's planning to be the same with this requested loan.

loans.use: To do necessary renovations to his barber shop

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La  Señorita Patricia, nacida el la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra el 21 de noviembre de 1988 estado civil soltera, su objetivo de la  señora  es llegar  a  abrir una  sucursal de ventas de salteñas  en el centro de la ciudad , para hacer crecer su negocio, lleva trabajando en la venta de salteñas  1 años, aprendio este oficio debido a que su madre  tiene la misma actividad y el le enseño el oficio , solicito su crédito a emprender el cual se le esta dando el apoyo necesario su crédito será destinado para la compra de un horno y también para la ampliación de su negocio, es una joven emprendedora y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra on November 21st, 1988.  She is single.  Her objective is to open a branch of “salteña” (Bolivian empanada) sales in the center of the city.  She wants to do this to make her business grow.  She has been working selling salteñas for one year.  She learned this business activity because her mother does the same thing.  Her mother taught her the business.

She requested a loan from Emprender, which is giving her the necessary support.  She is an enterprising and very hard-working young woman who has a great desire to succeed.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy an oven to make salteñas

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha C. T. es una Barranquillera que  tiene tres hijos en las edades de 10, 12 y 23 años.  Su principal negocio desde hace 15 años, es fabricar prendas de vestir, disfraces y ropa casual, especialmente en la línea femenina; ella también genera otros ingresos porque tiene un punto de comercialización donde vende además de la ropa que produce, variedades y ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje; Martha vende a través de dos asesoras comerciales  y directamente en empresas, universidades de la ciudad y en su punto de ventas a transeúntes. Ella inició este negocio después de hacer un curso de modistería,  donde aprendió todas las técnicas para diseñar, preparar, ensamblar y acabar  piezas  de vestidos femeninos, y desarrolló su experiencia cuando fue  trabajadora en otras confecciones, así cuando estuvo preparada, inició su propia aventura emprendedora. Al principio compró sus primeros activos fijos e insumos y durante 12 años estuvo organizada en un apartamento con su pequeño taller;  pero como se presentó su primer desafío  porque  sus clientes no llegaban a ese lugar,   arrendó un local  y trasladó su taller, empezando a obtener los resultados esperados  tanto en su volumen de ventas como en su clientela.   Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el primero al que aplica en Kiva, con el planea comprar materias primas e insumos como telas, correderas  e hilos, para fabricar ropa de la temporada como uniformes escolares y también  surtirá su vitrina con papelería y variedades,  aprovechando el entorno en el que circundan estudiantes y profesores. Con su primer financiamiento ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y mejorar los ingresos familiares,  porque ella trabaja en el sueño de incrementar sus capacidades productivas, aumentar sus ingresos y  lograr profesionalizar a sus hijos , con tal de que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Martha C. T. is from Barranquilla.  She has three children aged 10, 12 and 23.  Her main business for the past 15 years has been making garments, costumes and casual clothes, especially for women.  She also makes other income because she has a sales location where, in addition to the clothes she makes, she also sells a variety of other products and offers a photocopying service.

Martha sells her products through two commercial consultants and directly to companies and universities in the city.  She also sells her products from her sales location to passersby.  Martha started her business after having followed a course in dressmaking where she learned all the techniques necessary for designing, preparing, assembling and putting the finishing touches to women's dresses.  She developed her experience as she worked on other dressmaking projects.  When she was ready, she started her own entrepreneurial adventure.  She bought her first fixed assets and supplies and, for 12 years, she worked out of an apartment, in a small workshop.  However, her first business challenge was that customers didn't come to her workplace so she rented premises and moved her workshop.  She started to obtain the results she hoped for both in terms of sales volume and in number of customers.

This is Martha's second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first through Kiva.  She plans to use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, zippers and threads for making seasonal clothes such as school uniforms.  She will also stock her display cabinet with stationery and other products, taking advantage of the fact that her business is located in an area surrounded by students and teachers.  With her first loan, Martha managed to increase her working capital and improve her family income.  She is working on realizing her dream of increasing her production capacity, increasing her income and helping her children to become professionals so that they can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabrics, zippers and threads for making clothes

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia Del Carmen tiene 52 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba un medio de vida para mantener a sus 6 hijos, inicio por medio de una amiga que le dio la idea de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, fue así que decide obtener esta fuente de ingresos. Su deseo es que su hija finalice sus estudios, para que sea una gran profesional. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, pan, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en: Lucia Del Carmen is a 52-year-old woman who owns a general store. She has been in business for over 8 years, getting her start because she needed a way to support her 6 children. Her friend gave her the idea of setting up a general store in her home, which was how she decided on this source of income. She would like for her daughter to finish her studies so that she can become a professional. The loan that she is requesting is for purchasing beans, sugar, cooking oil, candy, bread, juice, and soda pop.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, cooking oil, candy, bread, juice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Kimir Ene

texts.en:
Kimir Ene L. is 33 year old, married and has 2 children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last 6 years, with a monthly profit margin of 5,000 KES. 

She learned about KADET from the KADET staff. She paid the previous loans well, and has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD, which she would use to purchase agricultural inputs.


She hopes to use the profit generated from the loan to expand farming. She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a hard-working woman who puts a lot of effort into her work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Her spouse is a driver. She has no other dependents and her family goal is building a house for her children. She lives in her own home with her family of seven. For 15 years, she has been operating a retail shop and she faces the challenge of inadequate capital. She hopes that in the future her shop will grow to a wholesale business. Faith needs a loan to buy sugar, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive por el sector de San Antonio en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente tiene  un corazón muy calido y se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y la agricultura, esta parroquia cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

Doña María tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda economícamente y sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una camioneta, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María hace 17 años tiene una tienda de comestibles en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de  pollos y cuyes los que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Está en el banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, etc. para seguir ampliando su tienda.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria M.  is a member of the Cumbe communal bank.  She lives in the San Antonio area in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate but its people are very warm and they work in the business of raising animals and farming.  This parish has lovely places to visit and to appreciate its natural beauty.

Maria is 44 married, and she has 3 children: 21, 18 and 16. Her oldest son works and helps with expenses, and her two other children are  in a city school.  Her husband is a driver and drives a van. With the two of them working they have been able to build their own house .


Maria has had a grocery store for the past 17 years and she works every day of the week with no regular schedule.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs for the family to eat and also to sell.

She has been with the bank for 13 years and she will use the new loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts, etc, to continue enlarging her store.

Her goal is for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, actividad que lo ejerce en el interior de su casa, en donde escogió un espacio para ser una granja. 
Asimismo se dedica en la venta productos o artículos para el hogar así como mercería, y los ofrece de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales. Es así como se desarrolla sus días de trabajo, durante el día vende cuyes, en donde sus hijos la apoyan distribuyendo a los clientes que previamente han solicitado la cantidad de éstos animales y durante el resto del día, vende sus productos. Para ella lo más rentable es la venta de cuyes, por lo que se intensifica en su crianza y limpieza de sus galpones, así evitar enfermedades, que puede ocasionar serias pérdidas en su capital (cuyes) y sus ganancias. Por tanto desea continuar capacitándose en las técnicas de crianza de cuyes y tener su granja con los estándares de calidad. Por ello pide de su apoyo para que se concreten sus objetivos. Este será su crédito número 19 con MFP,  por lo que manifiesta que le servirá mucho este aporte para concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de maderas y rejillas para nuevos galpones de su granja.
texts.en:
Julia, 47, lives with her husband and four children in her own house.  For over five years she’s been raising guinea pigs at home where she selected a space to set up her farm.  She also sells articles for the home as well as notions in an ambulatory manner at various markets.  This is how her work days unfold: during the day she sells guinea pigs, her children help her distribute them to customers who have previously ordered a certain number of these animals and during the rest of the day she sells her products.  For her, the guinea pig sales are the most profitable which is why she intensifies their care and cleaning the sheds to prevent illnesses which can cause serious loss of capital (guinea pigs) and profits.  Therefore, she wants to continue to learn guinea pig raising techniques to have a farm with the highest quality standards.  Because of this, she’s asking for your help to reach these goals.

This will be her loan #19 with MFP.  She states that it will be very helpful in the pursuit of her goals.  She will use the requested loan to buy lumber and lattices for new enclosures in her farm.

loans.use: to buy lumber and lattices to build more guinea pig enclosures.

loans.name: Talhada

texts.en:
Talhada is 39 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Talhada works very hard to provide for them.

Talhada buys and sells nipa palm fronds in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa to sell.

Talhada has been in this business for 23 years.

In the future, Talhada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of nipa palm fronds to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married with 4 children. She is 44 years old and lives in Sindangan.
For 3 years, Luzminda has been selling a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 11,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 to purchase more products for her retail store.
Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her retail store

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es: Balbino tiene  56 años, es un hombre responsable. Junto a su esposa Adela y sus 2 hijos, vive en armonía familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. El trabajo al que se dedica esté laborioso hombre, es la agricultura. Ya tiene 40 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades, los que después de fertilizarlos y cosecharlos los comercializa en la costa del país, viajando constantemente en temporadas de cosecha, asimismo trabaja con el camión que posee, en el traslado de papa al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, así como también en el servicio de trasporte de cargamento de diferentes variedades ya sea  verduras, frutas y demás productos alimenticios a diferentes lugares del país, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Ahora tiene sembrado papa, en las variedades de yungay y andina, sobre sus 7 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde tiene pensado ampliar para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades y trasportarlos a diferente puntos del país. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al poyo que recibido durante todo este tiempo. Asimismo pide que lo apoyen  nuevamente para continuar con sus objetivos, comprometiéndose a cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente. Balbino de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de papa de las variedades denominadas “canchan, única y pricholi”, asimismo varios sacos de abono orgánico para continuar con éxito sus próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Balbino is 56 years old.  He is a responsible man who lives in family harmony together with his wife Adela and their two children.  They live in their own home which is located in the small village of San Juan, La Libertad.

This hard-working man is a farmer.  He has 40 years experience growing all varieties of potatoes.  After fertilizing and harvesting his potatoes, he sells them on the coast, travelling there constantly during harvest seasons.  He also works with a truck that he owns, transporting potatoes to the wholesale market in the town of Tarma.  He also transports cargo of different types such as vegetables, fruit and other food product, to other parts of the country.  This makes him better profits.

Balbino is currently growing yungay and andina varieties of potato on his 7 hectares of farmland.  He is thinking of expanding his land so that he can grow in larger quantities and transport his crops to different parts of the country.

Balbino is a member of the "Capital Semillera" community bank and this is his eighth loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the support that he has received up to now.  He asks you to support him once again so that he can continue achieving his goals.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments punctually.  With your support, Balbino will invest the money he has requested in buying canchan, única and pricholi varieties of potato seed.  He will also buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that he can continue working successfully with his upcoming harvests.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and rabbits.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y turística (cuenta con sitios arqueológicos).

Desde hace algunos años Edilberto se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (vacas, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y su respectivo alimento, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Edilberto con trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado sacar adelante poco a poco a su familia, algo que le da mucha alegría.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 42, lives with his wife and children in his own home, which has the basic utilities, located in the rural region of the Zaña district which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. This area is characterized by its crop and animal agriculture and tourist activity (it has some archeological sites). 

For a number of years Edilberto has devoted himself to selling farm animals (cows, sheep and poultry). He raises them in pens he has at the back of his house and feeds them commercial feed, grains and natural grasses. Once they have finished growing he sells them to his customers or in various marketplaces in the area. With the income he will be able to cover his family obligations. 

He has sought a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian soles to purchase animals and their respective feeds. Once he fattens them he sells them to his customers. With the earnings he obtains he will pay off the loan that was given him and improve his quality of life. Edilberto with work and effort has been able to make small, steady improvements for his family, something that makes him very happy.

loans.use: to purchase animals and their respective feeds.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en: Helimatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 28 years ago in the city of Kenema, she is married to a driver and the couple has two children – one in primary school and the other in secondary school. Helimatu sells palm-oil, the country’s most popular cooking oil, and has been running this business for many years now. She has requested a loan of 500,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Katente Unity Group

texts.en:
Margret sells hard liquor in Mubende. The 50-year-old married mother of seven has been in this business for about a decade now. Her income over time has been growing steadily. She earns about 40,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) per week as profit. This has enabled her to pay fees for her seven children who are in school.

Margret has a ready market for her product. Her customers are the local people from the area. She conducts this business from home. With a Kiva loan, she plans to buy more materials like drums and molasses to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy more materials like drums and molasses to increase her production.

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан 45 лет, вдова и воспитывает двух детей. Кундузкан по специальности медсестра, но учитывая небольшую зарплату медицинских работников, ей пришлось искать источник дополнительного дохода для своей семьи. После развала Союза, Кындузкан решила начать свой собственный бизнес в продаже детской одежды и обуви, и школьной формы. При стартовом капитале в сумме 500 советских рублей, Кундузкан приложила огромные усилия в развития своего бизнеса и добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день ежемесячный оборот составляет  около 30,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от ее предпринимательской деятельности позволили Кундузкан купить машину  «Фольксваген Пассат». В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Кундузкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп сезонного ассортимента детских  товаров. В будущем, Кундузкан мечтает купить дом для своего сына.
texts.en: Kunduzkan is 45 years old and a widow  raising two children. Kunduzkan is a registered nurse by profession, but, given the low salaries of medical personnel, she had to seek an additional source of income of her family. After the Soviet Union had fallen apart, Kunduzkan decided to start her own business to sell children’s clothing, shoes and school uniforms. With  a starting capital of 500 Soviet Rubels, Kunduzkan made a huge effort to grow her business and achieved success – now her monthly sales are about 30,000 KGS. The income from her business allowed Kunduzkan to purchase a Volkswagen Passat. In order to develop her business further, Kunduzkan turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” in order to obtain a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to stock up on seasonal goods for children. In the future, Kunduzkan’s dream is to be able to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 30 years old and married with 2 young children.

Grace has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. She also started raising pigs to augment her income. Grace plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets, and feed. Grace hopes that she would be able to manage her businesses well. She also hopes to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets, and feed

loans.name: Anie Khemper

texts.en:
Anie Khemper is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Anie Khemper has a retail shop that sells fish like mackerel & sardines. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell 
.
Anie Khemper is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anie Khemper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 17 and 14.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farm business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dimas Wilfrido

texts.es:
Dimas Wilfrido tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.
Dimas se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener comprar más tierra y sembrar más.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  jugar el indor.
texts.en:
Dimas Wilfrido is 20. He is single, has no children, and lives with his parents in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province.
The Monte de Los Olivos Communal Bank is located in the San Jose del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the office. The group has 14 members, male and female, who work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn, oranges and cocoa.
Dimas works in agriculture, sowing corn, oranges and cocoa. He buys and sells his products in the Chillanes Canton. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer in order to keep his crops in good condition.
This loan will be very helpful for him, because it will allow him to have a better quality of life. The most frequent challenges that he encounters are: competition and pests. His dream is to buy more land and plant more crops.
In his free time he enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 32 years old and married with two children. She owns a business selling cows. Liberatha works from 6 am until 6 pm every day, and she currently employs one person to help her. This is her third successful year in the business.

Liberatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her animal sales business. She will save any additional profits so that in the future she can reinvest in her business and be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
To earn a living, Josie helps her husband in planting vegetables for sale. She is now 51 years old and has seven adult children. In farming, they experienced problems and difficulties due to typhoons or drought, but they are not discouraged in managing their farm lots for it is the major source of their income. Through their patience and hard work, most of their children have finished their educations. 

They aimed to increase their vegetable production to earn a higher income and to satisfy their basic necessities. She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in squash production. They hope that they will be having a fruitful harvest and give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in squash production

loans.name: Kigarama Kwehayo Group

texts.en:
Farming has been Kellen's source of livelihood for close to 20 years now. The high-spirited mother of five principally grows cash crops, to wit: bananas, millet, maize, cassava and beans.

She has brought to bear unwavering diligence and a strong sense of determination through the 20 years. This, in many respects, unravels her longevity. Monthly, this business generates her sales profits totaling to UGX 200,000.

She says she intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase high-grade manure for her farms, and the rest of the loan money will be used in the hiring of new labor.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure for her farms and to hire new labor.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She  lives in Uganda and also takes care of additional orphaned family members. For the past eight years, Nulu has run a business selling charcoal. She works six days out of the week, selling her product wholesale from her home. Nulu also generates additional income through renting rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She lives in a house that she owns without access to electricity or running water. Nulu's major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding her family. 

Nulu is requesting an 80,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to the nearby villages for charcoal and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joahna

texts.en:
Joahna is a 28-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. 

She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years.

Joahna is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil for sale.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children who are four and six years old. He describes himself as honest and effective.

Samson operates a retail shop where he sells cooking oil, rice, flour, sugar etc. He has been involved in this business for a year. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are residents of neighboring villages. He says his biggest business challenge is having insufficient funds to improve the retail shop. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy baking flour, milk and cooking oil. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulbs, testers, extensions and soldering wires.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent used the previous loan to buy tea for planting. He is a 55-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent home. 

For 16 years, he has been growing tea, and the business has been very profitable since he is near a tea factory and thus assured of a ready market. His hardships are seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation, while his vision is diversifying his business to include a retail shop, buying land to grow more tea and hiring employees to help expand his business. Vincent is requesting a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 34 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maricar has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Maricar requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to sell.

Maricar has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maricar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa A. was born in Niamey (Republic of Niger) on April 23, 1959. Coming from a family of nine children, she could not continue in school. So, at a very early age, she started learning how to make and sell corn mush. She was able to save a little money from this business and expanded into general grocery items sold from a display located in front of her house. Business is booming, allowing her to help with household expenses, since she is married and the mother of four. Today, Ms. A. would like to go professional by opening up a shop, but she lacks the funds to do so. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000 to open a shop, that she will call «Chez Yawano» and to widen the range of goods for sale. Her experience as a merchant to-date will guarantee the success of her plans.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Yawa est née à Niamey (République du Niger) le 23 avril 1959. Fille d’une famille de neuf (09) enfants, elle n’a pu avancer dans les études et commença très tôt à préparer et à vendre de la bouillie à base du maïs. Elle réalisa un peu d’économie à partir de cette activité et entreprit la vente des produits d’alimentation générale sur une étagère devant sa maison. Ce commerce prend un essor rapide, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux charges de son ménage car elle mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Aujourd’hui, Mme A. veut rendre professionnelle son activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique mais elle n’a pas assez de moyens pour réaliser ce projet. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir la boutique et d’élargir la gamme des ses produits. L’expérience que Mme A. a acquise dans ce domaine est une garantie pour le succès de l’activité.

loans.use: To stock and sell general grocery items

loans.name: Wartisem

texts.en: W. is a 45 year-old mother with one child, aged 20. She has been managing her business by selling cooked foods in a small restaurant for 20 years. She usually earns $10 per day. She opens the small restaurant from 5 pm – 2 am everyday. Her husband, Dakir, is a fisherman and sells fish in the fish market, earning $2. She needs a bigger loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Small restaurant

loans.name: Dusti

texts.en:
Dusti has been in his business for over 7years. He began his business with $100. His business is situated in the center of Mastchoh market. Due to financial difficulties in his family, he must earn money to support them.  

He started his activity with a limited number of goods to sell. Soon he became a MicroInvest client and could increase sales in his business. He routinely disburses his loan. In the future he plans to open one more trading location.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous C., 25 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband, a construction worker, their two children, and her parents.  Mrs. Yous C. works as a farmer, raising mostly pigs and growing some other crops.  She will use this loan to purchase pigs and feed for her farm.  In the future, she hopes to raise more animals like ducks and chickens.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed to raise on her farm.

loans.name: Olga Violeta

texts.en:
Olga Violet G., age 56, owns and operates a general store called "The Estrellita" (little star) where she sells everyday foods and household needs. Olga explains she started her business as mini-store years ago with just a few products and has been able to grow her tienda to a well stocked neighborhood grocery store. Despite the many small tiendas that have sprung up around her, she continues to grow her business little bit by little bit. With this loan she will buy more supplies for her store and also purchase pigs to raise to sell when fully grown. She admits working with pigs is difficult and one needs to have a lot of love to work with these animals. She knows how profitable raising pigs can be and because of this good business sense she has been able to stay one step ahead of her growing competition.

She is married and is able to read and write. Her children are all grown and living on their own. Her dream is to continue growing her tienda and raising pigs because knows how much they have helped her and her family increase their quality of life. If only the chronic arthritis in her hands and feet had a cure, her quality of life would be even better. But despite her painful arthritis she continues walking and working every day.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase pigs and also inventory for her small store

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en: S. Mirzoali is an experienced butcher, as he has been in this business 7 years. He is married and has 5 children. According to him, this is a family business as his father and grandfather were butchers too.In fact, he now has his two elder sons apprenticing him in the store. The turnover of his business is fast and he is not hoping to buy two bulls for his business. He plans to use his loan to increase the amount of meat he has available because the people of Tadjikistan usually buy save reserves of broiled meat for the winter season.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Puapae

texts.en:
Puapae is 29 years old. She is a single mother with one child. She runs her own elei (traditional Samoan fabric) printing business in Vaimoso, where she lives. She is one of the longest running members of SPBD. Her first loan in 2004 helped her to start her elei printing business. She is good at printing and also making different designs, which is why people buy from her at the market.

Paupae is now applying for her fifth loan so she can expand her business, improve her home and also help the family grocery shop. She earns a profit of $200 WST ($80 USD). She will use this money to send her child to school, meet her family's needs and pay back what she owes to SPBD.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her elei printing business and for home improvement

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoen T., age 66, and her husband have been married over forty years. They have six children—four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and living elsewhere, and the other two live under their custody; one of them is a construction worker, and the other one weaves silk at home. Phoen and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production when she was twenty years old. Her husband grows rice and plants vegetables.

Phoen is requesting her second loan, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy silk materials for weaving and to expand her family's farming business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving, and to expand farming business

loans.name: Khatima

texts.en:
Khatima (her husband is pictured) is a mother of one child. She is a 33 year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She and her family settled in the Fizuli region of Kurdmahmudlu village.

This family has been in this business for four years. Now, they need a loan of $950 to buy a cow to obtain more milk and earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Community Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, located at block 8 Jr. Alfonso Ugarte in the district of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and single. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Currently, she has a stall in the Bellavista market, getting up early to sell her juanes (rice-stuffed leaves) and tamales, and in the afternoons she buys the raw ingredients which she needs to prepare her dishes. She then goes to bed early to prepare for tomorrow’s work.

With this loan of 1300 Soles, which will be repaid in five months, she will invest in the purchase of rice, oil, condiments, eggs, meat, sugar, plantain, and regional fruits. Zoila feels very content with her business and with all her achievements.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 8, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es soltera. Ella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado de Bellavista, se levanta muy temprano para ir a vender sus juanes, tamales, en las tardes compra sus insumos que necesitara para la preparación de sus comidas, y descansa temprano para la faena del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de: arroz, aceite, condimentos, huevos, carnes, azúcar, plátano, y fruta regionales. Zoila se siente muy bien con su negocio y con logros alcanzados

loans.use: Purchase provisions for the sale of her food products

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Enriqueta Rengifo de Vargas is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Victorias." She lives in the Juanjui district, San Martin region, Mariscal Caceres province. She rents out a place to run her grocery store, which is located in the La Punta neighborhood. She sells a variety of goods such as candies, carbonated drinks, and other food products for daily consumption. When her husband retired from working for a state institution, the couple decided to use the money that he received to start a small business. With the loan from Banco Comunal, the business grew. Today their business is well-stocked with a variety of products. With a loan in the amount of 1000.00 sols, which will be repaid in 6 months, she'll buy: different types and brands of packaged pasta, canned goods, sacks of sugar and rice, and bottles of cooking oil because these foodstuffs are much needed in the area. She will also stock her shelves with carbontaed drinks and candies. Enriqueta, 61, has 3 daughters. She is a persevering woman who fights for what she wants. She is a survivor because she overcame a serious disease and today serves as an example for her family who always stands by her side.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Enriqueta Rengifo de Vargas, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Victorias ” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui su negocio está ubicado en en un local especialmente alquilado para este propósito que se ubica en el Barrio La punta donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Al jubilarse su esposo que trabajaba en una institución del estado, con el dinero producto de su liquidación deciden poner un pequeño negocio, con el préstamo del Banco Comunal se incremento, hoy en día tienen un negocio bien surtido de variados productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagar en 6 meses , comprará: fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en botellas de ha litros litro; debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su estock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Ella tiene 61 años de edad, 03 hijas, es una mujer perseverante y luchadora que dio ejemplo de vida al sobreponerse a una grave enfermedad y que hoy sirve de ejemplo para su familia que siempre se mantiene muy unida a ella. ,

loans.use: To buy large amounts of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Sipros

texts.en:
Sipros is a 37-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Sagam Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and seven children. Sipros set up a fruit and vegetable stand near her home in 2007. Her hard work, determination and excellent people-skills have led to her success within the one-year period. She has been able to generate enough income to cover her household expenses. She plans to use the funds from her loan of $500 to purchase more stock of vegetables, and also supplement her current business with the sale of cereals.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is newly married and thanks Sinapi for helping him. After learning the tailoring trade, Michael did not have the start up capital to begin a business but a friend introduced him Sinapi and he secured a loan to start out on his own. Since Sinapi has helped him, Michael has decided to train others and has now recruited four people to train. He wants to use the loan to buy an embroidery machine and sewing materials to expand his operation. He hopes that  this loan will also help his wife to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a self-sacrificing mother of 3 girls who are very young and they are the reason Doris makes such an effort with her work every day. She sells fruit ice lollies which she makes in her own home. They are very popular as she lives in a very hot area. With her earnings from this business, Doris can pay for the daily needs of her family.

One of her wishes is to be able to save up enough money to build her own house as she and her daughters currently live in one made of pre-fabricated materials.

This mother turns to you for a loan which she will invest in her business - in the purchase of fruit and the little bags she uses to produce the ice lollies. She hopes that little by little she can save up enough to build her very own home.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Doris es una madre abnegada de 3 niñas que están aún muy pequeñas, y son el motivo por el cual Doris se esfuerza cada día trabajando.Ella se dedica a la venta de chupetes de fruta (hielo), que fabrica en su propia casa y su consumo es muy común porque vive en una zona muy calurosa.Con las ganancias de este oficio, Doris puede pagar el costo diario de las necesidades de su familia. Y uno de sus deseos es poder ahorrar para construir su casa, ya que ella y sus hijas viven en un ambiente de material prefabricado.Esta madre recurre a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de fruta y las bolsitas para la fabricación de sus chupetes. Espera que poco a poco pueda ahorra para construir su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for the production of fruit ice lollies

loans.name: Erick Danilo

texts.es:
Erick L., a 22 year-old small merchant, has a small grocery store in his house. From a very young age, he began selling sweets, but because he didn’t have capital and because of his age, he wasn’t eligible for a loan. Through the years, though, he has learned to manage his business and make it grow until became the store that it is today. He does not yet have children, so he says that all of his strength and dedication go to his store. He hopes to be able to have a better life when he marries and has children. The loan will be used to buy products, like basic grains and perishable goods, to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Erick L., un joven que a sus 22 años es un pequeño comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Empezó desde muy joven vendiendo golosinas, ya que no contaba con capital y por su edad no era apto para un crédito. Pero a través de los años ha aprendido a manejar su negocio y hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en la pulpería que es ahora. Todavía no tiene niños, así que él cuenta que todo su esfuerzo y dedicación están en la pulpería. Espera poder tener una vida con mejores condiciones para cuando se case y tenga hijos. El crédito será usado en la compra de productos para inversión en su negocio, como son granos básicos y productos perecederos.

loans.use: To buy products to supply his small grocery store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. sells groceries like milk, Milo, and different kinds of canned products at Elmina. Sarah has received no education. She is a widow and has 5 children. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and her children's school fees. She plans to use the loan to buy more product to resell to increase her income. She hopes to use the increased profit from her business to improve her children's education.

loans.use: Buy more products to sell in the grocery store to increase income

loans.name: Dianes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Daines from Dar es Salaam, a divorced woman with three children between the ages of 25 and 31 years. Daines has been operating a bar business since 2003. Her bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting 'mishikaki' (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.

Daines 's business is doing well as she works 16 hours per day, seven days per week, assisted by three employees. She currently earns about $100 monthly and is requesting a loan of $250 in order to buy additional stocks of beer and soda. In the future, she plans to purchase more equipment including tables, chairs and glasses. Daines thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soda and beer in bulk for her bar.

loans.name: Hamidan Rahmat Ali Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is the wife of R. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a shuttering business. Her younger son is an electrician.

Hamidan baji’s husband is a building contractor. Hamidan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy wooden beams for her son’s shuttering business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a horse cart to carry loads. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to carry loads. Nawab baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wooden beams for shuttering business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is a trader who sells drinks and sachets water. She purchases the drinks and sachets water from distributors in Benin City to sell to her customers. Florence is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She requests a $425 loan to purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mr. Leng T., born in 1983 and residing in Chek Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer with 1.5-hectares of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He is now requesting a loan to buy more rice seeds and fertilizer to support the field. Leng’s wife, Mrs. Loy Sokchan, helps him on the plantation.

Leng T. is 25 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is yet too young to begin studying.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes Espirita

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Bancomunal Luz de la Esperanza.
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 36 años y tres hijos 15, 14, y 5 años todos estudian en el colegio Ollantay.
A Mercedes siempre le gustado el negocio, hoy en día tiene una pequeña tienda se llama “Mechita “pero ella empezó vendiendo  salchi-papas en la puerta de su casa con al ayuda de sus hijos, y cuando hay campeonatos de deporte por su barrio sale a vender tallarín con chanfainita, su esposo es guardián en una construcción. 
Desde que esta en Finca a progresado económicamente, su casita era de esteras ahora es de madera, esta muy contenta, aprendió a separar el negocio de las amistades, a no gastarse su capital de trabajo, y darle buen uso a sus ganancias.

Necesita un préstamo de 1200, soles para surtir la pequeña tienda que funciona en su casa y comprar abarrotes como, leche, arroz, aceite y gaseosas.    
El sueño de ella es tener un negocio de restaurante, con sus hijos por que le gusta la cocina; y que Finca siga ayudando a más mujeres.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of "Bancomunal Light of Hope". Mercedes is 36 years old, and lives with her partner and her three children, ages 15, 14, and 5 years who all study at Ollantay school. Mercedes has always liked business. These days, she has a small shop called "Mechita", but she began selling by "salchipapas" (a fast food dish consisting of hot dog and potatoes) from the door of her house with the help of her children. When there are sports championships in her neighborhood, Mercedes sells noodles. Her husband is a building custodian. Since she has been with Finca (the microfinance partner), Mercedes has progressed economically. Her house was previously made of wooden mats, and is now made of wood. Mercedes is very happy. She has learned to separate business from friendship, not to spend her working capital, and put her profits to good use. Mercedes needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Soles to stock up the small shop that she runs from her house, and buy groceries like milk, rice, oil and soft drinks. Her dream is to start a restaurant business with her children as she likes to cook, and that Finca continues to help more women.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nelly De Jesús

texts.es:
NELLY, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Aguarico n° 299 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 37 años de edad, 02 hijos, y es enfermera.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró tela de algodón, elásticos, hilos, blondas, aguja para su maquina de coser, para la confección de sus ropas interiores (calzones, braceares), ropas de dormir, etc. a raíz del fallecimiento de su esposo se dedicó a la confección, con las ganancias que obtuvo se compró un motokar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró varios repuestos para su motokar, arreglo su motor, pinto su chasis.
Ella está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo y la comprensión, que siga apoyando a todos las mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Vecinas Unidas, located on Jr. Aguarico n° 299 in the Callería district. She is 37, has two children and is a nurse. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought cotton cloth, elastic, thread, textiles, a needle for her sowing machine, all for the confection of undergarments, pajamas, etc. Since the passing of her husband, she has been dedicated to confectionery. With her earnings, she bought a motokar. With this new S/. 1,000 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase replacement parts for her motokar, fix its motor and paint its chassis. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support and understanding. May she continue to support women who want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motokar replacement parts, engine repair and paint for chassis

loans.name: Galu

texts.en:
Galu N., 36, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the villagers and the public two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Galu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be used to maintain business needs.

loans.use: Purchase bingo supplies

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke A. is a 43-year-old married mother of four children and lives in Igbo-eleri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs, a business skill she acquired from her mother. Romoke has been in business for the past ten years and has been borrowing from Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO), for over two years. Romoke needs the loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es: La señora Manuela es una mujer luchadora que ha sobresalido en las ventas de tortilla desde horas muy tempranas se levanta para ir a moler el maíz ya que por las noche lo deja nesquizado, luego comienza su jornada como todo los día a palmear sus ricas y calientes tortilla que son vendidas y consumidas por los Nicaragüense es uno de los alimentos que se consume mucho. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez, tiene dos hijos de 9 y14 años de edad, que cursan la primaria, su esposo es supervisor de servicios de seguridad. Ella inicio con la venta de tortilla con dinero propio para apoyar  a su esposo para cubrir las necesidades diarias, con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones con su familia. Sus planes es poder seguir ofreciendo sus productos a otros clientes para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Manuela is a fighter who has stood out in tortilla sales. Bright and early she rises to begin grinding corn, since at night she leaves it to cook. She then starts her day like every other, making her hot and tasty tortillas that she sells to be consumed by Nicaraguans; tortillas are a large part of the diet. She's 39 years old, residing in the Enrique Bermúdez neighborhood. She has two kids, ages 9 and 14, that are in grade school. Her husband is supervisor of security services. She started selling tortillas with her own money to help her husband cover the daily costs. With this loan she wants to buy construction materials to build a room to have better living conditions for her family. Her plans are to be able to continue offering her products to other customers to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a room

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells groceries. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Comfort is 44 years old and married with five children. She says thank you, and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia E. is 26 years old. She is married with a single child who is currently in school. Sophia lives with her family at Mankessim in the coastal region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who has been selling yams for 2 years now. She buys her fresh yams from farming villages around her town and sells them to her retail customers at a profit.

She wants to use the loan to buy more tubers of yam to store and sell them in small lots to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the community group called “Eye Adom” (translated, Grace) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and through supporting each other, repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy yam in bulk

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia Lorena M. T. vive en Zacatecoluca  ubicado en el departamento La paz. Silvia tiene 27 años de edad. Silvia tiene pareja pero por motivos económicos él se encuentra  fuera del país y le ayuda con remesas mensuales. Silvia se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda con productos de consumo diario y ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio, ya que carece de productos que sus clientes le demandan. Anteriormente Silvia ha obtenido otros créditos, los cuales ya cancelo y fue muy puntual en todas sus cuotas asignadas.
texts.en:
Silvia Lorena M. T. lives in Zacatecoluca located in the department of La Paz. Silvia is 27 years old. Silvia has a couple but because of the economic situation he is out of the country and helps her with monthly remittances. Silvia works at her grocery store and now she is requesting a loan because she wants to stock her business, because she is missing some products her clients demand. Silvia requested other loans before which were all paid on time each and every quote.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Takku Liggey 13 Teffes Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Liggey 13  Teffes regroupe des femmes et des hommes habitant un quartier en bordure de mer dans la ville côtière de Mbour située à 70 km de Dakar la capitale Sénégalaise. Ils s’activent dans des activités telles que la vente de chaussures, de tissus, de la restauration et de la pêche. Les revenus tirés de leurs différentes activités leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Avec le prêt qu’ils sollicitent ils veulent renforcer leur activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey 13 Teffes brings together women and men who live in a seaside area of the coastal city of Mbour, located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. They are active in business, such as in selling shoes and fabrics, food catering, and fishing. The revenues derived from their different activities enable them to look after their children. With this loan they’re requesting, they want to bolster their commercial businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina S. is 36 years old and she now lives in Phum Thom Village in Kandal province. She is a good housewife in her family. Her husband, Mr. Sout Sam, is a motorbike repairer. He is on the right in the photo. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Although Mr. Sout Sam tries to work hard, he still earns less income than needed to support his children’s studying. Thus, Mrs. Dina S. decided to ask for a loan to support her children in their studying. She hopes her children will improve their education and have the opportunity to find a good job in the future.

loans.use: To support her children in their studying

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice Q., who received no formal education, is married with five dependents.  Beatrice sells fish in Elmina, a business she has operated for some time now. She uses her income to pay for school fees and other bills and will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to save money and educate her children.

loans.use: Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria, 43 years old and married with eight children, sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a refrigerator for the cooling of drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie S., 55 years old is a rice and corn grower. She has three children. Her eldest is 34 and all her children are now living separately. She was a CEVI client since 2000. She likes its services especially that it offers a very lo interest rate of 2% a month.

She wanted to grow her business. Receiving a loan therefore is very worthwhile since she was not able to pay yet the laborers who work for land preparation. She will also invest some of the money to other business ventures.

She likes CEVI services a lot a she said that she will not quit joining the program because it truly beneficial for her business growth.

loans.use: to pay the farm laborers

loans.name: Jehovah Group

texts.en: Agyei is thirty – nine years old. He is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Agyei is a trader. He runs a licensed chemical store. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Jehovah. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Saahkem

texts.en:
(
Born in 1954, D. is married with seven children; she lives in Musang, within the urban town of Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, D. plans to invest in Roasting of fish and frying of gateaux.  She plans to buy fresh fish, charcoal and spices for the roasting of fish. She will also buy flour, yeast, firewood, Sugar, groundnut oil, frying pan and spoon which will enable her to fry her gateaux.
