This is D. seven  loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 1999.She has a great deal of experience in her business; added to that, she will be selling in schools during lunch break.  Over the years, her customers have been increasing on regular basis. She also has an excellent site for her business which is located near the road and is accessible to many people.

She plans to use the profit from her business to build a house and pay her children school fees. She will also reinvest part in the business. The rest will be used to clothe her children, provide medical assistance to her family, and feed her family.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish, spices, flour, sugar, groundnut oil, yeast, firewood, frying pan and spoon and paying of rents.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Gibrilla L. was born in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years old and is married to a business woman. Together they have four children. Three of their children are in primary schools; one child is in secondary school.

Gibrilla is requesting a loan of about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leone (SLL) in order to pay school fees and other school-related charges for his children.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees and other school-related charges.

loans.name: Jelie

texts.en:
Jelie D. C. is 44 years old and married to Alfredo D. C.. They are blessed with three children named Edelfa, Geoffrey, and Alfredo, Jr. Jelie's husband is tiring of doing field activities. Her children are close to adult age; her eldest child is taking his studies but Jelie does not have enough money to send her children to school. Jelie is a direct seller of Avon products, her only source of income in their village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Her business is not easy because it requires looking for new customers to buy the products that she is selling.

Jelie walks around her village to look for her customers to buy what she is selling. Her business requires her to visit Avon, the company, if her customers have orders. She incurs expenses in fares, because when her customers have orders she needs to go to the company. She does not have enough capital to get an inventory of Avon products to decrease her fare expenses. She wants to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for additional capital of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marta Eugenia

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Marta Eugenia B. Siú tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos todos adultos, es abogada y administra un negocio de venta de comida y refrescos desde hace mas de 15 años. Este negocio era propiedad de su mama (actualmente fallecida) desde hace unos 40 años y bastante reconocido en esta ciudad de Bluefields.

En el negocio de la señora B. se venden sorbetes, desayunos, refrescos naturales y gaseosas y comida a la carta. Además se venden queques para cumpleaños como otros productos complementarios para este tipo de actividades.

Sus clientes son habitantes de esta ciudad que por un lado llegan al negocio a consumir sus productos como también a realizar encargos principalmente de queques para cumpleaños y bodas.

La microempresaria B. esta solicitando  se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

2 Quintales de Azúcar a US 35 dólares cada quintal, 2 cajas de leche a US 45 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de mantequilla a US 35 dólares cada caja, 80 libras de pollo a US 1.30 dólares cada libra, 3 cajillas de huevos US 30 dólares cada cajilla y 2 quintales de  harina a US 38 dólares cada quintal.
texts.en:
Marta, the micro-entrepreneur, is 50 years old, and a single mother with 4 children, all adults. She is a lawyer and has administered a business that sells food and soft drinks for over15 years. The business was the property of her mother (now deceased) for some 40 years and is well known here in the City of Bluefields.

Marta's business sells sherbets, breakfasts, natural and bottled drinks, and food a la carte. In addition, she sells birthday cakes and other complementary products for such occasions.

Her customers are inhabitants of this city who come to the business to consume its products as well as to place orders, principally for birthday and wedding cakes.

Marta is soliciting financing for the following products: 2 quintales of sugar at $35 per quintal, 2 cases of milk at $45 per case, 2 cartons of butter at $35 each, 80 lbs. of chicken at $1.30 per pound, 3 cases of eggs at $30 per case, and 2 quintals of flour at $38 per quintal.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUGAR, MILK, BUTTER, CHICKEN, EGGS, AND FLOUR

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
MARIA ELENA MOYANO

María Elena Moyano es un grupo conformado por 11 socios, son muy organizados y eso lo demuestran en su trayectoria crediticia ya que cursan el 15ª ciclo. Este grupo lo conforman personas que viven en un mismo lugar y se conocen muchos años, la presidenta Sonia es la fundadora del grupo y es una persona muy exigente y responsable. Ella vende insumos textiles, la cual reparte en diferentes ferreterías además en los meses de campañas vende almanaques agendas tarjetas personales que ofrece en diferentes empresas.

El secretario José se dedica al servicio de buffets el tiene 3 hijos y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento de su familia.

La mayoría de los socios tienen diferentes negocios tales como venta de alimentos, cosméticos por catalogo, lencería, bisutería, insumos textiles, venta de gas, venta de postres, desayunos y buffet.
Ellas saben que hay mucha competencia es por eso que venden productos de primera calidad.

El préstamo otorgado a cada uno de los socios será para comprar productos e insumos que necesiten para aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Communal Bank: María Elena Moyano María Elena Moyano is a group of 11 members who are very organized and this is demonstrated by the fact that they are already in their 15th credit cycle. This group is comprised of people who live in the same place and have known each other for many years. The president, Sonia, is the founder of the group and is a person who is very demanding and responsible. She sells textile supplies, which she distributes in different hardware stores. In addition, in the (sales) campaign months she sells almanacs, calendars, and business cards that she offers to different firms. The secretary, Jose, works in buffet service. He has 3 children and with the income that he earns he supports his family. The majority of the members have a variety of businesses such as: food sales, buffet service, sales of cosmetics through catalogs, and the sale of lingerie, jewelry, textile supplies, gas, desserts and breakfasts. They know that there is a lot of competition, and for this reason they sell top quality products. The loan which is granted to each one of the members will be used to buy products and supplies that they need to increase their sales and thus increase their incomes so that they can support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Ceferina Berta

texts.es:
Ceferina T. de 60 años, vive en una casa de cemento, con todos los servicios básicos ubicado en la zona de la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Ceferina comenzó como comerciante informal en Pedro Pablo Gómez de Guayaquil, debido a que la ley Municipal no permitía estar en la calle laborando, decidió poner así su negocio en su vivienda.

Ahora Ceferina trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 19h00 vendiendo en su domicilio conjuntos para niños a $ 12.00 c/u, pantalones a $ 17.00 c/u y camisetas a $ 15.00 c/u, una de las mayores dificultades que tiene son los ladrones ya que tiene que estar pendiente de lo que tiene en su casa, su esposo trabaja como mensajero en una empresa farmacéuticas.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar $ 300.00 de pantalones, $ 160.00 conjunto para niños, $ 300.00 para camisetas, en su futuro quiere ubicar un local en el centro de la ciudad de Guayaquil, y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ceferina T. is 60 years old and lives in a cement house, with all of the basic services, located in the zone of Perimetral de Guayaquil. She began as a casual trader in Pedro Pablo Gomez de Guayaquil. Due to the fact that municipal law did not allow working in the street, she decided to set up a business in her home. Now Caferina works from 7:00 A.M. until 7:00 P.M. selling clothing in her home. She sells childrens' outfits for $12.00 each, pants for $17.00, and shirts for $15.00 each. One of the greatest troubles she has are thieves, since he has to be watchful of the things in her house. Her husband works as a messenger for a pharmaceutical company. With this loan she wants to purchase $300.00 worth of pants, $160.00 of childrens' outfits, and $300.00 of shirts. In the future, she would like to establish a business in downtown Guayaquil and finish constructing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, childrens' outfits, and shirts for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Pum Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. is 36 years old. She is a group leader. This group in Veal Prei village in the Takeo province consists of five members who receive different individual loans. 

Mrs. Sopheap P. is a silk weaver who owns a little supply of silk to weave. She wanted to expand her business, so Mrs. Sopheap P. decided to apply for a loan to buy more silk. 

Her husband, Mr. Samet Buot, is a farmer. Mrs. Sopheap P. is the mother of five children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Marilu Cirly

texts.es:
La Sra. F. A. Marilu Cirly de 53 años de edad es natural de Arequipa vive en Ica desde hace 7 años ella actualemnte habita en un cuarto alquilado desde hace 4 años en Huacachina donde es su trabajo diariamente.
Ella tiene una hija de 25 años la cual vive en Arequipa ya se encuentra casada y le envia aveces dinero a su madre.
se encarga del control del baño en Huacachina y también vende articulos de limpieza personal fuera del mismo ella se ha ganado la confianza de los jefes de la municipalidad por ser bien responsable.
La sra solicita que le financiemos un credito para mejorar un ambiente que ha comprado con sus ahorros en Huacachina mismo su sueño es poner un negocio de comida mas adelante lo que le permitiria obtener un mejor ingreso.
Los vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de ella dicen que es bien trabajadora colaboradora y respetuosa con todos.
texts.en:
F. A. Marilu Cirly, age 53, comes from Arequipa but has lived in Ica for the past 7 years. For the past 4 years, she has lived in a rented room in Huacachina, Ica, where her daily work takes place. She has a 25-year-old daughter who is married and lives in Arequipa, and who sometimes sends money to her mother. F. A. Marilu is in charge of the bathrooms in Huacachina, and she also sells personal hygiene products outside of the same facilties. She has gained the trust of the leaders of the municipality because she has been very responsible. She is asking us to finance a loan to improve a location she has purchased in Huacachina with her savings. Her dream is to open a food business there in the future, which will allow her to earn a better income. The neighbors provide very positive references for her, saying that she is very hard-working and cooperative, and that she treats everyone with respect.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Preparing a location for a future business

loans.name: Salome Marcos

texts.pt:
Salomé marcos M. nasceu em Gaza tem 44 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de 2 filhas com idades compriendidas entre os 24 aos 25 anos de idade nenhuma das duas se encontra a estudar pois trabalham todas juntas. Para alem das suas filhas responsabiliza se pelos seus 4 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar por mes 2.000.00mt. 

Salome estudou até a 4 classe porque a escola onde frequentava terminava naquele nivel de escolaridade, então seu professor leva a ela alegando que ia arranjar uma vaga numa outra escola e este abusa dela (violação de menores) e este a engravida. Salomé fica desesperada com a situação pois a sua mãe manda lhe embora de casa. Sai de Gaza para vila de namaacha na fronteira de Suazilândia com sua amiga a procura de emprego, após sua chegada começa a trabalhar no governo do distrito como servente, mas devido a doença do século () ela teve que abandonar o emprego porque sofria descriminação.

Anos depois começa a trabalhar com plantas de varias espécies tais como (Azáleas, Antores e Catos) pois são fáceis de se multiplicar e apreciáveis pois ela é uma florista de mão cheia e cultiva um lindo jardim em sua casa. Hoje Salomé e uma das mais famosas na região, vendendo flores para clientes da capital Maputo ganhando por mes aproximadamente 10.000.00mt porque para alem de vender tem contratos de jardinagem com proprietários de quinta na vila.
 Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Salomé na hluvuku e kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt foi usado para comprar insumos agrícolas tais como sementes e pesticidas para melhorar a sua colecção de flores, o segundo de 10.000.00 foi usado para aumentar a multiplicação das mesmas e estes 20.000.00mt serão usados para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto pois conta com ajuda das suas duas filhas
texts.en:
Salomé Marcos M. was born in Gaza. She is 44 years old and is a single mother of two daughters aged 24 and 25. Neither of her daughters are in school as they work with her. In addition to her 2 daughters, she also supports her 4 grandchildren who live with them. She is able to save 2.000.00 MT per month. Salome attended school until the 4th grade because the school she attended ended at that level. Then her professor took her saying that he was going to arrange an opening at another school and he abused her (child rape) and she became pregnant. Salomé was desperate about the situation because her mother threw her out of the house. She left Gaza and moved to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Swaziland with a friend to look for work. After she arrived, she began to work for the governor of the district as a servant, but due to an illness she had to leave her job.. Years later she began working with plants of various species such as Azaelas, Antores and Cacti) because the reproduce easily and valuable. She is a talented florist and has a pretty garden at her house. Today Salomé is one of the most famous florists in the region, selling flowers for clients in the capital, Maputo, and earning approximately 10.000.00 MT per month because in addition to her sales she also has gardening contracts with property owners in town. This is Salomés third loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The first loan for 15,000.00 MT was used to purchase agricultural products like seeds and pesticides to improve her flower collection. The second loan, for 10.000.00, was used to increase the reproduction of the same, and this 20.000.00 MT will also be used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will pay her loan before it is due since she has the help of her two daughters.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: reproduction and sale of plants and flowers

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en:
Dieudonne is 25 years old and is still single. He lives with his parents in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. He owns an Internet cafe business and is a young man in this field because he has been an entrepreneur only since 2009.

Dieudonne is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to purchase more computers to be used in his business and other materials such as chairs and so on.

Dieudonne is a hardworking man. His business is well organized and he is able to employ one person as a helper. The hours of his business are from eight in the morning to ten in the evening every day, even during the weekend. With this loan, he will be able to obtain more profits, which will help him to get married in the future.

loans.use: To buy more computers for his Internet café

loans.name: Claridel's Group

texts.en:
Claridel L. is from the village of Lucban, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Claridel is the leader of a nine-member group requesting a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Claridel is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products to the local community. She has done this for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Claridel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claridel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Claridel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Mrs. Thary R., 41, and her husband, Mr. Bunna Chea, 45, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have two children: one son and one daughter.

Thary and her husband have been selling food for ten years. She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose. And she will use a part of her loan to expand her store as well.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es: Roxana Patricia R. R. de 24 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Sacacoyo, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante ambulante, y junto a su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Roxana se dedica a la venta de zapatos y medicinas, las cuales comercializa en su hogar y así mismo de forma ambulante, esto último con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias, por lo que sale día con día a ofrecer su producto por las diferentes calles del departamento de La Libertad, logrando obtener ganancias bastante aceptables. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando ropa  para hombres y mujeres, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas y zapatos, todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera mantener el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana Patricia R. R. is 24 years old and resides in the municipality of Sacacoyo, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as an itinerant vendor, and her 5-year-old son. Roxana's work is selling shoes and medicines, which she offers for sale in her home and also as an itinerant vendor, in order to earn higher profits. Day after day, she goes out to offer her products on various streets of the department of La Libertad, which allows her to obtain quite acceptable returns. For this reason, she is a requesting a loan which she will invest in her business, buying men's and women's clothing as well as a larger quantity of medicines and shoes. She is doing all this with the desire to increase her earnings and thus maintain her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicines, clothing and shoes

loans.name: Nouratou L. Lydole

texts.fr: A. Nouratou L. Lydole est née le 22 Mars 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BOKOSSA Raoul, Nouratou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Nouratou vit depuis treize ans environs à Dandji, un quartier de Cotonou, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Nouratou a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis dix ans environs, Nouratou mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, chaussures et des bijoux dans sa boutique située à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à assurer à ses enfants, un bon train de vie. Nouratou achète ses articles à Lomé au Togo et aussi au Nigeria, États voisins du Bénin. Nouratou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé tous les crédits qu’elle a obtenus antérieurement de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Nouratou désire renforcer son activité et reconstituer son stock de produits, en vue de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Nouratou L. Lydole was born on the 22nd of March, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Raoul Bokossa and is a mother of three school-aged children. Nouratou has lived with her family in Dandji, a district in Cotonou, for around 13 years, and the couple see to the family's needs together. Nouratou left school at secondary level and for the past 10 years has sold fabric, shoes and jewellery from her home-run shop. This business activity generates revenues that allow her to look after her children's living conditions. Nouratou buys her items from Lomé in Togo, and from Nigeria, Benin's neighbouring states. Nouratou is an old ALIDé client who successfully repaid all the loans that she received in the past from ALIDé. Given her customers' mounting demands, Nouratou wishes to boost her business by enlarging her product range.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, jewellery and shoes

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia R. is from the village of Saladaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Ophelia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ophelia works in someone else's transportation-services business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Ophelia has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ophelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ophelia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ophelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Pann

texts.en: Mr. Pann S. is a 51 years old, married and father to three children. He makes a living by buying bran in bulk from people who have a grinding machine and then sells it to retail customers. In additional to this business, he has built a stall next to his house where he raises a pigs to generate extra income. He wife stays home to do housework and help to fatten the pig. This couple's children all attend the local school. Mr. Sophia owns a piece of land on which he would like to grow rice. He has applied for a loan to hire a laborer to plow this land.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow his land

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 4, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sugarcane plantation, a corn plantation and charcoal selling. Her husband Pablito, who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 12 children who are 11 to 35 years old. Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 20,000. She intends to use it to buy and sell charcoal so that she can continue to save up for their future and to send their children to school and expand her business. Anita D. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre de familia de 25 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el caserio Cerro Falla del distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por ser el distrito con la mayor extensión geográfica de la región, se caracteriza por estar conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a casi dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría aves de corral en un area de terreno cercana a su domicilio y las comercaliza, ya sacrificadas, entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente comercializa carne de pollos de granja, con lo que se genera ingresos estables que le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con la economia familiar.

Cecilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral para comercializarlas entre sus vecinos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión ella espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias.

Cecilia ya es una cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 25 year old mom that lives with her husband and small children in the village of Cerro Falla, district of Olmos, characterized for being the district with the largest geographical extension in the region and is comprised by different villages that are faraway from each other. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located almost two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Four years ago she started working in activities related to raising and selling small animals, she raises farm chickens in a place close to her home and then sells them, once slaughtered, to her neighbors. She also sells chicken meat, which helps generate stable income to help her husband with the family economy. Cecilia wishes to expand her business to buy more farm chickens and sell them to her neighbors, she has requested Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,500 PEN. With this investment she can have more sales and make more profit. Cecilia is a returning client for Edpyme Alternativa and has shown punctuality and responsibility at the time of making her payments. Her neighbors and acquaintances really like her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to sell meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement: will change electrical system and flooring

loans.name: Beby

texts.en: Beby A. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at the store around the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Beby is 49 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car to transport bags of charcoal from charcoal burners to her store.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Francy Locadith

texts.es:
el sr. Francy Locadith M. I. se dedica a la elaboracion de prótesis Dentales, a su vez también realiza extracciones de piezas dentales, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de “Laboratorio Dental M.” 
El señor Francy cuenta con 16 años experiencia en este negocio.
Debido a que en la zona en donde esta ubicado su laboratorio no existen clínicas dentales y la amabilidad con la que el Señor Francy atiende a sus clientes a el acuden la mayoría de personas de la aldea así como de todos los lugares aledaños.
Don Francy es casado pero no tiene hijos con su esposa y ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos dentro del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales y los medicamentos necesarios para las extracciones.
texts.en:
Francy Locadith M. I. works making dental prostheses, and he also carries out tooth extractions. He operates this business under the name "M. Dental Laboratory." He has 16 years of experience with this business. Thanks to the fact that there are no dental clinics in the area where his laboratory is located, and the friendliness with which Francy treats his clients, most people in the town, as well as many from more distant areas, come to him. Francy is married but has no children with his wife, who dedicates herself to domestic tasks within the home. He will use the loan to buy supplies and medications that he needs to carry out extractions.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies and medications

loans.name: Beisenbek

texts.en:
Beisenbek E. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest two children attend a local secondary school while his two younger children are in kindergarten. 

His wife is currently unemployed. Beisenbek operates a goods transportation business in his town.  He started his business in 2003 by transporting coal and firewood between sub-provinces. He transports coal and firewood using his own truck with trailer and sells it in local markets. His truck can transport a load of up to 15 tons, which allows him to make 6-8 trips during the winter season and 8-10 trips in the summer. His business earnings are the only source of his family's income. 

He is a very modest and quiet person. For the future, Beisenbek hopes to continue making progress with his business and says, "All I want is to build a house for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wheels for his truck and to grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase wheels for his truck

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly D., 62, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Ly  sells groceries for an income of USD 3 per day. Her daughter sells fish, earning an income of USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food. 

Ly D. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N., 35 years old, has been selling second-hand clothes for the last seven years in Central Market-Jinja. This is a business she began with financial support from her husband. Even with no experience, this mother of two still made progress. In a month she makes 300000 shillings. She also has a rental business that brings additional profits. She describes herself as hard-working and amiable. With this loan she wants to buy more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora G. is from the Barangay of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 50 years of age, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in the snack vending business, which she has done for six years. Aurora earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 a month.

In 2005, Aurora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid her previous loan amount of PHP 14,900.00 and is now requesting her fourth loan in the amount of PHP 10,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store.  Aurora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for future use, make loan repayments, and pay for the insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for food vending

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Celibataire Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CÉLIBATAIRE est créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2

Madame Boye Guèye N. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge.

Elle fait du commerce de thioub. Elle s'approvisionne auprès de ses amies qui achète la marchandise dans les pays limitrophes et revend dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'augmenter ses provisions afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses épargnes et prendre en charge les études de ses enfants
texts.en:
The “Celibataire” solidarity group has been created on March 28, 2008. It is composed of eight women living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Montagne Nord2. 

Mrs. Boye Guèye N., standing to the right in the photo is the group’s leader. She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of four dependent children. She sells “thioub,” a traditional tinted fabric. She buys her wares from friends who bring merchandise from the neighboring countries and resells at the local markets. Her new loan will allow her to expand her stock so as to increase her revenues. 

Her goal is to grow her savings and to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: Strengthening her business

loans.name: Sahr Brima

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Sahr Brima B.. He is single, and has one child aged two years. In 2006, Sahr established a plastic utensils business. He began his business because he believed it can make him self-reliant. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,418,000 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL.

Sahr has a very good loan repayment history. He requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. He is a serious and determined business man and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils.

loans.name: Dora Emma

texts.es: Dora Emma C. D. R. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. Panchimalco, en el departamento San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico, y así mismo junto a cuatro hijos menores D. edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Dora posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, contando con muy buena clientela ya que es la única tienda en el lugar. Así mismo comercializa granos básicos y verduras. Dora solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, sobre todo aquellos que cuentan con más demanda por parte D. las personas. Con el préstamo hecho a Integral ella alberga la esperanza D. poder mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, y D. esta manera contar con más ganancias las cuales le permitan brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora Emma C. D. R., age 39, resides in the city of Panchimalco in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who works as a mechanic and their four young children who are in school. Dora has a store where she sells basic necessities. She has a good customer base since she is the only store in the area. In addition, she sells grains and vegetables.

Dora is requesting a loan in order to buy a large quantity of basic necessities, especially those products for which people have great demand. With this loan provided by Apoyo Integral, she hopes to improve her business sales in order to have more money to proviD. everything her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase food products for her store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 48 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Briyit, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Marcelina ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco, donde el cacao, café y hojas de coca que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her beloved daughter Briyit, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Through her hard work, Marcelina has managed to give her crops a good start.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her crops.  She takes her products to sell in the market in the city of San Francisco where the cacao, coffee and coca leaves she grows sell quickly.

What Marcelina most likes about her work is enjoying the freedom that she has to work on her land.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work her land.  Over time, she hopes to be able to buy more land and thereby expand her production.

This is Marcelina's second loan from MFP.  She knows that this loan will help her to make progress in her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make her loan repayments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank which makes her very well liked.  She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy manure and insecticides.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make tortas

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio.   que ofrece a amigos y familiares, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso para su familia. Los sueños de Maria es que su hijo pueda asistir a una universidad y logre ser un buen profesional. Maria necesita un préstamo dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas por lo que se preocupa de generar ingresos para el alimento diario. Sueña con tener su propio medio de transporte que le facilite la entrega de sus productos.
texts.en: Maria sells cosmetics. She has had this business for more than 4 years. She offers them to her friends and relatives and obtains income for her family. Maria's dreams are for her son to go to college and have a good profession. Maria needs a loan to invest the money in buying perfumes and creams in order to generate income for her daily meals. She dreams of having her own means of transportation which will make it easier to deliver her products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Rosarinas Group

texts.es:
Ya son 20 años que la Sra. Melita se dedica al oficio D. la costura, ella tiene el negocio en su misma casa fueron sus abuelos quienes le inculcaron  el trabajo ellos tenían un taller D. costura y aun recuerda  cuando era niña y se portaban mal su abuelo en forma D. castigo la hacia trabajar volteando el cuello D. las camisas o  planchando los bolsillos D. los pantalones, así fue aprendiendo ya jovencita deciD.  perfeccionarse y estudiar,  al casarse  compro su casa y vio que en el lugar no había ningún taller D. costura  pensó que seria una buena idea  debido a que esa zona recién se estaba poblando  no se equivoco  ella reconoce que su trabajo le ha brindado mucha tranquilidad para solventar los gastos D. la familia  ahora mas que nunca debido a la repentina enfermedad D. su esposo es ella quien solventa todo y se las ingenia para  hacer D. todo, actualmente esta inmersa en la campaña escolar confeccionando uniformes y  buzos escolares  ella  hace los uniformes para 2 colegios, su préstamo lo usara para comprar telas  para confeccionar buzos,  lo que mas desea en el futuro es acondicionar un lugar en su casa para  poner un taller mas granD. con atención al publico y sobretodo  comprar maquinas industriales ya que su meta es abastecer a todos los colegios D. la zona donD. vive, La Sra. Melita es miembro del grupo “LAS ROSARINAS”  es la tesorera del grupo que  esta formado por 8 socias .

* la Sra Melita esta sentada con blusa roja.
texts.en:
For the past 20 years Melita has worked as a seamstress in her own house.  Her grandparents were the ones who started her in the business because they have a workshop. She even remembers that when she was a child and didn’t behave, her grandfather punished her by making her turn the shirt collars or iron the pants pockets.  This was how she learned, and as a young girl, she decided to study and perfect the traD..  When she married, she bought a house and saw that there was no other tailor shop in the area, and she thought it would be a good idea to put one in since the area was starting to increase in population.  She wasn’t wrong and she recognizes that her work has offered her the ability to pay the family expenses, especially because of the sudden illness of her husband.  Melita is the one who pays all and figures out how to handle everything.  Currently she is making school uniforms and sweatsuits for 2 schools.  She will use the loan to buy fabric to make sweatsuits.  What she would like most in the future is to fix up a place in her house where she can put a bigger workshop for the public and especially to buy industrial sewing machines since her goal is to produce the uniforms for all the schools in the area where she lives.  Melita is a member of the 8-person group “Las Rosarinas”.  She is the treasurer.  
*In the photo she is sitting and wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: Fabric to make sweatsuits

loans.name: Uwele Group

texts.en:
Hamida M., who is in her mid-thirties, is married. She sells food and "bites" (snacks) to school children at a school just outside the city centre.  She works from 9:30am to 5:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamida's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants a loan to increase her stock of food and snacks.  Her dream is to have a wholesale shop selling hardware.

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, Uwele, which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans. 

In the picture, Hamida is in front row, first on the left in a flowered dress.

loans.use: To increase her stock of food and snacks.

loans.name: Clavelia

texts.es: Clavelia, de 39 años, vive en concubinato con José. Con quien tiene 2 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Desde muy joven, comenzó a trabajar como peón en otros cultivos. Con el dinero que le pagaba junto un pequeño capital, con lo que hace 2 años compró 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde comenzó a sembrar café, cítricos, achiote y maíz en poca escala. Pues necesita generar ingresos en corto tiempo. Ahora ella vende al menudeo sus cosechas, pero con el tiempo, esmero y dedicación logrará obtener el capital necesario para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, y así obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, entidad respetada en su comunidad, por el apoyo que brinda a los agricultores de la zona. Clavelia, muy pronto cosechará maíz híbrido, después de la cosecha está pensando comprar con el crédito, 5 mil plantitas de café que plantará para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Clavelia, age 39, is in a common law relationship with José. She cares for and has great love for her two children. Clavelia lives in her own house in the native community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian jungle. As a young woman, she began working as a laborer on other farms. With the small amount money she earned and accumulated as capital, she bought two hectares of farmland for growing coffee, citrus fruits, annato seeds, and corn on a small scale. Now she needs to generate income for the short term. Clavelia sells her crops to retail shops, but over time and with great care and dedication, she hopes to obtain the necessary capital to increase her output and generate more income.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Almendra” (Almond Blossom). This is her first loan with MFP, a respected entity in the community that is known for its support of local farmers. Clavelia will soon be harvesting hybrid corn. After this harvest, she will use her loan to buy 5000 coffee seedlings to plant for the next season.

loans.use: Purchase 5000 coffee seedlings

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encarnación; la socia tiene 56 años de edad, casada y tiene 8 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía especialmente chompas de alpaca la socia trabaja de forma independiente un par de años atrás, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para así poder ofrecer a más clientes y tener más ingresos económicos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "COMUZONE III” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Encarnación, and she is 56 years old and married with 8 children. She divides her time between her daily chores and her business buying and selling handicrafts, especially alpaca sweaters. She started working independently a few years ago. She is a very cheerful person with a great desire to get ahead for the sake of her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise, so that she can offer it to more customers and achieve better economic returns. 

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy more handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las 12 socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Éxito. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Aquí hace cinco ciclos se reunieron un grupo de personas para poder acceder a los créditos que ofrece la institución.  Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, venta de comida o prestan servicios como cabinas telefónicas, salones de belleza, entre otras cosas.

Aquí conocimos a Luisa María Z., tiene 21 de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres con dos hermanos menores, en la actualidad estudia el cuarto semestre de medicina en la universidad. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras le han recibido muy bien en el grupo.

Ella se dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días, vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que tiene cuatro meses que se dedica a esta actividad y que fue una amiga que la incentivó a que ingrese al mundo del comercio, que le esta yendo muy bien y que con esto se esta financiando parte de sus estudios. 

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos.
 
Su sueño es ser una gran medico. 

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la fotografia la Señora. Zenia Mero que es la Promotora del Banco, la Señora usa lentes y está con una camiseta interior amarilla y una blusa exterior blanca.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton, 12 members of the Mujeres De Exito (Women of Success) Microfinance Institute get together every fifteen days. This place is well-known for the delicious candy that the locals make and is famous throughout the country. Fifteen loan cycles ago, a group of people came together in order to obtain the loans that this institute offers. These group members sell anything from general merchandise to food, or they provide telephone or beauty services, among other things.

Here is where we met Luisa Maria Z., a 21-year-old single woman who lives in her parents' home with her two younger siblings. She is currently in her fourth semester of premed at the university. This is her first loan cycle with the institute, and she likes it because her fellow group members have received her well.

She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's accessories). She works every day, selling products to her classmates at the university. She sells door-to-door and by order, accepting credit from her customers and billing them weekly. She states that she has been in business for four months after a friend motivated her to enter the world of sales. Business is going well, and she has been able to pay for part of her studies with her earnings.

She will invest this loan in purchasing fragrances, fashion jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and other products.

Her wish is to become a great doctor.

Pictured here is Ms. Zenia Mero, the bank promoter. She is wearing glasses and a yellow undershirt with a white blouse over it.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, fashion jewelry, and other products.

loans.name: Billia

texts.en:
Billia M. A. is a married lady. Her husband is an engineer, and they have five children between twenty and six years old. Her business is located at an area known as Lights, in Mombasa, Kenya.  Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist sites, including the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Billia supplies construction materials, such as sand, ballast, blocks and other building materials. She has been in this business for ten years now and her target market is contractors. She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more sand, ballast and blocks to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow the business and even open a hardware store, which will be a one-stop shop for her customers. She describes herself as jovial and cheerful.

loans.use: to purchase sand, ballast, and blocks

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 24 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y luchadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Julio de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Ella empezó como comerciante vendiendo ropa de manera ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad de Palmapampa y Santa Rosa. Su pasión por las ventas y las buenas ganancias que le generaron este negocio fue ahorrándolo, es por ello que ella optó en salir a ofrecer su mercadería a las distintas ferias que se realizan en las zonas rurales, obteniendo buena solvencia económica. Durante este tiempo de trabajo su esposo es quien más la apoyaba, él era su mentor en los negocios, se encarga de buscar clientela. Maribel viene ofreciendo su mercadería desde hace 05 años y hoy es toda una conocedora en sus responsabilidades como comerciante. Considera que los periodos más difíciles son los meses de enero, febrero y marzo por que son épocas de lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza existiendo imperfecciones en las carreteras así imposibilitando el recorrido de los vehículos quienes prestan sus servicios como medio transporte en el traslado de las mercaderías. Los planes que tiene en mente es alquilar un espacio en los centros comerciales y así exponer su mercadería  a la vista del público. Este es tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socia responsable. Con el crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de mercaderías por lo cual ella tiene que realizar el viaje a la ciudad de lima y comprar diversidad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Maribel is 24 years old, and is a happy and determined young mother.  She lives in a rented house with her husband Julio, who is 35 years old, and their two children, who they want to give a better future.  She started selling clothing as a street vendor in the streets of the city of Palmapampa and Santa Rosa.  She began to offer her merchandise at different markets in rural areas because she has a passion for sales and she saved the good income that her business generated, so she had a good financial standing.  During this time, her husband was the one who gave her the most support.  He was her mentor in business and helped her find customers.  

Maribel started offering her merchandise five years ago, and today is she knowledgeable about her responsibilities as a businesswoman.  She thinks the most difficult periods are the months of January, February, and March, because they are times of intermittent rains, which causes problems with the roads, which makes it difficult for vehicles transporting goods to run.      

She is planning to rent a space in the commercial center and expose her merchandise to the public.  This is her third loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she would like to get another loan in the future, and she is ready to do so.  She is a responsible member of her community bank.  With this loan, she plans to purchase more merchandise.  She will make a trip to the city of Lima and purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras  quien tiene 9 ciclos trabajando con Adim y han tenido dos préstamos con Kiva. Ellas han participado en las capacitaciones de Adim las cuales les ayuda a salir adelante según comentaron.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Flor de María de 48 años se dedica a la venta de helados, hielo y con el crédito pasado inicio un pequeño vivero artesanal este es pequeño terreno plano en el que esta sembrando plantas ya sean ornamentales o arboles en el cual invertirá el crédito para abono, bolsas...etc. Masaya es conciederada la ciudad de las flores ya que muchos de sus habitantes se dedican a la produccion de plantas.

Las otras integrantes son Virgenza del Carmen  de 26 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos Zermat y Modesta de 41 años se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada, queso en su casa y el mercado de Masaya desde hace 18 años además vende productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Melania group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs who have been involved with ADIM for 9 terms.  They have received two loans from Kiva and participated in ADIM training which has helped them get ahead, according to their statements.

The coordinator of the group is Mrs. Flor de María, age 48, who sells ice cream and ice.  However, she used the last loan to set up a small greenhouse where she can grow plants, including ornamental plants and trees. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and bags. Masaya, where the client lives, is an area with a high concentration of flowers and many people work with plants.

The other members of the group are Virgenze del Carmen, age 26, who sells Zermat products, and Modesta, age 41, who sells milk, curd, and cheese from her house and in the Masaya market.  She also has been selling Avon products for 18 years.

loans.use: to purchase items for her greenhouse, such as fertilizer and bags.

loans.name: Roció Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Roció Isabel es madre de familia y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando y que son su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de la inscripción de la escuela donde están estudiando sus hijos.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo como jefa de sistema de una compañía de nieve. Ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesario para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Rocio Isabel is the mother of three school-age children who she must provide for. She is applying for a loan to pay the monthly tuition fees for the school where her children study. She plans on paying off this loan with a part of her salary as the head of systems for a company that sells ice. She hopes her children will have the necessary education to improve their lives.

loans.use: pay for school costs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea, 56, and his wife, 55, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Tunle Sap River. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought. Mr. Chea has five children. Two of his children are single and three are married. Two of the children work as fish catchers also. Mr. Chea is not comfortable because his house often needs to be repaired. He would like a loan to repair his old house.

loans.use: to repair his old house.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She has been operating her business for many years. In her working years, she has never received any complaints from her clients about her work. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of her clients and earns better profits. Her clientele base is her community ladies who prefer giving her orders for her good work. She completes each dress in 3 to 4 days' time frame and earns well after completing one.  

She is hopeful that the loan investment will take her business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una discoteca de la ciudad de Cusco como mozo y también trabaja en una carpintería, el hace muebles, sillas y puertas, el socio por medio de este trabajo y negocio saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere mejorar en el trabajo y también quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un artefacto para su casa para comprar un televisor.
 

                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Mujeres Emprendadoras" ("Enterprising Women") communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 29 years old.  He lives with his partner and has one child.  His daily activities alternate between his work as a waiter in a nightclub in the city of Cusco and his work in a carpentry shop.  He makes furniture, chairs and doors.  Through this job and business, he is moving his child forward.  He wants to improve in his work, and he also wants to expand the carpentry business.  The member is asking for the loan to buy an appliance for his home and to buy a television.

He is happy to have the loan and he promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for his home and to buy a television.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco El socio pertenece al banco Mujeres en Accion, porque inicialmente eran solo mujeres y luego invitaron a sus parejas, hijos y familias tanto varones como mujeres, entonces el banco no puede cambiar de nombre, por estar ya registrado y bien constituido.

El socio es el Sr. Cirilo; el socio tiene 55 años; el socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son ya todos independientes, el socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio compra y vende cerdos, el está en el negocio de cerdos y nos comenta que compra cerdos tiernos y los cría, alimenta y engorda para luego venderlo en las diferentes ferias o mercados regionales, Aunque en esta ocasión el socio invertira su credito en el arreglo de su casa, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en el revestimiento de su vivienda, el socio en esta ocasión desea el crédito para los materiales de construcción de su casa propia, el socio ira pagando sus cuotas con lo que le genera la venta de sus animales, entre otros que cría están las aves de corral y cuyes también. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la construcción y revestimiento de su vivienda.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, " Mujeres en Accion" (Women in Action), and the bank is part of the Compone district, a province in Anta and department of Cusco. The member is part of this bank, because initially it started with just women and then they invited their partners, children, and family members to join - men as well as women - and at that point the bank could not change its name because it was already registered and populated. 

Cirilo is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children whom are all independent.  Cirilo is a merchant who buys and sells pigs; he is in the pig business. He tells us he purchases young pigs and raises them, feeds them, and fattens them up to later sell at various fairs or regional markets.  He seeks this loan to be able to invest in the remodeling of his home.  In this occasion he would like the loan for the constuction materials for his home.  This member would pay his installments from what he earns selling his animals;  poultry and guinea pigs are amongst some of the other animals Cirilo raises.  This member is soliciting this loan to invest in construction materials to remodel his home.

As a member he finds himself very thankful for the support offered via these means and he comitts himself to fulfill his payments in the time allotted.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials and remodeling his home.

loans.name: Karen Sofia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la Señorita Karen, tiene 21 años  de edad, es  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, nuestra amiga estudia para Lic. en Comunicación en la Universidad Laica de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido emprender un negocio que le da para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería de la marca Visón, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en la universidad donde estudia a sus compañeras de clases y conocidos, nos cuenta que le realizan muchos pedidos sus compañeras, además también aprovecha todos sus ratos libres para realizar sus ventas. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la recibe en su casa ya que una señora le entrega allí. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios  y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Camino Al Progreso ["Path to Progress"] communal bank meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international levels. This is the home of the famous hats ["Panama" hats] made of paja toquilla fibers.

In this place lives Karen, a young lady of 21. She is single and lives in her parents' home. She is studying for a degree in communications at the Lay University of Manta. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to operate a business which has given her the means to pay the expenses for her studies. 

She works selling clothing of all types, as well as Visón brand costume jewelry. Her sales method is door to door, and she also sells to her classmates and acquaintances at the university where she studies. She reports that her classmates place many orders. She also takes advantage of every free moment to make her sales. She provides goods to her customers on credit and collects payments every fifteen days. She receives her merchandise at her home, since a woman delivers it to her there. She has done this work for two years, and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and costume jewelry. 

Her dreams are to finish her studies and be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
Jumaboy is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Jumaboy has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Jumaboy harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. Through this, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Jumaboy requests 1,000 USD for purchasing young cattle. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.         


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es:
El señor Eleazar está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos escolares de la escuela de sus dos hijos que tiene. 
Tiene que pagar la inscripción y comprar los útiles escolares que son cuadernos, libros y carpetas, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su empleo ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la familia. 
Desea que sus hijos tengan la educación y el estudio necesario para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Eleazar is requesting a loan to pay for school fees and expenses for his two children.
He needs to pay for their registration and to buy equipment such as notebooks, books and folders, and at the moment he does not have the money he needs to pay for these school supplies.
He plans to repay the loan with a part of the salary he earns with his job, his source of income for his family.
He wants his children to study and to get the necessary education to have a better future.

loans.use: To pay for registratio fees, school fees and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinace Trust is very pleased to present you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They are among the first sets of borrowers to have received a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in the city. Like colleague teachers in other regions in the country, this group of teachers has come to SMT to seek for a loan of 2,400,000.00 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Andrew is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono, 58 years ago, Andrew is married and has 6 children – 5 grown-ups and 1 attending primary school. Andrew is a teacher and has been serving in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to complete his house building project. He will use his share of the loan to buy house building materials.

loans.use: to buy house building materials

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
38-year-old Roselyn earns a living through farming. She is married and has 2 children aged 19 and 11.

Roselyn helps her husband grow rice crops on their land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Roselyn also runs a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like canned goods, shampoo and various other items. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Roselyn hopes to fund her children’s education through her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is an enterprising 50-year-old businessman. He is married to Grace who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children ages 17 and 15. He has been a shoe maker for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET after repaying the previous ones successfully. Michael will use the loan to buy raw materials for making shoes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to open a shoe shop and employ some workers who will be making shoes for his shop and later open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy, age 48, who is a resident of GMA, Cavite City in the Philippines. She is a single mother to her three children, two of whom are already working while one is still staying at home. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Dorcy operates a tailoring business. She mainly tailors curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home accessories. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she also sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dorcy hopes her business grows, and she dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto Antonio es un hombre soltero, trabajador y responsable, a sus 53 años de edad, tiene un puesto de ventas en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín, lugar que le favorece mucho para vender ropa, ya que este es el epicentro del comercio de la ciudad. Tiene un hijo de 11 años y es su adoración por eso se levanta día a día de 9.00am a 7.00pm, a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo para poderle dar a su hijo todo lo que necesita.

Actualmente debido a que viene la temporada navideña, y el comercio en la ciudad de Medellín se aumenta considerablemente, Gilberto quiere estar preparado, y por eso solicitó un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de inventario, con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y conseguir nuevos, ademas de lograr incrementar sus ingresos, brindar empleo a otras personas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilberto Antonio is a single, hardworking, responsible man.  At the age of 53, he has a clothing stand in downtown Medellín which is a very favorable spot for clothing sales because it’s right in the middle of the city’s commercial hub.  He has an 11-year-old son who is his adoration and this is why he rises daily at 9am and goes until 7pm working with much enthusiasm to be able to provide his son with everything he needs.

At present, due to the approaching Christmas season, commerce in Medellín increases considerably and Gilberto wants to be prepared.  Because of this, he’s asked for a loan to buy larger amounts of inventory to meet customer demand and to attract new customers as well as increasing income and provide employment to others thus improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
