Guadalupe is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of essentials so that she can improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a sari-sari (general store) and selling chicken. She has seven children who are between 30 and 43 years old – six of them have families and one is still single and working. Felicisima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Felicisima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for home appliances and home repairs. Felicisima is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
Ricardo labora como vigilante y es casado tiene 4 personas a su cargo es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga, para compra de útiles escolares de sus hijos y matricula de los muchachos.

Agradece a CEPRODEL  por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ricardo works as a security guard. He is married and has four people under his care. This is the first loan that has been granted to him by CEPRODEL. Ricardo will use the funds to buy school supplies for his children as well as pay for their tuition.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for its support.

loans.use: Pay tuition & purchase shoes, uniforms, and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu H., who is in her mid-forties, is single and has two children.  She has been selling tea and snacks in a place called Sinza just outside the city center. She works from 5:00am to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mwajabu's 4th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She has paid back her previous Motisha loans successfully. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business by buying more drinks to resell.

Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group, Arusha, which has a total of fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Mwajabu is the first one on the left, in orange.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to resell.

loans.name: Memede  Ambroisine

texts.fr: Dame  memede est mariée et mère  d’un  enfant.  Elle  a  38  ans. Pour améliorer les conditions  de  vie  de  son  enfant,  elle  exerce  comme  activité  la  vente  des  liqueurs.  Elle  a  commencé  son  activité  en  2003  et s’approvisionne  au  grand    marché  de  Lomé.  Elle  revend   ensuite dans  un magasin  non loin du  Monastère à  Hedzranawoé.  Elle  a employé  dans  le  magasin une  personne  qui  l’aide  dans  ces  tâches.   Elle espère  accroître  son  commerce  et  sollicite  un  prêt au près  de Wages.
texts.en: Mrs. Memede is married and the mother of one child.  She is 38 years old.  To better living conditions for her child, she is in the business of selling liquor.  She started this work in 2003 and gets her supplies at the main market in Lomé.  She then resells her stock at a shop not far from the Monastery in Hedzranawoé.  She employs one person in the store who helps her with her tasks.  She hopes to increase her turnover and is requesting a loan from Wages.

loans.use: to purchase liquors

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Verónica de 33 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María departamento de Usulután, vive con su madre de 68 años de edad, sus tres hijos de 3, 8 y 10 años de edad, tienen casa propia y Verónica se dedica a una tienda, que la inicio hace 10 años, por cuenta propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, detergentes, café y golosinas, con esta inversión fortalecerá el negocio, mejorara sus servicios y atenderá mejor a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es tener un negocio fuerte, que pueda mejorar sus ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old and lives in Santiago de Maria in the Usulutan region.  She lives with her 68 year old mother and her 3 children who are 3, 8, and 10.  They have their own home and Veronica has run a small general store out of their home for the last 10 years.

Currently, she is seeking a loan to buy various products to sell such as oil, sugar, toilet paper, detergent, coffee, and snacks.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business, improve her service, and better tend to her customers.

She aspires to have a strong business that will improve her income for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to purchase various products like oil, sugar, toilet paper and detergent.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children who are in school, Rosanna is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosanna is 35 years old. 

Rosanna has a business buying & selling ready to wear (clothing) in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear.

Rosanna has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosanna would like to send children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of RTW clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paz Group

texts.es: Esta ubicado en el estado de México. Este grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La tesorera se llama Maria de la Paz R. S.. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, es divorciada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones, Ella se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, negocio que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita este prestamo para surtir su negocio. Al momento de  solicitar este prestamo se siente sontenta porque cuenta con mas capital para diversificar los productos que ofrece en su tienda y con esto poder retener y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Quiere este prestamo para hacer crecer su negocio, tener un local mas grande y mejor ubicado para poder verder mas y con esto apoyar a su familia con los gastos economicos y seguir brindandoles educación a sus hijos para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
It’s located in the state of México.  The group has 9 members.  The Treasurer’s name is María de la Paz R. Sánchez.  She is 46 years old and studied up to third grade.  She’s divorced and has a total of four children, two girls and two boys.  She is a Grocer, a business she started two years ago.

She is asking for this loan to stock her store.  At the time of requesting the loan she is happy because she has more capital to diversify stock in her store and this will make it possible for her to retain her customers and meet their needs.  She wants the loan to help her business grow, to have a larger, better situated locale in order to sell more and provide for her family’s expenses and continue providing education for her children so that they’ll have a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y tiene nueve hijos  independientes.  La señora pudo estudiar la primaria.
Se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos ovinos, también se dedica a la chacra, cosecha papa, quinua, cebada.  Hace un ciclo que  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Ahora solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra D. una vaquillita.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es mejorar con el ganado y obtener mejores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married, and has nine children who are independent. Josefina has an elementary school education.

She buys and sells cattle and sheep. Josefina also has a farm where she grows potatoes, quinoa, and barley. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one cycle. Her initial loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and she invested the money in her business. Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to buy a calf. She manages her business with her husband.

Her dreams incluD. improving her livestock and generating better earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Musembei

texts.en: Musembei is 71 years old, married and has six children who are in school. He operates a food stall to earn a living for his family. He has employed two cooks to assist him. He also works as a security guard for extra income. He has been running his business for six years and has expanded the business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested for 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as rice, maize flour, wheat four and salt.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, maize flour, wheat four and salt.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 55 years old, sells groceries at home. Her husband is also a groceries seller but he sells at school. Their income is $36 per day. They have four children. Three are studying and one is working in a company for $6 per day. 

Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $50 on school fees and $10 for transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy equipment for selling food. It is her new career. Because she wants to send all of her children to study in the university, she needs to get more money to support them, and selling food is a good career in the place she is staying. If she can save much money she wishes to buy a small shop in the market.

loans.use: To buy material and equipment to sell food.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 50 years old. He lives in Vanadzor with his mother, his wife and his daughter. 

For about four years, Armen has run his own business. He buys eggs and sweets from wholesale dealers and distributes the merchandise to food shops in Vanadzor and the whole Lori region. Armen uses his garage to store the items and he distributes them to food shops using his own truck, which he bought thanks to his business income. 

Armen’s wife helps him in his occupation and thus they are able to meet their family's needs.
 
Armen wants to diversify his merchandise, so he needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy large lot of various sweets for his business.      

This is Armen’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of various sweets for his business.

loans.name: Yorlenis Leticia

texts.es: La Joven Yorlenis desde hace 3 años labora en su pequeño negocio venta de comida, actividad que ha sido su principal fuente de ingreso la que le ha servido para sastifacer sus necesidades, necesita este financiamiento para incrementar la venta ya que la demenda es buena y ella  no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para realizar dicha obra, tambien podra incrementar la venta de recarga electronica, esta actividad la realiza en conjunto con su mama, en su comunidad la consideran como una joven  trabajadora, progresiva, responsable y de buenas costumbres.
texts.en: For the last three years, the young Yorlenis has worked in her small business selling food. This business has been her main source of income and it has been able to take care of her needs. She needs this loan in order to increase her sales since the demand is high. She doesn’t have the economic resources necessary to do this. In addition, she can increase the sales of phone recharging.  She works with her mother in this business. In her community, Yorlenis is considered a young, progressive, responsible hard-worker with good manners.

loans.use: buy products for her business.

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
Doreen's group is comprised of six hardworking women. Doreen is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Doreen has operated a business selling clothes for 3 years. She sells shoes as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Doreen hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Doreen hopes to expand her clothing business. Doreen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral es amplio; lo tiene en su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus responsabilidades diarias del hogar. 
 
Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para sus animales, con la finalidad de obtener un buen precio por parte de sus clientes a quien ofrece sus ovejas y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y responsable con el objetivo principal de sacar adelante a su familia y poderle brindar estudios superiores a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
María, age 41, lives with her husband and children in their own house.  The house, located in the Mórrope district in the Lambaqeque department, does not have basic services.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and arts and crafts.

For several years María has been raising and selling sheep.  She has a large pen at her house.  She feeds the sheep balanced feed and natural fodder.  When they reach the ideal size and weight she offers them for sale to her customers.   With the income that she gets she is able pay for her daily household responsibilities.

She has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more animals and feed for the animals.  Her purpose for doing so is to get a good price from her customers who buy her sheep.  That way she will be able to have greater income in order to improve her quality of life.

María is a hard-working and responsible person.  Her main objective is to get her family ahead and to be able to offer her children higher education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Progress Two Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28 year old Wanisai (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is single with one child aged four. Wanisai runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges faced are debtors failing to pay on time. 

Wanisai has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes and footwear accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Wanisai plans to open a number of shops.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear accessories for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is from the village Giorgitsminda. He is 37 years old and lives with his  wife Nina and two sons (19 and 11 years old).  Their younger son goes to school and the elder one helps his parents on the family farm. 

Zaza runs a dairy farm. He has 4 milk cows. He and Nina produce 80 kg cheese per month and sell it locally. Also he has a car and brings wood from the forest, which is sold in the village. 

Zaza requests a loan for purchasing calves. He will raise them and sell grown calves by spring for a higher price. One part of the loan will be used for purchasing the feed for cows and calves for the winter months. Zaza will spend the profits for purchasing new household goods, in order to make the house comfortable and improve the living conditions of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed for calves and cows

loans.name: Silveio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Marpanha, provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez 4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ele. 

saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo a procura de emprego, é pensionista e a esposa é comerciante ha mais de 21 anos e tem uma pensão e mais o rendimento da esposa dá cerca de 8.800.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.300.00mt, 17.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt todos  para o comercio. Tambem vende produtos de primeira necessidade no seu estabelecimento.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Silveio was born in Marpanha, in the province of Sofala in central Mozambique. He is married and the father of three adult children. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports three grandchildren, who lives with them.
He left Marpanha for Maputo to find a job. He is retired and his wife has owned a store for more than 21 years. He also has a pension. His wife earns about 8,800 meticals a month, which they use to cover household expenses. They are able to save a little in their bank account each month. He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from coworkers who are also clients of the institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to build a house. His first loans, in the amounts of 10,300, 17,000, and 12,000 meticals, were all used for the business. They also sell staple goods in their store. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house so he can provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up a son and two daughters, all the children study at school. Two years ago with an initial investment of 15000 soms, Damira purchased cattle for breeding. She started this activity in order to earn additional money to meet the family needs. She earns additional 2000 soms per month by selling milk products. In case she needs money, she can sell some animals. At the moment Damira needs additional funds to purchase hay for cattle.  She applies for the loan for this purpose. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 66 years old,  widowed, and has five adult children. She runs a tailoring business, where she makes clothes and provides general clothing alterations to the people in her community. She also makes curtains and bed covers. Each month, Elsa nets  4,000 PHP from her business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cloths, threads, and other tailoring materials. Elsa hopes for her business and living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, threads, and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Lucía De La Cruz

texts.es:
Lucía tiene 46 años vive en la Provincia del Carchi ciudad de Tulcán, que queda en el Norte de Ecuador frontera con  Colombia. Lucía tiene una hija de 15 años con la que vive ya que es una persona divorciada. Lucía es una persona tranquila y bondadosa.

Lucía trabaja sola en la tienda de víveres, empezó desde que se divorció ya que vió la necesidad de sacra adelante a su hija. Es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de Víveres, verduras, frutas para abastecer su negocio, este abastecimiento de productos generará más ingresos a Lucía, que ayudaran a mantener a su hija y que acabe de estudiar.

Su sueño es poder tener un micromercado y ayudar con empleo a las personas que lo necesiten, para que en su casa no les falte el pan de cada día junto con buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía is 46 years old.  She lives in Carchi province, in the city of Tulcán, located in northern Ecuador on the border with Colombia.  She is divorced and has a fifteen year old daughter who lives with her.  Lucía is quiet and good-natured.  

Lucía works alone in a general store.  She began working there after her divorce as she realized that she needed to help her daughter get ahead.  This is her third loan request from Fodemi and she will use the proceeds to purchase food such as vegetables and fruits to stock her store.  Supplying these products will generate more income for Lucía and this will help support her daughter who is finishing her studies.  

Her dream is to own a mini-market and help employ people who need jobs so that they always have a good income and daily bread in their homes.

loans.use: to purchase food such as vegetables and fruits to stock her store.

loans.name: Evie

texts.en:
Evie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Evie is providing motorela or habal-habal services. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Evie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: From Kyenjojo District, Francis is a 39-year-old father of four children between the ages  of 11 and 2, all of whom he wishes to give a good education to. Having inherited land from his father, Francis planted a sugar cane plantation of six acres and started brewing alcohol from the sugar cane.  Now requesting a loan to purchase waragi, a local brew, to resell, he dreams of building a permanent residential house and expanding his business into new areas.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Jessica joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy 26, is a single mother who lives in a family house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is high cost of transport.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to install water pipes in her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to install water pipes in her house.

loans.name: Djoumaî

texts.fr:
Djoumai est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur . Elle a 04 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 07 ans.  
Djoumai travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2004. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison et achète à Lomé. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Djoumai a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des ignames.  Elle veut agrandir l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Djoumai voudrait ajouter d’autres activités telles que la vente de charbons de bois( combustible très utilisé par les femmes togolaise à la cuisine).  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Djoumai is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has four children ranging from 7 to 16 years.  Two of her children attend school.  Djoumai has been working as a grain reseller since 2004.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and sells alone, from home, to her customers.  She has no particular difficulty.  Djoumai has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy grains and yams.  She wants to expand her business.  In the coming years, Djoumai would like to add other activities such as selling charcoal (a fuel commonly used for cooking by women in Togo).  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a poultry farmer living in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been in operation for four years. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

Her main challenges are poultry diseases and the high cost of feeds and drugs. Lydiah would like to diversify to a food canteen and hotel business. She will use the extra income from this business to pay for her children’s education and pay for other household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 56-years-old widowed woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be intelligent and principled. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, rice, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a viable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the retail store. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy  more home products such as sugar, wheat flour, etc. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products such as sugar, wheat flour, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Lidia, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three kids who go to school. She has been running a business called a Genge-Duka (a retail shop providing fruits and vegetables in the same shop) for seven years now. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Lidia's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to improve her Genge and started selling cooking oil. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her Genge and to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, and flours. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Lidia will share this loan with her loan group "Babati," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her Genge-Duka and to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, and flours.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Roda (pictured above) has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in her life. Just to mention one of them, she doesn't have a formal job. But her courage, perseverance, and desire to succeed make her get up every day to work on her poultry business.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 13 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her three children, she has been selling dairy milk, eggs, poultry, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 80,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being an African woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions even more.

The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Roda always thinks and dreams big; that’s why she wants to give the best quality of life to her children. You can help Roda to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jemelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jemelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, and other groceries.

Jemelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the futur, Jemelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. 
He has been engaged in this business for 9 years.
This shop is not his own, he has rented it. 
Having borrowed a loan amount of $400, he started to sell children’s clothes.
For the second time he borrowed a loan amount of $600 
to sell  the children’s clothes and woman’s blouses.
For the third time she borrowed a loan  of $800 to sell blankets.
Now he needs a loan  of $1200 to expand the area of his shop and to increase range of industrial goods.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en: Shahbaz is 57-years old, married, has 5 children. He lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He breeds lambs and cattle, a business he has worked in for 20 years. With his first loan of $400, he bought five lambs and a calf. He is now requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milch cow

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a lonesome divorced woman. Previously, she rented a shop where she sold sweets and different kinds of candies. Now Sharifa conducts her activity between two regions: Istaravshan and Zafarabad. In both regions she has certain clients. To Zafarabad she delivers socks, underwear, and shirts. To Istaravshan she carries dairy produce and eggs.

Sharifa prefers this kind of activity because she is always busy and meets many people. This keeps her from feeling sad.

Her current request is for money to buy goods in cash, which would be cheaper for her.

loans.use: Purchase goods for cash

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio grows vegetables and also works for other vegetable growers. He derives his income from these efforts, with which he supports himself.

He lives in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

He would use the loan to buy a milk cow, to restart the small dairy he had in the past but is currently not in business. He hopes to increase his income by means of this newly restarted business.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan, with which he hopes to enter a new phase as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Gregorio, es pequeño agricultor de hortalizas y realiza trabajo como empleado para otros productores de hortalizas. Sus ingresos provienen de estas actividades con lo que se mantiene. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar – Rió Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca de raza mediana para reactivar la producción de leche que tenia en el pasado, pero que actualmente esta paralizada. Con esta nueva actividad espera mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo y así empezar una nueva etapa como micro-empresario.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa, 50 years old, mother of 2 children owns a small business of wedding and evening dresses renting in the area of Nabaa in Beirut. Sanaa has borrowed 7 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua. This very enthusiastic and dynamic woman has been constantly expanding her business since the first time we met her. She has very nice taste in picking the dresses she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients about the dress they should rent.
Sanaa has been for a long time the main breadwinner of the family. Through her work, not only was she able to help her husband opening a small shop, she did the same for her daughter in helping her opening a small business.
Sanaa needs a loan of USD 1,200 to buy new evening dresses and therefore increase her shop inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of new evening dresses for her small business of wedding and evening dresses renting

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: Muhayo H.  rents a stall in the market in the Ovchikalacha region in Khujand. Her business a candy store. She is married and has 2 children. She has3 years' experience in this line of work . Her stand is profitable and the turnover of her working capital is fast. She buys her goods from supplies from Uzbekistan, making her purchases three times a month. Presently she wants to spend her loan for her next purchase of candies so as to expand her inventory.

loans.use: expanding her inventory to increase her turnover

loans.name: Claudia Janet

texts.es:
Mrs. R.'s clothing shop is favorably located on one of the main streets of Lourdes. She sells men's and women's clothing. A very entrepreneurial woman, she started her business with very little but has built it up steadily such that it now serves to support her family. At this time she needs to invest in more merchandise.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. R. tiene su negocio en una de las calles mas principales de Lourdes ,ella vende pantalones para caballero y damas y ropa de todos los estilos, necesita invertir mas por la temporada y algo que le favorece es tener una buena ubicación en el negocio es muy propicio para que se vendan los productos en los cuales quiere invertir ,la señora es muy emprendedora , su negocio lo inicio con poco y hasta la fecha lo a ido incrementado paulatinamente, de este negocio obtiene los fondos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia, ya que dependen directamente de ese ingreso que obtiene de las ventas .

loans.use: Buying t shirts, trousers and underwear to sell at the Lourdes market.

location.town: 3ra Calle poniente casa numero 3 lourdes Colon , l

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: T. Ilhom lives in the Nausky region and he is married with 2 children. He is the client of the MicroInvest since 2004 that recommends him as a motivated client.  He is engaged in the home business of livestock raising and sale. He is experienced in this business because has been engaged in this business since his early years when he helped his father. His wife also helps out in this business.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a bull.

loans.use: for the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Dorice W.. She is married and has two children, aged three months and nine.

In 2002, Dorice established a crafts business selling carvings. Working alone, she earns about TZS 145 per month from this business. Dorice has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $25. In the future, Dorice also plans to open another a business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
R. Gulomjon was born in 1985 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. Now, he is a businessman who sells men's clothing and shoes.

He first applied to MicroInvest in 2004, when he heard about their successful business history from his brother. He applied to MicroInvest so that he could structure the business terms to bring him a permanent business income. He has a good assortment of clothing and many repeat customers.

Mr. R. Gulomjon has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ for 6 months to expand his store.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Quetzal 1 Group

texts.es:
Veronica del Rocio is 23 years of age. She has been selling cosmetics for a living for 8 years. She was only able to attend primary school because her parents asked her to help cover the household expenses due to the lack of financial resources. She would like to purchase more cosmetics catalogues and merchandise with this loan, so that she can sell her products to everybody in town. The other members of the group are: Cristina S. V., who raises and sells pigs; Martha V. G., who sells clothing; and Candelaria G., who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

VERONICA DEL ROCIO TINEN 23 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS DE CASA EN CASA, UNICAMENTE PUDO ESTUDIAR LA PRIMARIA YA QUE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS SUS PADRES LE PIDIERON APORTARA DINERO A LA CASA, CON LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS ELLA AYUDA AL GASTO FAMILIAR, CON EL CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MAS FOLLETOS DE COSMENTICO Y COMPRAR MUCHA MERCANCIA PARA OFRESER A TODA LA GENTE DEL PUEBLO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. CRISTINA S. V. CRIA PUERCOS PARA VENDERLOS, MARTHA V. G. VENDE ROPA Y CANDELARIA G. G. VENDE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Consesa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consesa M. is a single mother of 3 small children, whose ages are 9, 7, and 6 years old, respectively. She has a convenience store that allows her to obtain earnings to feed and support her children in their studies. The loans that she has received have allowed her to improve her financial situation and have improved her quality of life, both for herself and her family. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business and increase her inventory in order to grow and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Consesa M. es madre soltera, con 3 hijos, los cuales todavia son menores de edad, uno tiene 9, 7 y 6 años respectivamente; su negocio principal es una pulperia que le permite tener ingresos para alimentar a sus hijos y brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. Los creditos que ha recibido le han ayudado a mejorar su situacion economica y ha levantado el nivel de vida, tanto de su familia como el de ella misma. Solicita este credito ya que necesita invertir mas en su negocio y reforzar su inventario para poder crecer en la inversion y agrandar su actividad economica.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start selling costume jewelry in her community.

loans.name: Sreyry

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyry N. and her husband Chheang Nhean are subsistence farmers who raise pigs and cows in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children. Three of their children attend school. The other two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sreyry N. now has insufficient money to buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Previously, Mrs. Sreyry N. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike for transport purposes. Last year, some of Mrs. Sreyry N.’s children got dengue fever and she spent $500 to cure them. This is one of the reasons that Mrs. Sreyry N. does not have enough money to buy animal food. Mrs. Sreyry N. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is an exemplary young man and very responsible. From a young age, it was obvious that he was an enterprising and hard-working guy. Since he didn't go on to university to finish his studies, he decided to start a taxi business with the goal of saving enough to resume his studies in the future. Unfortunately, some weeks ago, he was robbed of his radio transmitter, an important device for communicating with his customers and fellow cab drivers because it facilitates better and faster service for his customers and greater security for him. This young entrepeneur now needs a loan to continue developing his business with the enthusiasm, pleasure and security that he had before.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hugo es un hijo ejemplar y muy responsable, desde niño demostró ser un muchacho emprendedor y laborioso, al ver que no ingresó a la universidad para seguir estudios superiores, decidió dedicarse a brindar servicio de taxi a la población de su zona, con los beneficios que obtiene desea ahorrar lo suficiente para más adelante, cubrir los gastos de sus estudios superiores.Desafortunadamente hace algunas semanas sufrió el robo de su radio transmisor, importante aparato de comunicación que utiliza con sus clientes y compañeros taxistas para un mejor y rápido servicio a sus clientes y sobre todo mayor seguridad para su persona.Este emprendedor joven, en estos momentos requiere de un préstamo para seguir desenvolviéndose en su trabajo con el mismo entusiasmo, alegría y seguridad de siempre.

loans.use: Buy radio equipment for taxi business.

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es: Dolores es una joven de 24 años de edad, labora en un instituto de educación, desempeñándose como docente de ecuación primaria, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 meses, por la que debe luchar muy duro ya que todos los gastos familiares recaen sobre ella. Vive la casa de su familia y son ellos quienes le apoyan con el cuido de la menor, desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar ya que apoya a su familia, y ahora tiene que mantener a su pequeña hija. Mientras está trabajando su madre cuida del bebé. Actualmente el techo de su casa de habitación está en muy malas condiciones, y las lluvias les están afectando mucho, es por eso que solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y así asegurar la salud de su familia sobre todo la de su bebé, ya que la casa está húmeda y cuando llueve tienen que estar pendientes de que no se mojen los bienes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 24 year old young woman, she works in school as an elementary teacher. She is a single mother and has a 6 month old daughter, for whom she works very hard as meeting all the household expenses fall to Dolores. She lives in her family's home and they support her by taking care of her daughter. She has worked ever since she was young to support her family, and now she has to support her small daughter also. While she works her mother watches the baby. Today the roof of their home is in poor condition. Rain is affecting them a lot, and therefore she is seeking a loan to change their home's roof and thereby ensure her family's, and above all her daughter's, health. Their home is very humid an dwhen it rains they have to be careful that their belongings do not get wet.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling clothing, beauty products and other goods.

loans.name: Norma Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Norma Marcela López R. tiene 43 años , pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II, vive en la Avenida 28 de Julio Mz.1F lote 134 del distrito Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no siguió estudiando porque se fue a vivir con su pareja desde los 17años, actualmente tienen 2 hijos varones que ya trabajan y una hija mujer que todavía tiene 9 años y estudia primaria.
Norma confecciona y vende calzado de acuerdo a la estación, lo hace en Florencia de Mora y luego va a vender en Casa Grande. Ahora como ya se acerca la época de verano confecciona sandalias.
Con el primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compro diversos materiales que se utilizan en la confección, por ejemplo; pegamento, plantillas y cuero sintético.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará material como, cueros, pegamento, plantas, etc.
Norma sueña con terminar toda su casa y tener un gran taller.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Marcela López R. is 43 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II (God Guides Our Steps II). She lives at Avenida 28 de Julio Mz.1F lote 134, district Florencia de Mora, province Trujillo, department of La Libertad Perú. She finished secondary school completely, but she didn’t continue studying because she was lived with her partner since she was 17. At the moment they have 2 boys who are already working and one daughter who is currently 9 years old and is studying in primary school. Norma makes and sells footwear at the station. She does this in Florencia de Mora and later she goes to sell at Casa Grande. Now she is close to the time of summer, when she will make sandals. With her first loan of 300 soles, that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought various materials that she used in her craft, for example glue, insoles, and synthetic leather. With this loan of 500 soles that she would repay in 4 installments she would buy materials like leather, glue, insoles, etc. Norma dreams of finishing her house and to have a big workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for shoemaking

loans.name: Jiguisèmè (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Jiguisèmè toutes des voisines et évoluant dans le même secteur économique, résident dans le village de Yangasso (préfecture de San quatrième région administrative du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec les coépouses, les beaux parents et autres parents du conjoint.
Depuis maintenant deux ans elles collaborent avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso lequel leur a déjà octroyer trois prêts de groupe tous correctement remboursés. Avec ce quatrième elles comptent acheter, des habits, des parures à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et Koutiala auprès des grossistes du domaine. Quant aux chaussures elles sont importées du Burkuna Faso. 
Elles effectuent leurs ventes au marché et de façon ambulante dans le village, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. Chacune des membres de ce groupe espèrent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice cycle qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Elles ambitionnent ouvrir une boutique à Yangasso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Jiguisèmè group, all of them neighbors and coming from the same economic sector, live in the village of Yangasso (prefecture of San, fourth administrative region of Mali). They have an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children, and they live in traditional families with their co-spouses, parents-in-law, and other relatives of their husbands.

For two years now they have been working with the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso which has already given them three group loans which have been correctly reimbursed. With their fourth loan, they intend to buy clothing and costume jewelry in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and in Koutiala from wholesalers who sell these sorts of goods. As for shoes, those are imported from Burkina Faso.

They do their selling in the market and door-to-door in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele constituted essentially of women. Each of the members of the group hopes to make an average of 100,000 F CFA of profit per cycle, which will be used to help cover family expenses. Their ambition is to open a little shop in Yangasso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing, costume jewelry, and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Bushra Shaheen Noor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Bushra shaheen baji is a 34 year old woman who resides in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 4 years. Her husband's name is N. A. and he is a fruit seller by profession and has been selling fruits for the past 2 years. Bushra baji has no children. She stays at home and embroiders dresses. This work gives her a reward in shape of money. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business.

She is the leader of a group with a few more women. Shamim baji and Shazia baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling businesses. Sharfan baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier acaba de cumplir 30 años, lleva conviviendo con su pareja aproximadamente 12 años, su esposa y sus 3 hijos viven en la casa de su madre, vivienda que cuidan porque su madre vive en otra ciudad. Desde que migraron sus padres a otra ciudad se quedó ha cargo de todas las chacras, pero por falta de capital no puede sembrar como la hacia su padre, en grandes cantidades, pero tiene la ilusión de ir incrementando cada vez más sus cultivos de papa y arvejas.  Cultivar papa en esta temporada es muy bueno, pero como se ha elevado el precio de los fertilizantes ha sembrado solo 10 sacos de semilla, en esta próxima siembra sembrará 20 sacos, paralelo a acaba de sembrar una bolsa y media de arvejas, y ha guardado semilla para su otra chacra que va preparar, porque estos granos guardados mucho tiempo no producen bien. A Javier le agrada su actividad, la cual depende de las fechas en que siembran y cultivan para cosechar buenos frutos y sobre todo para que puedan tener buen precio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y ha juramentado en el cargo de secretario del banco comunal al que pertenece, comprometiendo a cumplir fielmente con todas las actividades, asimismo a incentivar que los demás socios efectúen los pagos en las fechas exactas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas y abono para la chacra de papa que tiene sembrada.

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella T. is a pig grower. She raises pigs because she enjoys the work. Aside from that, she thinks that raising pigs is a profitable business. Because of her pigs, she has money to spend for her daily needs.  She is 52 years old. Three of her 6 children are already married and the others are still studying. Her husband, a farmer, is the one who manages their small parcel of land. Bella wants to help her husband so she raises pigs to contribute to the family income.

She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Specifically, the money will go to pay for 3 sacks of starter, grower and finisher mash. In this way, she will have healthier jumbo pigs to sell in the market.

CEVI sustains their clients' businesses. They give their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Uzma Parveen M. Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Uzma parveen baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last five years. Uzma baji is married to M. S. and he has a business making and selling car seats.  He has been making these for the last three years. Uzma baji is involved in an embroidery business. She does this work to pay off the school fees for her three sons. Uzma baji is applying for a loan to buy material (plastic sheets and thread) to make more car seats to sell.

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Nadia baji wants a loan to buy repair tools for her workshop. Abida parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shakeela Fatima baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make car seats

loans.name: Soo

texts.en:
Soo P., 69, is widowed with seven children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. Soo sells to village people and the general public three days a week.

She has five previous loans with SPBD. Soo expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145). South Pacific Business Development loans are Soo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvements.

loans.use: Support plantation business and help improve home.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene 50 años de edad, vende fritanga desde hace diez años, anteriormente tenia una pulpería pero cambio de domicilio y le fue mal en la venta y ahora logro poner  su fritanga, su esposo es albañil y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad. Este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por que ha sido parte de su desempeño en su negocio para salir adelante, con este crédito va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción y construir un muro en la parte de atrás de su casa para una mejor seguridad para su familia. Sus planes es poder aumentar su inventario para vender mas sus carnes asadas que se vende bastante, también desea ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is 50-years-old and has sold fried foods for ten years. Before that, she had a small store in her home, but moved to a new house and sales dropped. She has now been able to set up her fried food business. Her husband works in construction. They have two children, who are six and fourteen-years-old. This is her eighth cycle in Afodenic, to whom she is grateful because they have been part of her efforts to get ahead in her business. With the loan money she will invest in the purchase of construction materials and will build a wall in the back part of her house to provide more security for her family. Her plans are to be able to increase her inventory so she can sell more of her roasted meat, which she sells a lot of. She would also like to help her children be able to study.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un muro en la parte de atras

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ludy L. is 41 years old, residing at Gango, Ozamiz City with 2 children, and her husband is a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver in the City of Ozamiz. She is a new member of PMPC and joined the Co-op because of programs and services that she admires a lot.

Her little "sari-sari" (variety) store started up 2 years ago and it became a great help in bringing income to her family. As of this time, she is applying for a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 as additional capital to purchase grocery items for her "sari-sari" store.

Her future plan is to be able to expand her grocery store and to send her children to college.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Sari-sari" store

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa de 46 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con la Sr. Jorge  de 43 años de edad quien trabaja como empleado en el Hospital Nacional de Itauguá  y con quien tuvo 3 hijos: Ramón de 28 años, Marilyn de 17 años, quien  se encuentra cursando el tercer año técnico en informática, y Marcos de 15 años quien cursa el primer año de la Media.
María Teresa cuenta con un copetín que hoy día reúne a una cantidad interesante de clientes.
Comenta que abrió su negocio hace un poco más de un año  ya que  los ingresos de su marido no alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos.
  Con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy en día cuenta con un copetín donde la misma trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno eléctrico en donde podrá hornear todo tipo de alimentos, además de surtir mejor su negocio en cuanto a bebidas y otros alimentos en General.
texts.en:
María Teresa is a 46 years old businesswoman and is married to 43 year old Jorge who works as an employee in the Itauguá National Hospital and with whom she has 3 children: 28 year old Ramon, 17 year old Marilyn who is finishing 3rd year of computer studies, and 15 year old Marcos who is completing his first year in media studies. María Teresa has a small snack bar where a number of interesting clients gather daily. She opened her business a little over a year ago as her husband’s income didn’t completely cover the household expenses and the children’s schooling expenses. With great effort and help from the entire family she has able to be successful and today she has her snack bar where she works with the objective of improving the quality of life for her family. She seeks a loan to buy an electric stove where she will be able to make all kinds of dishes, in addition to stock her business with beverages and food items in general.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an electric stove and merchandise such as meat, soda pop, beer, and more

loans.name: Vosid

texts.en:
A. Vosid is 45 years old. He is married with 4 children. Vosid is running his own café where he cooks shish kebab. His café is located in one of the markets of Istaravshan town. He has been in this business already for 8 years. On average he serves 20-25 customers a day. His wife and daughter help him with the business.

Vosid is trying to use only the best ingredients in his café. Thus the business is stable and brings in considerable income for the family. Vosid requests 800 US Dollars to purchase meat and charcoal for his café for cooking shish kebab. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Vosid wants to thank everyone who is supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing meat and charcoal for his café

loans.name: Olasanyi

texts.en: S. is 44 years old, married and has three children. She is a committed LAPO client. She is a seamstress and also sells clothing materials. She has been in business for eight years and needs a loan of NGN50,000 to purchase more clothing materials to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Бобочонова  имеет небольшой продуктовый и вещевой магазин, также в ассортименте  товара  имеются сигареты и спички.  В настоящее время сезон летней одежды , мороженного и холодных напитков.  Она  торгует недалеко от института , где каждый день проходят много студентов и покупают у нее напитки и мороженное. Кредит необходим для покупки мужской одежды .
texts.en:
Firuza B. has a small food and clothing store. Her product assortment also includes cigarettes and matches. Now is the season for summer clothing, ice-cream and cold drinks. She sells not far from a university; so many students pass by her store every day and buy drinks and ice-cream from her. Firuza needs a loan in order to purchase men’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's clothing

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano, se conformó en fecha 20 de marzo del 2009, gracias a que la Directora General, la Sra. Basilia B. que se dedica a la venta de frutas, se informó del Programa gracias a la presidenta de otro grupo que era su vecina y la misma la invitó a formar su propio grupo, la misma contactó con la asesora informándose aun mas con respecto al programa y  de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya pasando al 2do ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de   429.411 Gs. lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de bebidas, venta de carbón, venta de frutas, venta, venta de bijouterie, venta de medicamentos, venta de comestibles, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y demuestran espíritu de trabajo en equipo.
Con el crédito comprarán: mercaderías para la despensa como arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc. Compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comestibles carne, harina, huevos, condimentos, etc., compra de carbón , bebidas, frutas, bijouterie, compra de CDs, medicamentos para  farmacia, compra de ropas, mercería en general.
texts.en:
The group of women called San Cayetano was formed on March 20, 2009, thanks to its general director, señora Basilia B., who sells fruits. She found out about the program thanks to the president of another group, who was her neighbor. She invited her to form her own group, and she contacted an advisor to get more information about the program and the work that Mujeres Emprendedoras does. Once she had all of the information, she succeeded in bringing together 17 working women, who are now on their second loan. They work together in a supportive manner. The average credit that will be loaned to each member is 429.41 guaranís, which will go towards different activities like selling beverages, charcoal, fruit, trinkets, medicine, food, etc. All of them carry out these activities to make money, and they help each other to reach their common objectives that they have with Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in their weekly meetings and demonstrate a spirit of teamwork. With this credit, they will buy merchandise for a grocery store like rice, sugar, mate, dairy products, bread, soft drinks, etc. They will also buy ingredients to prepare food like meat, flour, eggs, condiments, etc. And they will buy charcoal, beverages, fruit, trinkets, CDs, medicines, clothing, and general merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, mate, dairy products, bread, soft drinks, meat, flour, eggs, condiments, charcoal, fruit, beverages, trinkets, medicine, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (19,16.13.4) años de edad, ella es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, la socia se instaló en el mirador de Taray, ella hay vende sus artesanías a los turistas que bajan a tomar fotos desde el mirador aprovechando que tienen una hermosa vista del valle sagrado y los nevados, ella solicita el préstamo en razón de invertir en los insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” (Lord of Agony of Taray), which is located in the district of Taray, an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 19, 16, 13, and 4).

Martha divides her time between performing household chores and making handicrafts. Her vending post is situated near the “Mirador de Taray” (a view overlooking the Sacred Valley of the Incas), where she sells her handicrafts to tourists who come to take photographs of the landscape. From the Mirador, one can see the beautiful view of the Sacred Valley and the snow-capped mountains.

Martha is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies used in making her handicrafts. She acknowledges and appreciates the help provided through her loan and agrees to complete her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making handicrafts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells drinks and snacks in her shop. Elizabeth lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Elizabeth is very happy with the growing nature of her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Amalia M. Pérez, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es  madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. La señora Amalia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general,  por lo que todos los días por la mañana se prepara por lo que tiene que alistar los productos que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Por lo que aprovecho esta oportunidad como un medio para incrementar sus ingresos. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de más mercaderías principalmente ropa y cosméticos ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos y desea aprovechar. Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado de Managua. Ella posee el sueño de seguir creciendo en su negocio de tal forma que algún día realice mejoras a su vivienda que le permitan vivir de una forma más cómoda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: plowing her land and buying fertilizer

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre D. siete hijos, D. los cuales cinco son mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. menús (comida), su restaurante está ubicado en el centro D. esta localidad, en este negocio trabaja junto a una D. sus hijas, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él es agricultor. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al 2000” desD. hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, dinero que invirtió en artículos para su bodega.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 1200 soles, que será utilizado para comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes al por mayor. La meta D. Bertha es tener un local propio para su restaurante, ya que el que tiene es alquilado.
texts.en:
Bertha is a dynamic, cooperative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and the mother of seven children, of whom five are grown. She works selling meals in her restaurant which is located in the center of the town. In this business she works with one of her daughters and counts on the help of her husband who works in agriculture. She has been part of the Community Bank "Women of 2000" for two years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, money she invested in articles for her storeroom. Currently she needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be used to buy rice, sugar, and meat at wholesale. Bertha's goal is to have her own location for her restaurant since she rents the place she has now.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and meat at wholesale

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is A. K., son of A. Rahim. He is a 34-year-old married father of three sons and one daughter. He is living with his whole family, including his father and mother, in the Behsood district.

When he found information about AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company), he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to expand his business. He has a butcher shop in the city of Jalalabad and he wants to supports his family.

loans.use: To buy animals for his butcher shop

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is married with six children. She lives Ntaricon, Cameroon. Marie and her entire family are currently living in a house with five rooms. Marie had to overcome some difficult challenges in her life, such as inadequate funding to pay her children's school fees, bad produce from farms and ill health. This has made life tough for Marie.

Marie currently sells shoes and poultry to make a living. She is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes and chickens for resale. This would be Marie's third loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2007. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business, and her reasonable prices. Also with experience, she is now having good profits from her business.

Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication when ever they are sick.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: The purchase of shoes, chickens and livestock feed for resale

loans.name: Koffi Attikpo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un électricien d’équipement et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail  de rouleaux de tuyaux de cuivre, de bouteilles de gaz et d’autres articles.  Son stock a connu une baisse il voudrait  se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter 10 rouleaux de tuyaux de cuivre, 15 bouteilles de gaz,  3 groupes de climatiseurs et divers autres articles. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient  aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is an electrician whose business consists in retailing copper tube rolls, gas bottles, and other items. His stock experienced a drop, and he would like to resupply. This is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 10 copper tube rolls, 15 gas bottles, 3 air-conditioning sets, and various other items. He's married and the father of 2 children. It is with the profits drawn from his business that he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 copper tube rolls, 15 gas bottles, 3 air-conditioning sets, and various other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cereal stocking.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa M. is 42 years old and lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are studying at the local public school.
Mrs. Channa M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops and rice, while her husband, Mr. Chhoeur Cham (shown on the right of the picture), is a chef. On her plantation, Mrs. Channa M. has a problem because her soil is infertile. Therefore, she decided to ask for a third loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of her loan, she will buy rice seeds and dig a well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and dig a well

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yadira S. B. es una ama de casa con 02 hijos en edad escolar ella es casada, y se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de nacatamales y de fritanga, los días de semana ella hace fritanga como es tajada con queso, tacos, enchiladas y los fines de semana hace nacatamales los cuales los vende únicamente sábado y domingo, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus nacatamales como es la carne de cerdo ella quiere comprar un cerdo vivo y ella misma destazarlo y comercializarlo ya que así le saldrá la carne un poco más baja que comprándola por libra, además comprara maíz, y otros productos que lleva los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Yadira is a housewife with two children of school age. She is married and she has a business making food similar to tamales and fried foods. On week days she makes fried food which is shared with cheese, tacos, and enchiladas and at the weekend she makes tamales which she sells only on Saturday and Sunday. She requests a loan to buy raw materials such as pork for making her tamales. She wants to buy a pig and butcher and market it herself as this will make the meat a little less expensive than if she buys it by the pound. She will also buy and other products that are in tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tamales

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old mother of four who operates a tailoring business in Kariobangi. She earns extra income by farming. She has been in business for 15 years and describes her business environment as competitive. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add a stock of fabric to her business. Jane hopes to open more outlets and increase her investment. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: At 61, Leonita R. still wants to be active in her business. She is a  rice farmer. She is married and has an only child who is now 27 years old. Leonita  has been farming since 1980 and continues to do so because it provides income for her family. She recently joined CEVI to expand her business opportunities. Leonita is asking for a loan PHP6,000. The loan will be used for farm supplies like seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sovannary
